commentary.comment: Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Maximilian Sauer (Braunschweig) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and can count himself very lucky that the referee didn't issue a red card.
Christoffer Nyman (Braunschweig) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Koen Casteels.
A yellow card for a tackle by Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
What a big chance! Ken Reichel (Braunschweig) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) gets inside the penalty area and sends a powerful shot that almost ends inside the net. The keeper is alert and makes a good save.

Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the top left corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 0:1.
Substitution. Onel Hernandez (Braunschweig) in, Jan Hochscheidt out.
Torsten Lieberknecht decides to make a substitution. Patrick Schonfeld (Braunschweig) will be replaced by Nguyen Trung Dai Duong.
Substitution. Vieirinha makes his way off the pitch and Ashkan Dejagah (Wolfsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Tobias Stieler shows the yellow card to Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) for a heavy challenge.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Daniel Didavi walks off the pitch to be replaced by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).
Torsten Lieberknecht has decided to substitute Salim Khelifi and he is replaced by Phillip Tietz (Braunschweig).
RED CARD! Maximilian Sauer (Braunschweig) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Tobias Stieler. He can have an early bath.
Philipp Wollscheid (Wolfsburg) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) misses a big chance! He fires the ball high over the crossbar from inside the 6-yard box after the ball rebounded to him.
Mario Gomez goes off the pitch and Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg) comes on.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Ken Reichel (Braunschweig) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Mirko Boland (Braunschweig) has a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better as his effort ends wide of the left post.
The players claim that Gustav Valsvik (Braunschweig) handled the ball inside the box and it seems they are right. The referee points to the penalty spot. Wolfsburg are awarded a penalty kick!
Gustav Valsvik (Braunschweig) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) fires the penalty into the right side of the net!
Maximilian Sauer (Braunschweig) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Paul Ntep de Madiba is replaced by Vieirinha (Wolfsburg).
Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) receives a harsh yellow card from the referee after committing a minor foul on his opponent.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Christoffer Nyman as he is replaced by Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig).
Torsten Lieberknecht has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Patrick Schonfeld (Braunschweig) replacing Quirin Moll.
Domi Kumbela just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Hendrick Zuck (Braunschweig) replaces him.
Andries Jonker decides to make a substitution. Josuha Guilavogui will be replaced by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).
Ashkan Dejagah (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Daniel Didavi.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
The foul by Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Wolfgang Stark.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Daniel Heuer Fernandes is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to B. Monchengladbach.

Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the left post. Daniel Heuer Fernandes guesses his intentions and denies him with a fine save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to B. Monchengladbach.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) struck from medium range. He buried the ball inside the right post.
Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Daniel Heuer Fernandes pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Substitution. Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt) on for Jan Rosenthal.
Gooal! Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt) scores with a shot from inside the box after latching onto a headed pass from Antonio-Mirko Colak. He makes it 1:1.

It's a goal! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) makes it 2:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Jonas Hofmann and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Daniel Heuer Fernandes was helpless.
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Fabian Johnson will be replaced by Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Mahmoud Dahoud leaves the pitch and is replaced by Laszlo Benes (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) has come on for Thorgan Hazard.
Torsten Frings has decided to substitute Antonio-Mirko Colak and he is replaced by Denys Olijnyk (Darmstadt).
Substitution. Jerome Gondorf makes his way off the pitch and Silas Zehnder (Darmstadt) comes on as his replacement.
Goal! Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 2:2.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) leaps highest to meet a cross and steers a header towards the right post, but the goalkeeper produces a crucial save to thwart the effort.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) strikes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box and it goes straight inside the left post!
Jerome Boateng is being substituted because of an injury. Carlo Ancelotti sends Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) on the pitch.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) whips a volley from long range towards the goal. His beautiful effort whistles wide of the right post. It was close and it could have been a top class goal!
Tom Starke leaps like a salmon to deny Mike Frantz (Freiburg), whose effort is headed to the underside of the crossbar, but isn't powerful enough to find its way into the back of the net.
Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom left corner, but Tom Starke pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Alexander Schwolow, who pulls off a stunning save!
The foul by Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jochen Drees.

Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) finds himself some space just outside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Tom Starke pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going into the bottom right corner. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Freiburg.
Bayern Munich have a goal ruled out for offside!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Janik Haberer trots off the pitch and is replaced by Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) wastes a promising chance! He tries his luck with a shot from mid-range, but his effort hits the crossbar! A few inches lower and it could have been a sweet goal!

Tom Starke can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Nils Petersen (Freiburg). The ball would have probably ended up in the middle of the net.
Christian Streich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Julian Schuster (Freiburg) replacing Mike Frantz.
Goal! Arjen Robben slips it to Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom right corner with a great effort. The score is 2:0.
Goal Nils Petersen (Freiburg)! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) was put through by Vincenzo Grifo and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom right corner. 2:1.
It's time for a substitution. Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) comes on in place of Xabi Alonso.
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to substitute Philipp Lahm and he is replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Havard Kallevik Nielsen (Freiburg) is coming onto the pitch as Aleksandar Ignjovski cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Arjen Robben is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot which bounces in off the left post to make the score 3:1.
GOAL! Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) scores with a header from close range after Robert Lewandowski headed a pin-point lofted cross into his path. It's 4:1.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) finds himself some space inside the box and gets on the end of the corner. He lashes the ball towards the left post, but Felix Wiedwald pulls off an amazing save to thwart him.
Goal! Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 0:1.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Sokratis (Dortmund) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) picks up a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that crashes against the bar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) unleashes a decent shot towards the roof of the net, but Felix Wiedwald thwarts him with a nice save. Dortmund force a corner. They send men into the box.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Shinji Kagawa, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:1.

This was a piece of cake for Felix Wiedwald. Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went low to the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper. Good work from Dortmund as they win a corner.

An absolutely sensational volley by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund). He took a shot from inside the penalty area and the ball went in just under the crossbar. All credit to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), excellent finish.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Theodor Gebre Selassie comes off for Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen).
Thomas Tuchel has made a change at the break. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) has come on in place of Erik Durm.
Goal - 2:2! Max Kruse laid the ball off to Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Gunter Perl after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) gets a yellow card.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) was quite harsh and Gunter Perl didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
GOAL! Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Roman Burki, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 2:3.

Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads towards the top right corner, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him. Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick.

Marc Bartra (Dortmund) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the roof of the net, but Felix Wiedwald pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Nuri Sahin will be replaced by Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund).
Alexander Nouri has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) replacing Florian Grillitsch.

Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) makes a reckless foul in order to win the ball from his opponent. Gunter Perl has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle. The referee blows his whistle and awards Dortmund a penalty after chaos inside the box.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) takes the penalty and perfectly sends the ball inside the right post.

Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper leaps from the ground and makes a stunning save. The ball goes out of play. Dortmund are awarded a corner kick.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
The manager makes a subsitution with Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) coming on for Lamine Ludovic Sane.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund).
Referee Gunter Perl sees the trip by Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to Dortmund.
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Gunter Perl ignores the protests.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) fires the penalty inside the left post.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ousmane Dembele departs the field of play to be replaced by Sven Bender (Dortmund).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity from the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to release a low effort which ends up in the bottom right corner.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Felix Brych after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.

The ball hits the back of the net! Emil Forsberg delivers the corner, Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) finds himself some space on the edge of the box to unleash an unstoppable shot. His effort goes into the bottom right corner and past the helpless goalkeeper. 0:2.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Taleb Tawatha will be replaced by Jesus Vallejo (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) pounced on a rebound on the edge of the box and his shot goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Ralph Hasenhuttl prepares a substitution. Oliver Burke is replaced by Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming onto the pitch as Guillermo Varela cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) is punished with the yellow card.
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Branimir Hrgota.
A substitution has been made. Yussuf Poulsen goes off and Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) comes on.

It's a goal! Bastian Oczipka plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Jesus Vallejo (Eintracht Frankfurt). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:2.
Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Goal - 2:2! Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the top right corner. Bastian Oczipka provided an assist for the goal.
Felix Brych is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Martin Schmidt is forced to make a change. Leon Balogun is unable to continue due to injury, Alexander Hack (Mainz) comes on.
Robert Hartmann shows the yellow card to Konstantin Rausch (1. FC Koln) for a heavy challenge.
Jonas Hector (Koln) scores a lucky goal from mid-range. Although his low shot was struck towards the middle of the goal, the goalkeeper was unable to reach the ball.
Today's referee Robert Hartmann rightly decides to book Stefan Bell (Mainz) for his harsh tackle.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Robert Hartmann starts the second half.
It's time for a substitution. Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) comes on in place of Robin Quaison.
The foul by Lukas Klunter (1. FC Koln) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Hartmann.
We are about to witness a substitution. Levin Oztunali (Mainz) is replacing Niko Bungert.
Peter Stoger has decided to make a change. Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) replaces Leonardo Bittencourt.

Yuya Osako (Koln) strikes the ball towards goal after latching onto a defence-splitting pass on the edge of the penalty box and his shot sails inside the right post to leave the goalkeeper completely stranded!
Here comes a substitution. Salih Ozcan (Koln) is brought on as a substitute for Yuya Osako.
Here is a change. Milos Jojic is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Christian Clemens (1. FC Koln).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom left corner. Christian Mathenia has a clear sight of it makes a comfortable save. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Wolfsburg will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg) finds himself some space just outside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Christian Mathenia pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going into the top left corner. The linesman points to the corner flag, Wolfsburg are going to take it.

It's in the back of the net! Sebastian Jung sends a superb cross into the box. Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header into the top left corner, leaving Christian Mathenia beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) for a heavy challenge.
Goal! Lewis Holtby produces a great pass that finds Filip Kostic (Hamburger) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) blows an opportunity as he sends a rebound from just outside of the box narrowly wide of the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Andries Jonker gives a chance to Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) and Jakub Blaszczykowski is off.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) is given a yellow card.
We are about to witness a substitution. Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) is replacing Nicolai Muller.
The substitution is prepared. Bakery Jatta (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Albin Ekdal.
Andries Jonker prepares a substitution. Sebastian Jung is replaced by Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg).
Booking. Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) receives a caution from the referee.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch so that Yunus Malli can be given a rest.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) for Lewis Holtby.

Filip Kostic sends a superb cross into the box. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the top right corner, leaving Koen Casteels beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:1.
Today's referee Manuel Grafe rightly decides to book Koen Casteels (Wolfsburg) for his harsh tackle.
Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) is cautioned by the referee.
Manuel Grafe is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.

OFF THE POST! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the right post! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Goal! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:1.
Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he drags his effort wide of the left post.
Today's referee Deniz Aytekin rightly decides to book Allan Allan (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin), whose header flies narrowly wide of the right post.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. His dangerous effort is blocked by Rune Jarstein, who makes a glorious save! The ball goes out for a corner. Bayer Leverkusen can continue in their attacking effort.

Chicharito produces a killer pass to release Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen), who then unleashes a low drive from the edge of the box and scores! The ball goes in off the right post, leaving the goalkeeper stranded. 0:2!
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
It's in the back of the net! Julian Brandt picks out Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 0:3.
The end of the first half.
Referee Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle to start the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Pal Dardai probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of John Brooks. He is replaced by Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin).
Here is a change after the half-time break. Allan Allan is replaced by Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin).
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Rune Jarstein is alert and denies him.
Dangerous play by Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin). Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle for a foul. The referee makes the call - penalty to Bayer Leverkusen!
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) smartly converts the penalty into the top of the net. The spot kick is too good for the goalkeeper.
It is time for a substitution. Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) is on for Alexander Esswein.
Tayfun Korkut prepares a substitution. Wendell is replaced by Danny da Costa (Bayer Leverkusen).
Goal! The rebound fell to Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:4.
Substitution. Stefan Kiessling makes way for Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen).
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) gets his head on the corner, but he sees his header blocked.
Substitution. Chicharito did his best and is replaced by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen).
Deniz Aytekin couldn't ignore the rough tackle by Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) and blew his whistle. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) scores from the penalty spot with a shot that goes inside the right post. How easy is that!
Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) was too forceful with his tackle and Deniz Aytekin interrupted the game to signal a free kick. That is a penalty kick for Hertha Berlin.
Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Bernd Leno to move before rolling the ball into the middle of the goal!

The ball hits the back of the net! Danny da Costa showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) gets onto the scoresheet by sweetly heading it into the middle of the net – 2:6.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.

A neat pass is well received by Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Hoffenheim will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) uses the wrong choice of words while trying to explain something to the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) is booked for saying more than Marco Fritz was willing to tolerate.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Marco Fritz blows his whistle to start the second half.

Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) picks up a cross inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the right side of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Oliver Baumann, who pulls off a stunning save! The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Augsburg.
Substitution. Konstantinos Stafylidis is replaced by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg).
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Substitution. Mark Uth walks off the pitch and Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Kerem Demirbay and he is replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort rattles the left post! What a shot that was!
That was close by Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.

Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) has a good opportunity as he meets a cross on the edge of the six-yard box and heads it towards the target. One of the defenders stands on the goal line and manages to keep the ball out.
Alfred Finnbogason goes off the pitch and Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) comes on.
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Halil Altintop is replaced by Georg Teigl (Augsburg).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Donis Avdijaj (Schalke) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and sends a low drive past the goalkeeper.
Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Ralf Fahrmann to dive and make a save.
Naldo (Schalke) is penalised for holding. Frank Willenborg signals a set piece. Joy for one side, despair for the other as the referee gives a penalty to Ingolstadt!
Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Ralf Fahrmann to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

What a wasted opportunity by Naldo (Schalke)! He creates himself some space inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the left side of the goal, but Orjan Nyland makes an astonishing save to thwart him. Schalke force a corner. They send men into the box.
Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a great save to deny Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) tackles a bit over-zealously and Frank Willenborg blows for a foul. PENALTY! One of the players from Ingolstadt is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
We have witnessed a sending-off! Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) is given a red card for his dangerous challenge. Frank Willenborg's decision is final.
Penalty saved! Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) sends the penalty towards the left hand side of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a wonderful save to deny him.
Sonny Kittel comes off the pitch to be replaced by Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt).
Here is a change. Donis Avdijaj is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Weston McKennie (Schalke).
Maik Walpurgis has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) replacing Pascal Gross.
It's time for a substitution. Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) comes on in place of Guido Burgstaller.
It is time for a substitution. Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) is on for Roger.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to substitute Coke and he is replaced by Bernhard Tekpetey (Schalke).
Bernhard Tekpetey (Schalke) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Frank Willenborg is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Booking. Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) receives a caution from the referee.

Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Roman Burki is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. Augsburg will take a corner kick.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Julian Weigl leaves the pitch to be replaced by Erik Durm (Dortmund).
Philipp Max (Augsburg) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Roman Burki makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom right corner.
Goal! The rebound fell to Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:0.

Shinji Kagawa produces a sweet pass and picks out Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the middle of the net and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:1!
Great ball in from Ousmane Dembele. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle to start the second half.
What a chance for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball goes inches over the crossbar.
Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Andreas Luthe makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the bottom left corner by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund). Dortmund force their opponents to concede a corner.
The manager makes a subsitution with Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) coming on for Konstantinos Stafylidis.
Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
The substitution has been made. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) has replaced Raphael Guerreiro.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Andreas Luthe dived superbly to block a header by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the left post, but Andreas Luthe pulled off a remarkable save!
The game has come to an end for Jonathan Schmid. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Georg Teigl (Augsburg).
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Matthias Ginter and he is replaced by Sebastian Rode (Dortmund).
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Dong-Won Ji joins the action as a substitute, replacing Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) attempts to convert a cross into a goal, but his promising header from near the penalty spot towards the bottom of the right post is denied by a decent save from Timo Horn. Bayer Leverkusen force their opponents to concede a corner.

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) looks very eager to impress, does well to beat his man and force a cross into the box, where one of his teammates gets his head on the ball, but it's too easy for the keeper. (in this sentence the player crosses and heads his own cross!! So I created a different scenario).
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is obviously very disappointed with his shot from the rebound. He aims exactly at the goalkeeper's gloves. This should have been an easy goal!
Goal! Simon Zoller passes the ball to Milos Jojic (Koln) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Bernd Leno couldn't do anything about it. 0:1.

Timo Horn pulls off a fantastic save! Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header low towards the right post, but the effort is kept out.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) connects with a cross from out wide in the six-yard box, but only plants his header onto the right post.

Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike to the bottom left corner. Timo Horn pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Simon Zoller is replaced by Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln).

CHANCE! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and FC Koln will have a goal kick.

A great individual effort by Lukas Klunter (Koln)! Showcasing his skills, he found his way deep inside the box and produced a low drive which goes straight into the middle of the net. Absolutely amazing!
Peter Stoger has decided to make a change. Marco Hoger (1. FC Koln) replaces Leonardo Bittencourt.
Substitution. Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Aranguiz.

Julian Brandt sends a superb cross into the box. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the right post, leaving Timo Horn beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:2.
Gunter Perl shows a yellow card to Matthias Lehmann (Koln) for his blatant foul.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) for Chicharito.

It's a goal! Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) makes it 2:2. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Kai Havertz and planted his close-range header into the top left corner. Timo Horn was helpless.
Substitution. Konstantin Rausch (Koln) has come on for Milos Jojic.
Substitution. Kai Havertz makes his way off the pitch and Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as his replacement.

Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) wastes a promising chance! He tries his luck with a shot from mid-range, but his effort hits the right post. A few inches to the left and it could have been a sweet goal!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Konstantin Rausch (1. FC Koln) was quite harsh and Gunter Perl didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.

Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) picks up a pass and has an effort from the edge of the box, but Daniel Heuer Fernandes gets down to his right to keep it out. The ball is out of play and Hertha Berlin manage to earn a corner.

A perfect lofted pass from Vladimir Darida finds Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Daniel Heuer Fernandes had no chance of stopping that. 0:1.
Patrick Banggaard (Darmstadt) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post.

Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) outjumps the defence in the centre of the box and connects with the free kick from Marvin Plattenhardt. He sends the ball inside the right post with his towering header and alters the score to 0:2.
Torsten Frings has decided to make a change. Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) replaces Wilson Kamavuaka.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Benjamin Brand blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes just wide of the left post.
Wasted opportunity. Felix Platte (Darmstadt) gets to the rebound inside the box and smashes the ball just wide of the right post.
Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) will replace Alexander Esswein.
Torsten Frings prepares a substitution. Mario Vrancic is replaced by Dominik Stroh-Engel (Darmstadt).
Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) sees a yellow card from Benjamin Brand after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Daniel Heuer Fernandes pulls off a great save to deny Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal.
Substitution. Niklas Stark leaves the pitch and is replaced by Florian Baak (Hertha Berlin).
Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) attempts to discuss the decision with Benjamin Brand, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
Here is a change. Marcel Heller is going off and Torsten Frings gives the last tactical orders to Benjamin Gorka (Darmstadt).
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Arne Maier (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Salomon Kalou cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
Goal! Florian Niederlechner gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 1:0.

What a finish by Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt)! He rises high to get to a rebound and produces a long-range header from inside the box which goes into the roof of the net. The goalkeeper was unable to stop the ball from hitting the net.
The yellow card is received by Florent Hadergjonaj (Ingolstadt).
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.

Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his strike towards the middle of the target as Martin Hansen produces a good save.

Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the middle of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.

Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the bottom right corner. Alexander Schwolow is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save.
The referee signals a substitution. Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) is brought on as a substitute for Onur Bulut.
Roger (Ingolstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
It will be a substitution. Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt) is ready to enter the pitch as Florent Hadergjonaj walks off.
Maik Walpurgis has decided to substitute Roger and he is replaced by Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt).
Substitution. Florian Niederlechner leaves the pitch and is replaced by Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Manuel Gulde (Freiburg) was quite harsh and Bastian Dankert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That's the end of the game for Maximilian Philipp, who is replaced by Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg).
Substitution. Anthony Jung (Ingolstadt) replaces Markus Suttner.
Amir Abrashi (Freiburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.

Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
The foul by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Marco Fritz.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) picks up a pass and has an effort from the edge of the box, but Lukas Hradecky gets down to his right to keep it out. Mainz force a corner. They send men into the box.
Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a perfect cross from Aymen Barkok deep inside the box, and he produces an accurate strike which goes into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:1.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Marco Fritz blows his whistle to start the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Martin Schmidt gives a chance to Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) and Levin Oztunali is off.
Goal! Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:2.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the top right corner of the net.
The ball is whipped in from the free kick and finds the head of Stefan Bell (Mainz), who rises and produces an amazing header inside the right post.
Substitution. Aymen Barkok will be replaced by Max Besuschkow (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Stefan Bell (Mainz) is yellow-carded.
Substitution. Danny Latza (Mainz) has come on for Fabian Frei.
Niko Kovac prepares a substitution. Haris Seferovic is replaced by Guillermo Varela (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header into the top left corner. Excellent finish.
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) is booked.
Substitution. Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) on for Taleb Tawatha.
A yellow card for a tackle by Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Martin Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Robin Quaison (Mainz) replacing Jhon Cordoba.
Bojan Krkic (Mainz) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Marco Fritz ignores the protests.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Max Besuschkow (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a yellow card.

Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a minor foul to interrupt the attacking move of his opponent and is warned by the referee that he will get a yellow card if he does it again. The referee makes the call - penalty to Mainz!
Goal! Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) slams home the penalty with a precise low shot into the bottom right corner.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) picked up a yellow card from referee.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

A perfect lofted pass from Emil Forsberg finds Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the top right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Tom Starke had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
Stefan Ilsanker picks out Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig), who drives a shot just over the crossbar from the edge of the box.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the right post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) zig-zags his way into the box and fires the ball towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a great reaction save to stop the effort.
Bernardo (RB Leipzig) touches the ball with his hand inside the box! That's a penalty to Bayern Munich! They have a good chance to score now.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) fires the penalty into the right side of the net!

Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Tom Starke leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Bernardo (RB Leipzig) wins himself just enough space to meet the corner and shoots. The shot goes towards the bottom right corner, but Tom Starke makes a decent save and thwarts the effort.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches over the top.
Tobias Stieler blows his whistle for a foul after Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) hacks down one of his opponents. The advantage of a penalty kick is given to RB Leipzig.
Today's referee Tobias Stieler rightly decides to book Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) for his harsh tackle.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) gives no chance to the keeper and converts the penalty with a sharp low drive into the left side of the net.
Franck Ribery has picked up an injury and is replaced by Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich).
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) gets a yellow card.
Goal! Emil Forsberg passes the ball to Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Tom Starke couldn't do anything about it. 3:1.
What a huge chance for Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Goal! Nice headed pass by Xabi Alonso to Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich), who latches on to it and puts the ball into the back of the net with a fine header. 3:2.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) for Xabi Alonso.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Tom Starke is just a bystander as the ball flies low into the middle of the goal. The score is 4:2.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) blows a clear opportunity to score as he rattles the right post from point-blank range.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Joshua Kimmich departs the field of play to be replaced by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich).
Ralph Hasenhuttl prepares a substitution. Marcel Sabitzer is replaced by Benno Schmitz (RB Leipzig).
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) has too much to say to the referee and receives a yellow card.
Yussuf Poulsen will be replaced by Davie Selke (RB Leipzig).
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Stieler and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Here is a change. Timo Werner is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Rani Khedira (RB Leipzig).

What a chance that is! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the crossbar!
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is first to latch onto the rebound near the penalty spot, and he produces a fantastic header into the roof of the net.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) scores a goal from the resulting free kick, sending it into the top right corner. What a strike that is, absolutely fantastic!
Goal! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) dribbles into the box then perfectly lifts the ball over the goalkeeper and into the net. He couldn't do anything to stop that cheeky lob. 4:5.
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) receives a yellow card for chasing the referee and shouting at him.
Tobias Stieler is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) rises high to meet a cross from the corner kick and plants a header from inside the penalty area. His effort went just narrowly wide of the left post.
What was Matija Nastasic (Schalke) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Goal – 1:0! Nabil Bentaleb sends a precise lofted pass into the box, Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) rises above the defenders near the penalty spot to meet the ball and heads it straight into the top right corner.

What a chance that is! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the left post!
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) collects a pass and has an effort from 13 metres out, but it flies just wide of the right post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Markus Schmidt has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Yellow card. Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

Ralf Fahrmann receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed towards the right side of the goal.
Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Bobby Wood (Hamburger) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
That will be all from Daniel Caligiuri who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Donis Avdijaj (Schalke).
Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a change. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) replaces Bakery Jatta.
We are about to witness a substitution. Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) is replacing Vasilije Janjicic.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) replacing Klaas-Jan Huntelaar.
The manager makes a subsitution with Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) coming on for Dennis Diekmeier.
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Nabil Bentaleb is replaced by Johannes Geis (Schalke).
Goal! Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) scores after an assist by Lewis Holtby that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:1.
That's it for today, Markus Schmidt has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! Mark Uth slips it to Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom right corner with a great effort. The score is 0:1.
Goal! Adam Szalai displays great vision and sends a pass to Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:2.
Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make. Werder Bremen have a free kick.
Goal - 0:3! Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Pavel Kaderabek provided an assist for the goal.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Fantastic team goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) was set free in the area by Steven Zuber and he made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom left corner. 0:4.
Kerem Demirbay takes over corner duties and expertly finds Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the left side of the goal. The score is now 0:5.
Alexander Nouri decides to make a substitution. Serge Gnabry will be replaced by Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) has come on for Maximilian Eggestein.

Max Kruse produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:5.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) replaces Niklas Sule.

That was a nice football moment. Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the right post. Oliver Baumann guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! Werder Bremen win a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) replaces Mark Uth.
Julian Nagelsmann prepares a substitution. Adam Szalai is replaced by Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim).
Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Thomas Delaney.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
It's 2:5! Robert Bauer feeds Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom left corner.
Goal - 3:5! Philipp Bargfrede tees up Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen) inside the box and he curls the ball into the top left corner and past Oliver Baumann.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort came back off the left post!

Christoph Kramer sends a superb cross into the box. Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Koen Casteels beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg) is penalised.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Christian Dingert starts the second half.
The game is interrupted. Jannes-Kilian Horn (Wolfsburg) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Nico Schulz (B. Monchengladbach).
Goal! Riechedly Bazoer provides Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
Andries Jonker has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg) replacing Paul Ntep de Madiba.
That's the end of the game for Daniel Didavi, who is replaced by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) for Jonas Hofmann.
Here is a change. Ibrahima Traore is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Raffael (B. Monchengladbach).
Nico Elvedi just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) replaces him.
Here we go. The referee makes the decision and the match has to be interrupted due to severe rain.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg) is given a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Fantastic team goal! Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) was set free in the area by Janik Haberer and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the right side of the net. 1:0.
Robert Kampka blows his whistle and signals a foul after Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) brought his opponent down. The referee points to the penalty spot. PENALTY to Freiburg!
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a low shot inside the left post.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Markus Weinzierl decided to make a change. Benjamin Stambouli is replaced by Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke).
Yellow card. Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Evgen Konoplyanka as he is replaced by Donis Avdijaj (Schalke).
Donis Avdijaj (Schalke) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.

Leon Goretzka (Schalke) has a good chance to score with a mid-range attempt after collecting a pass. He aims for the top right corner, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Alexander Schwolow. The referee points to the corner flag and Schalke will take a corner.
That's the end of the game for Maximilian Philipp, who is replaced by Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Close! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) picks up a pass and has an effort from the edge of the box, but Ralf Fahrmann gets down to his right to keep it out.
Substitution. Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) has come on for Florian Niederlechner.
Here is a change. Daniel Caligiuri is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Franco Di Santo (Schalke).
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Ralf Fahrmann is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Christian Streich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) replacing Onur Bulut.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.

Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom left corner is blocked by Christian Mathenia, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom right corner. Christian Mathenia has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Levin Oztunali will be replaced by Jairo Samperio (Mainz).
Markus Gisdol has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Bakery Jatta (Hamburger) replacing Lewis Holtby.
Today's referee Daniel Siebert rightly decides to book Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) for his harsh tackle.
Filip Kostic (Hamburger) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the middle of the target, but Jannik Huth was alert and the score remains the same.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Giulio Donati (Mainz) for a tough tackle.
It is time for a substitution. Fabian Frei (Mainz) is on for Danny Latza.
Daniel Siebert shows the yellow card to Mergim Mavraj (Hamburger) for a heavy challenge.
Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) executes a nice mid-range free kick. His effort only flies inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day.
Substitution. Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) has come on for Aaron Hunt.
Substitution. Yoshinori Muto makes way for Andre Ramalho (Mainz).
Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) comes onto the pitch after Dennis Diekmeier signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.

Goal! Marcel Sabitzer clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), who gets on the end of it and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the right side of the goal. Rune Jarstein had no chance of stopping that. 0:1.

Rune Jarstein hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. It will be a corner kick for RB Leipzig.

Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) latches on to a pass on the edge of the box, but he can't get any power into the shot and fails to trouble Peter Gulacsi. The ball goes out for a corner. Hertha Berlin can continue in their attacking effort.
Marvin Compper (RB Leipzig) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the middle of the target, but Rune Jarstein was alert and the score remains the same. RB Leipzig get a corner.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Robert Hartmann starts the second half.
Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Hartmann ignores the protests.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the middle of the goal, but Rune Jarstein pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Goal! Rune Jarstein makes a huge mistake and Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) has an easy task to put the ball into the back of the net. 0:2.
Pal Dardai has decided to substitute Valentin Stocker and he is replaced by Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin).
Substitution.  Allan (Hertha Berlin) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Per Skjelbred walks off.

Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Hartmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. There is a free kick near the sideline to Hertha Berlin.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee signals a substitution. Rani Khedira (RB Leipzig) is brought on as a substitute for Naby Keita.
A yellow card for a tackle by John Brooks (Hertha Berlin). Robert Hartmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) replacing Yussuf Poulsen.
Here comes a substitution. Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) is brought on as a substitute for Alexander Esswein.
The yellow card is received by Diego Demme (RB Leipzig).
OWN GOAL! The free kick is whipped in and Rani Khedira (RB Leipzig) is unlucky enough to head the ball into his own net. 1:2.
Ralph Hasenhuttl decides to make a substitution. Timo Werner will be replaced by Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig).
Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Rune Jarstein with a low strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 1:3.
Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) goes on a mazy run and finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper. He slots the ball into the middle of the net, leaving the goalkeeper beaten.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Yann Sommer pulls off a great save to deny Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Augsburg force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
What a big chance! Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Bastian Dankert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. What a clinical finish!
It is time for a substitution. Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) is on for Patrick Herrmann.
Here is a change. Halil Altintop is going off and Manuel Baum gives the last tactical orders to Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
The referee signals a substitution. Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) is brought on as a substitute for Laszlo Benes.
That was close by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the right post.
It's a yellow card for Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Nico Elvedi makes way for Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach).
A substitution has been made. Philipp Max is replaced by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg).
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Bastian Dankert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a caution.
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Alfred Finnbogason is replaced by Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach). Ibrahima Traore plays a fantastic through ball and finds Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Guido Winkmann checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Goal - 1:0! Franck Ribery tees up Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) inside the box and he curls the ball into the right side of the net and past Michael Esser.

Michael Esser makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded low towards the middle of the goal by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) after a cross from the side. The linesman makes the right call and Bayern Munich will have a corner.

Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 22 metres out, but it missed the left post by a whisker.
Guido Winkmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better as his effort ends wide of the left post.
We are about to witness a substitution. Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt) is replacing Felix Platte.
Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Guido Winkmann ignores the protests.
A goal, which was scored by Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt), was disallowed due to offside.
Substitution. Mario Vrancic is replaced by Sidney Sam (Darmstadt).
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to substitute Joshua Kimmich and he is replaced by Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich).

Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the underside of the crossbar is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper. The referee blows his whistle, Bayern Munich are awarded a corner kick.
Torsten Frings has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) replacing Wilson Kamavuaka.

Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the left side of the goal, but Tom Starke made a crucial save! It will be a corner kick for Darmstadt.
Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Guido Winkmann blows his whistle for a foul. The referee makes the call - penalty to Darmstadt!
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) was probably a bit loose with his words to Guido Winkmann, who decides to show him a yellow.
Tom Starke anticipates the direction of the penalty by Hamit Altintop (Darmstadt). He attempted to put the ball into the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper was there in time to deny him.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) wasted a clear opportunity. He fired a first-time shot from point-blank range, but it rattled the right post.
Guido Winkmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a killer pass and scores a great goal after finding the back of the net with a simple finish!
Yellow card. Marco Reus (Dortmund) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Handball! A player from Hoffenheim handled the ball. Dortmund are about to take a penalty!
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) fails to convert the penalty kick. His shot goes just wide of the left post.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) has tested the patience of referee Felix Brych and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Felix Brych blows his whistle to start the second half.
Sokratis (Dortmund) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and can count himself very lucky that the referee didn't issue a red card.
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The substitution is prepared. Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Pavel Kaderabek.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) receives a harsh yellow card from the referee after committing a minor foul on his opponent.
Here is a change. Mark Uth is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Here comes a substitution. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) is brought on as a substitute for Benjamini Hubner.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sebastian Rode (Dortmund) replacing Marco Reus.
Substitution. Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) replaces Ousmane Dembele.
Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the bar!
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the middle of the goal, and thus alter the score to 2:0.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows for a foul after seeing the whole situation. It's a penalty for Hoffenheim!
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Roman Burki to move before rolling the ball into the middle of the goal!
The manager makes a subsitution with Sven Bender (Dortmund) coming on for Raphael Guerreiro.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
Paul Ntep de Madiba (Wolfsburg) misses a great opportunity from inside the penalty area after blasting the ball towards goal and it goes wide of the left post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Manuel Grafe has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
It's in the back of the net! Mario Gomez picks out Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 0:1.
Substitution. Shani Tarashaj (Eintracht Frankfurt) in, Marc Stendera out.
A yellow card for a tackle by Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Eintracht Frankfurt are given an advantage. They have a free kick.

What a save from Koen Casteels! Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out.
Goal! Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) scores after an assist by Paul Ntep de Madiba that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:2.
Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ante Rebic.
Niko Kovac has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Branimir Hrgota.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) is afforded space inside the box after collecting a pass, but the chance is wasted as his shot goes harmlessly over the crossbar.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has a great chance to score from deep inside the box! He finds some space for the shot, but sends it errantly way past the left post. Very poor attempt.
Koen Casteels (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card.
A substitution has been made. Paul Ntep de Madiba goes off and Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) comes on.

Lukas Hradecky can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg). The ball would have probably ended up in the middle of the net.
Andries Jonker has decided to make a change. Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) replaces Daniel Didavi.
Substitution. Sebastian Jung makes his way off the pitch and Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) was quite harsh and Harm Osmers didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Marcel Tisserand (Ingolstadt) jumps inside the box to meet the corner and aims a low header towards middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes to stop the effort.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Mathew Leckie is replaced by Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt).
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Harm Osmers and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box. The ball goes inside the right post and past the goalkeeper.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to make a change. Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Admir Mehmedi.
Substitution. Aranguiz makes way for Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen).
The ball was swung into the box by Wendell from the corner kick. He perfectly found the head of Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen), who planted a bullet header inside the left post to make the score 1:1.

Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his daisy-cutter towards the left post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it.
The manager makes a subsitution with Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) coming on for Max Christiansen.
Markus Suttner is being substituted because of an injury. Maik Walpurgis sends Robert Leipertz (Ingolstadt) on the pitch.
Harm Osmers is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) goes for goal but he directs his effort just wide of the left post.
