Goal! Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Leonardo Bittencourt. The score is 1:0.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Felix Wiedwald.

A perfect lofted pass from Lukas Klunter finds Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom left corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Felix Wiedwald had no chance of stopping that. 2:0.
Goal! Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) dribbles into the box then perfectly lifts the ball over the goalkeeper and into the net. He couldn't do anything to stop that cheeky lob. 2:1.

Zlatko Junuzovic showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header inside the right post. It's 2:2.
GOAL - 3:2! Leonardo Bittencourt found Simon Zoller (Koln) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Felix Wiedwald off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
After a goalmouth scramble the ball rebounds out to Anthony Modeste (Koln) who buries it from close range straight into the bottom right corner.
Substitution. Thomas Delaney makes his way off the pitch and Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) comes on as his replacement.
Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Wolfgang Stark ignores the protests.

Fin Bartels sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 4:3.
Alexander Nouri has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) replacing Robert Bauer.
A substitution has been made. Milos Jojic is replaced by Marco Hoger (Koln).
That's the end of the game for Leonardo Bittencourt, who is replaced by Konstantin Rausch (Koln).
Alexander Nouri decides to make a substitution. Milos Veljkovic will be replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Simon Zoller walks off the pitch and Artjoms Rudnevs (Koln) comes on as a substitute.
Felix Wiedwald pulls off a great save to deny Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Gunter Perl has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
What was David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Andrej Kramaric walks off the pitch to be replaced by Mark Uth (Hoffenheim).
It's time for a substitution. Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) comes on in place of Nadiem Amiri.
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Here is a change. Marc Stendera is going off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical orders to Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Kerem Demirbay walks off the pitch and Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) will replace Haris Seferovic.

The ball was swung towards the box by Sebastian Rudy from the corner kick. He perfectly found the head of Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim), who planted a powerful header into the roof of the net to make the score 1:0.
A substitution has been made. Guillermo Varela goes off and Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) had a good chance to change the score. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a shot from just outside the penalty area which went towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper was ready and made an amazing save.

The free kick from long distance is taken by Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg), who fires in a direct effort inches over the crossbar. What a chance! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.

A ball rebounds a long way out and lands at the feet of Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg). He doesn't hesitate and slams it towards goal, but Tom Mickel is alert and keeps the ball from reaching the bottom left corner by deflecting it onto the post. The score remains the same.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) is obviously very disappointed with his shot from the rebound. He aims exactly at the goalkeeper's gloves. This should have been an easy goal!

1:0. Halil Altintop (Augsburg) latches on to a pass on the edge of the penalty area and immediately fires a great first-timer into the bottom left corner. What an amazing finish! Tom Mickel did his best to stop it, but the shot was just too good. Jonathan Schmid provided the assistance.
Mergim Mavraj (Hamburger) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Goal! Philipp Max rounded the goalkeeper and sent a sweet pass to Halil Altintop (Augsburg), who had an easy finish to put it into an empty net. 2:0.
Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) is very lucky to stay on the pitch after using excessive force to bring down his opponent with a two-footed challenge.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Manuel Grafe has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Markus Gisdol decided to make a change. Michael Gregoritsch is replaced by Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger).
The game is over for Walace. Gideon Jung (Hamburger) comes on for the second half.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Daniel Baier (Augsburg) was all set to celebrate a sensational goal after he collected a rebound and blasted a shot in from long range. Unfortunately for him, his effort crashed against the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
The substitution is prepared. Bakery Jatta (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Matthias Ostrzolek.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Goal! Alfred Finnbogason sends a precise cross into the box, Philipp Max (Augsburg) latches on to it and puts the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 3:0.
Substitution. Halil Altintop leaves the pitch and is replaced by Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).

Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Tom Mickel is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 4:0.
Here comes a substitution. Philipp Max is given a rest as he is replaced by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Daniel Baier is replaced by Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he drags his effort wide of the left post.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Thomas Muller, but he can't get on the end of the pass.

David Alaba (Bayern Munich) struck with a perfectly taken free kick from the edge of the box. He curled the ball straight inside the right post. There are not enough superlatives that can be used to describe that goal.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Felix Zwayer's book.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the left side of the goal, but Koen Casteels pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Fantastic team goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) was set free in the area by Thomas Muller and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the top right corner. 0:2.

Goal! Kingsley Coman plays in Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box slots it into the bottom right corner 0:3.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Jakub Blaszczykowski comes off for Vieirinha (Wolfsburg).

Goal! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom right corner. Koen Casteels had no chance of reaching it. The score is 0:4.
Ricardo Rodriguez comes off the pitch to be replaced by Paul Seguin (Wolfsburg).
Carlo Ancelotti prepares a substitution. Mats Hummels is replaced by Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich).
Philipp Lahm will be replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
We are about to witness a substitution. Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) is replacing Thiago Alcantara.
RED CARD! Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Felix Zwayer. He can have an early bath.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Paul Ntep de Madiba (Wolfsburg) is coming onto the pitch as Daniel Didavi cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Goal! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:5.

Arjen Robben sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 0:6.
A header by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) from very close range goes towards the crossbar, but doesn't get past Koen Casteels, who makes a brilliant save.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Freiburg will have a goal kick.

What an opportunity! Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) squanders a huge opportunity as he latches on to a perfect cross from the wing. He produces a bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes just wide of the left post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Freiburg.

A perfect lofted pass from Marcel Heller finds Felix Platte (Darmstadt), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Alexander Schwolow had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.

Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows for a foul after seeing the whole situation. Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Cortus had an easy-decision to make.
Patrick Banggaard (Darmstadt) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Patrick Banggaard (Darmstadt) will miss the next game.
Perfectly taken free kick! Mario Vrancic sends the ball in, Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) manages to jump highest near the penalty spot and plants a cracking header low inside the right post. It's 2:0.

The second half has just started.

GOAL! Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 3:1.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Filip Kostic (Hamburger) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Sascha Stegemann lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
The ball from the corner slips through the box to Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) and he coolly slots it past the goalkeeper.

Goal! Jerome Gondorf produces a great pass that finds Felix Platte (Darmstadt) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot past the goalkeeper and into the back of the net. 0:2.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Aaron Hunt (Hamburger).
Wilson Kamavuaka (Darmstadt) is booked for saying more than Sascha Stegemann was willing to tolerate.
Substitution. Dennis Diekmeier leaves the pitch and is replaced by Bakery Jatta (Hamburger).
It's time for a substitution. Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt) comes on in place of Felix Platte.
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) breaks into the penalty area but his shot is blocked. Good work from Hamburger SV as they win a corner.
Here comes a substitution. Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Filip Kostic.
Torsten Frings prepares a substitution. Wilson Kamavuaka is replaced by Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt).

Superb touch by Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) as he receives a precise pass inside the box. He finds the keeper prepared as he unleashes his shot to the left side of the goal. Wonderful save! The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Hamburger SV.
Patrick Banggaard (Darmstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Sascha Stegemann ignores the protests.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Mario Vrancic as he is replaced by Sidney Sam (Darmstadt).
The foul by Mergim Mavraj (Hamburger) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Sascha Stegemann.
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his shot goalwards, but the keeper produces a decent save!
It's an own goal! A pitiful moment for Fabian Holland (Darmstadt), who tries to clear a cross into the six-yard box but instead sends the ball behind his own keeper. The score is 1:2.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Rune Jarstein. Wolfsburg will have a chance to score from a corner kick.

Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out for a corner. Wolfsburg can continue in their attacking effort.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) blows a clear opportunity! He sends a rebound from close range narrowly wide of the left post.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) for a tough tackle.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Bastian Dankert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin).
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Bastian Dankert's book.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball inside the left post, and thus alter the score to 1:0.

Koen Casteels pulls off a great save to deny Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal. Corner kick. Hertha Berlin will have an opportunity.
Substitution. Maximilian Arnold walks off the pitch and Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) comes on as a substitute.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) managed to win the ball from the free kick and unleashed a strike from the goal area onto the crossbar!
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg).
Andries Jonker has decided to make a change. Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg) replaces Vieirinha.
Here's the change. Salomon Kalou leaves the pitch and Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) comes on as a substitute.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Allan (Hertha Berlin) has received a yellow card for his foul.
It's time for a substitution. Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) comes on in place of Vedad Ibisevic.

Koen Casteels pulls off a great save to deny Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Hertha Berlin.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Substitution. Robin Knoche will be replaced by Philipp Wollscheid (Wolfsburg).
Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Bastian Dankert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
It will be a substitution. Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) is ready to enter the pitch as Alexander Esswein walks off.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

It's a goal! Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Marcel Tisserand. The score is now 1:0.
A clumsy foul by Marcel Tisserand (Ingolstadt) and Markus Schmidt blows his whistle. Werder Bremen are awarded a penalty!
Markus Schmidt shows the yellow card to Marcel Tisserand (Ingolstadt) for a heavy challenge.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the bottom left corner.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Markus Schmidt starts the second half.
A yellow card for a tackle by Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen). Markus Schmidt doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Ingolstadt win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. His effort sails well wide of the right post.
Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) tackles a bit over-zealously and Markus Schmidt blows for a foul. Ingolstadt are awarded a penalty kick!
Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal to give the goalkeeper no chance!

Lamine Sane (Werder Bremen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Markus Schmidt didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. Ingolstadt earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Milos Veljkovic comes off the pitch to be replaced by Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen).
Alexander Nouri has decided to substitute Florian Grillitsch and he is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Max Christiansen will be replaced by Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt).
The game is interrupted. Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Goal! Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dario Lezcano trots off the pitch and is replaced by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt).
Goal! Florian Kainz slips it to Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom left corner with a great effort. The score is 2:3.
Alexander Nouri has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) replacing Florian Kainz.
It's in the back of the net! Fin Bartels is the provider as he slips the ball to Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 2:4.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) sends in a shot from a promising distance after a precise pass. His effort goes inches over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and FC Koln will have a goal kick.
Dominique Heintz (Koln) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
Timo Horn pulls off a good save to deny a long-range header from Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim). Great goalkeeping!

After some miscommunication between the defenders, Dominique Heintz (Koln) gets to a rebound and plants a header towards the bottom left corner, but Oliver Baumann leaps to stop his dangerous attempt.

Dominique Heintz races towards the box before laying off to Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln), who picks it up but drags a shot well wide of the right post from the edge of the box. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Neven Subotic (Koln) is coming onto the pitch as Dominique Heintz cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Here is a change. Andrej Kramaric is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Goal! Jonas Hector passes the ball to the feet of Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 1:0.
Substitution. Adam Szalai makes his way off the pitch and Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) comes on as his replacement.
Substitution. Salih Ozcan (Koln) in, Leonardo Bittencourt out.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and FC Koln will have a goal kick.
Jeremy Toljan will be replaced by Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim).

Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the right post. Oliver Baumann guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Konstantin Rausch is being substituted because of an injury. Peter Stoger sends Marco Hoger (1. FC Koln) on the pitch.

Oliver Baumann makes a brilliant save! Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes towards the bottom left corner but is saved by the keeper!
Great touch by Matthias Lehmann (Koln) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
Yuya Osako (Koln) has tested the patience of referee Marco Fritz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Goal! Niklas Sule slips it to Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom left corner with a great effort. The score is 1:1.
Marco Fritz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Marcel Heller puts the ball on a plate for Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:0.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Patrick Ittrich has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Torsten Frings makes a half-time substitution. Artem Fedetsky (Darmstadt) comes on in place of Sandro Sirigu.
Hamit Altintop (Darmstadt) is shown a yellow card by the referee for dissent.
The referee signals a substitution. Franco Di Santo (Schalke) is brought on as a substitute for Donis Avdijaj.

Thilo Kehrer (Schalke) shows good awareness deep inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and flies inches wide of the right-hand post.
Patrick Ittrich blows his whistle after Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. A penalty is awarded to Schalke!
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot low into the middle of the target, but Michael Esser pulls off a save.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Fabian Holland (Darmstadt) for his blatant foul.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) comes onto the pitch for Felix Platte.
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Johannes Geis is replaced by Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke).
Patrick Ittrich shows the yellow card to Thilo Kehrer (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Max Meyer (Schalke) was quite harsh and Patrick Ittrich didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Coke (Schalke) scores a goal! A perfectly produced cross puts him one-on-one with the goalkeeper and he plants a brilliant header down in the middle of the net, leaving the goalkeeper beaten!
Substitution. Wilson Kamavuaka did his best and is replaced by Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt).
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) shows good awareness inside the box to meet a delightful cross from the free kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Daniel Caligiuri comes off the pitch to be replaced by Alessandro Schopf (Schalke).
Thilo Kehrer (Schalke) makes an ugly tackle on his opponent and is sent off by the referee!
Patrick Banggaard (Darmstadt) sees a yellow card from Patrick Ittrich after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Michael Esser (Darmstadt) picks up a yellow card.
Goal! Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 2:1.
Patrick Ittrich is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it! Werder Bremen force their opponents to concede a corner.
Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) leaps to meet an excellent cross and steers a fantastic header past the goalkeeper, inside the left post.
Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the left post.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) fires in the free kick from a promising position just outside the box. It's a fantastic strike and looks set for glory, but it only rattles the left post!
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) jumps for a header from a cross and puts the ball past the helpless goalkeeper.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Michael Gregoritsch as he is replaced by Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger).
Alexander Nouri has decided to substitute Florian Grillitsch and he is replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) has tested the patience of referee Felix Brych and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. Santiago Garcia did his best and is replaced by Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen).
Goal! Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 2:1.
Substitution. Filip Kostic will be replaced by Bakery Jatta (Hamburger).
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a change. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) replaces Lewis Holtby.
Max Kruse will be replaced by Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen).
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
That's it for today, Felix Brych has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds David Alaba (Bayern Munich) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails a few inches over the bar!
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and has an effort on goal. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies inches high over the bar.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Daniel Siebert blows his whistle to start the second half.
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Daniel Siebert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Arturo Vidal slides a brilliant pass into Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.

Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) unleashed a monstrous piledriver. He controlled a pass, glanced up at goal and shot from the edge of the box. It could have been a difficult one for the keeper, but the ball fortunately hit one of the defenders and ball bounced away.
Daniel Siebert blows his whistle and Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch for Douglas Costa.
Tayfun Korkut prepares a substitution. Aranguiz is replaced by Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen).
Today's match ends for Julian Brandt who will be replaced by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen).
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to substitute Kingsley Coman and he is replaced by Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich).
A substitution has been made. Javi Martinez is replaced by Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich).
What a huge chance for Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Substitution. Kai Havertz walks off the pitch and Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.

Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the bottom right corner. Timo Horn is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save. Now Augsburg have a corner.

Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) jumps highest to meet the ball from the corner kick and finishes behind the helpless keeper with a fine header into the bottom right corner. The defence stare motionlessly at each other. What a peach of a goal that is. Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) has every right to celebrate!
Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) brings his opponent down. Guido Winkmann has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle for a foul. Penalty awarded! Augsburg will take a penalty kick.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Timo Horn receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed towards the left side of the goal.

Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) has a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better as his effort ends wide of the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Guido Winkmann starts the second half.
Peter Stoger makes a switch. Artjoms Rudnevs (1. FC Koln) is coming on in place of Milos Jojic at the start of the second period.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Christian Clemens comes off for Simon Zoller (Koln).
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Substitution. Daniel Baier leaves the pitch and is replaced by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg).
Peter Stoger decides to make a substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt will be replaced by Marco Hoger (1. FC Koln).
Frederik Sorensen (Koln) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort.
Philipp Max (Augsburg) scores an unfortunate own goal and the opposition increase their lead!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Takashi Usami departs the field of play to be replaced by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Here comes a substitution. Jonathan Schmid is given a rest as he is replaced by Georg Teigl (Augsburg).
Jonas Hector (Koln) receives a yellow card.
RED CARD! Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Guido Winkmann. He can have an early bath.
What was Lukas Klunter (Koln) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) reacts stupidly and the referee shows him a deserved red card!
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Marco Reus (Dortmund) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) finds some space on the edge of the penalty box and smashes the ball into the top right corner! What a beauty!
Sokratis (Dortmund) scores an absolute screamer from outside the penalty area, with the ball flying into the top left corner!
The end of the first half.
Robert Hartmann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Sven Bender goes off the pitch and Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) comes on.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to make a change. Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) replaces Marco Reus.
Today's match ends for Anderson Rafael Ordonez Valdez who will be replaced by Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Ousmane Dembele, but he hits a shot just over the crossbar.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) creates a yard of space for himself and tries an effort from the edge of the box, but it goes just wide of the left post.
The referee signals a substitution. Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Marius Wolf.
Thomas Tuchel prepares a substitution. Julian Weigl is replaced by Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund).

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has a big opportunity to score! He climbs highest deep inside the penalty box and strikes a powerful header towards the goal. Next time he should aim better as his effort flies narrowly over the bar.
Substitution. Branimir Hrgota makes way for Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt).
GOAL! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Lukas Hradecky, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 3:1.

What a wasted opportunity by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the bottom left corner, but Lukas Hradecky makes an astonishing save to thwart him. Good work from Dortmund as they win a corner.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.

Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) shows good awareness deep inside the box and jumps high to meet a perfect cross from the set piece. He steers a fine header goalwards, but finds the keeper prepared. No doubt about the wonderful save that he made.
Goal! Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 1:0.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) unleashes a tremendous shot from distance, but it crashes against the crossbar! If it had flown a little bit lower it would have been a cracker!
Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) takes a snap shot and gives the keeper no chance to react.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) has tested the patience of referee Christian Dingert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) for his blatant foul.
It's in the back of the net! Tobias Strobl sprays a pass out to Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:1.
Goal! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) scores after an assist by Mahmoud Dahoud that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:2.
Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.
Christian Dingert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Andreas Christensen (B. Monchengladbach) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes inside the left post and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 3:2.
Julian Nagelsmann prepares a substitution. Sandro Wagner is replaced by Mark Uth (Hoffenheim).
Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim).
Ibrahima Traore comes off the pitch to be replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Andre Hahn will be replaced by Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) replaces Adam Szalai.

What a beautiful moment! Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the top right corner. Yann Sommer just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 4:2.
Goal! Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 4:3.
A substitution has been made. Benjamini Hubner is replaced by Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim).
Here is a change. Tobias Strobl is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Laszlo Benes (B. Monchengladbach).
It's a goal! Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) gets on the end of a pass and it allows him to finish into an empty net with a close-range header. The score has changed to 5:3.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.

What a wonderful moment! Danny Latza (Mainz) receives a perfect pass in the middle of the pitch, lines up the ball and unloads a powerful strike towards the right post. His effort fails to surprise Rune Jarstein, who makes a nice save. Mainz have been awarded a corner kick.
OWN GOAL! John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 1:0.
Today's referee Deniz Aytekin rightly decides to book Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.
The end of the first half.
Referee Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle to start the second half.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Jannik Huth guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Maximilian Mittelstadt trots off the pitch and is replaced by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin).
Here is a change. Genki Haraguchi is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin).
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) blows a big chance to score! He slammed the ball from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it went narrowly over the crossbar.
Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) picked up a yellow card from referee.
The foul by Giulio Donati (Mainz) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Deniz Aytekin.
Substitution. Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) in, Robin Quaison out.
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Giulio Donati and he is replaced by Leon Balogun (Mainz).
Here's the change. Jhon Cordoba leaves the pitch and Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
A yellow card for a tackle by John Brooks (Hertha Berlin). Deniz Aytekin doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot at goal. His effort is blocked by Alexander Schwolow with a brilliant diving save!
Mike Frantz (Freiburg) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Peter Gulacsi, who pulls off a decent save!
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Manuel Grafe ignores the protests.

It's in the back of the net! Emil Forsberg flights in the free kick and the ball finds the head of Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig), whose excellent bullet header from the centre of the box goes into the right side of the goal. 1:0.
Goal - 2:0! Yussuf Poulsen tees up Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Alexander Schwolow.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Manuel Grafe has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Christian Streich decided to make a change. Karim Guede is replaced by Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Half-time substitution. Julian Schuster will not participate anymore and Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) is coming on.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the top right corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Alexander Schwolow, so the score changes to 3:0.
Substitution. Naby Keita did his best and is replaced by Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig).
A yellow card for a tackle by Janik Haberer (Freiburg). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Ralph Hasenhuttl is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Marcel Sabitzer suffers an injury and Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) comes on.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Lukas Kubler (Freiburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Substitution. Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig) replaces Yussuf Poulsen.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Christian Streich has decided to substitute Amir Abrashi and he is replaced by Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg).
GOAL! Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) scores with a header from close range after Timo Werner headed a pin-point lofted cross into his path. It's 4:0.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul.
Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Orjan Nyland is alert and denies him with a nice save.

What a great chance for Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header inside the left post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save.
Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt), who attempted to block the ball after a cross, but instead he sends it inside the left post of his own goal.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Andries Jonker has made a change at the break. Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) has come on in place of Daniel Didavi.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Mathew Leckie as he is replaced by Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt).

Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Koen Casteels guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Fantastic team goal! Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) was set free in the area by Maximilian Arnold and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the top right corner. 2:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Anthony Jung (Ingolstadt) will replace Alfredo Morales.
It's in the back of the net! Yannick Gerhardt plays it into the box, and Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the middle of the net. 3:0.
Andries Jonker is forced to make a change. Riechedly Bazoer is unable to continue due to injury, Paul Seguin (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Maik Walpurgis has decided to substitute Pascal Gross and he is replaced by Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt).
Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Stieler had an easy-decision to make.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Vieirinha walks off the pitch to be replaced by Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg).
That's it for today, Tobias Stieler has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

That was a nice football moment. Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the right post. Martin Hansen guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the right post.
Goal! Almog Cohen puts the ball on a plate for Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:0.
Goal - 1:1! Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Felix Platte provided an assist for the goal.
Marcel Tisserand (Ingolstadt) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Manuel Grafe blows his whistle for a foul. PENALTY to Darmstadt! Let's see who will take responsibility.
Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a shot into the bottom right corner.
Michael Esser pulls off a great save to deny Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) comes onto the pitch so that Roger can be given a rest.
Torsten Frings has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) replacing Felix Platte.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) for a tough tackle.
Goal! Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the left post. He makes it 2:2.
Substitution. Leon Guwara (Darmstadt) on for Mario Vrancic.
Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) takes a brilliant free kick and curls the ball inside the right post to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Manuel Grafe ignores the protests.
A substitution has been made. Wilson Kamavuaka is replaced by Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt).
Red card! Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) simply can't believe his eyes. The referee makes the call and sends him off.
Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) makes a bad challenge and is given a second yellow card which means he's off.
Maik Walpurgis prepares a substitution. Sonny Kittel is replaced by Anthony Jung (Ingolstadt).
Here comes a substitution. Dario Lezcano is given a rest as he is replaced by Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt).
That's it for today, Manuel Grafe has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Valentin Stocker finds John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) and he shows great determination to get to the ball and plant a header into the back of the net. 1:0.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Marwin Hitz is alert and denies him with a nice save.
It's in the back of the net! Salomon Kalou sprays a pass out to Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:0.
Tobias Stieler shows the yellow card to Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.

Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) releases a promising shot from the set piece towards the right post, but Marwin Hitz makes a save to deny him. The linesman points to the corner flag, Hertha Berlin are going to take it.

Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the left post.
CLOSE! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post!
Here comes a substitution. Dominik Kohr is given a rest as he is replaced by Halil Altintop (Augsburg).
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Valentin Stocker will be replaced by Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin).

Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 22 metres out. Marwin Hitz stops the effort which is headed for the top right corner. Hertha Berlin force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
A yellow card for a tackle by Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee signals a substitution. Takashi Usami (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Alfred Finnbogason.
Pal Dardai prepares a substitution. Niklas Stark is replaced by Allan Allan (Hertha Berlin).
Christoph Janker (Augsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Tobias Stieler ignores the protests.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) takes the resulting free kick from 30 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the right side of the goal, but Marwin Hitz is alert and keeps the ball out.
That's the end of the game for Georg Teigl, who is replaced by Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg).
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) replaces Vladimir Darida.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What a goal! Philipp Lahm plays it to Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Roman Burki. 1:0.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) proves that he is an excellent free-kick taker after finding the back of the net with a clever shot that goes straight into the bottom left corner!

Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the top left corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 2:1.
Booking. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a caution from the referee.
Felix Passlack (Dortmund) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Marco Fritz ignores the protests.
What a huge chance for Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Marc Bartra (Dortmund) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and can count himself very lucky that the referee didn't issue a red card.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Marco Fritz has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Thomas Tuchel makes a half-time substitution. Sebastian Rode (Dortmund) comes on in place of Gonzalo Castro.

Goal! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom left corner. Roman Burki had no chance of reaching it. The score is 3:1.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Emre Mor (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Ousmane Dembele can be given a rest.
What was Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just over the bar.

Sven Ulreich pulls off a great save to deny Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Roman Burki (Dortmund) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Roman Burki (Dortmund) makes a slide tackle, but referee Marco Fritz blows for a foul. It's a penalty! What an opportunity to score for Bayern Munich.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) scores from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Substitution. Mikel Merino (Dortmund) in, Raphael Guerreiro out.
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to substitute Robert Lewandowski and he is replaced by Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich).
The substitution is prepared. Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Franck Ribery.
Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) replaces Javi Martinez.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) volleys the ball from just outside the box, but his effort goes narrowly over the bar.

This was a piece of cake for Sven Ulreich. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper. The ball goes out for a corner. Dortmund can continue in their attacking effort.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
The score has changed – 0:1. Thorgan Hazard sends a fantastic cross into the box from the corner. Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) jumps highest and plants a header inside the right post.
Goal! Anthony Modeste displays great vision and sends a pass to Christian Clemens (Koln), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Peter Stoger has made a change at the break. Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) has come on in place of Konstantin Rausch.
Raffael comes off the pitch to be replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).

Well, this is definitely a candidate for the goal of the year. Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise pass and releases an excellent long-range howitzer of a strike, which finds its way into the net as it flies into the bottom right corner.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Dominique Heintz (1. FC Koln) for a tough tackle.
Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a yellow card.
A cross from the free kick is whipped deep into the box by Milos Jojic and Anthony Modeste (Koln) gets in a shot, sending the ball into the top of the net. 2:2.
It's time for a substitution. Dominic Maroh (Koln) comes on in place of Christian Clemens.
Substitution. Jonas Hofmann leaves the pitch and is replaced by Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
Goal! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 2:3.
Lukas Klunter (1. FC Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Brych ignores the protests.
Here comes a substitution. Marco Hoger is given a rest as he is replaced by Simon Zoller (Koln).
The foul by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Brych.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Laszlo Benes (B. Monchengladbach) is coming onto the pitch as Lars Stindl cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Harm Osmers didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and  walks off the pitch to be replaced by Fabian Frei (Mainz).
Yoshinori Muto swings the cross over. Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar.
Substitution. Mike Frantz walks off the pitch and Nils Petersen (Freiburg) comes on as a substitute.
Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper inside the left post. 1:0.
Levin Oztunali will be replaced by Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz).
Martin Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Bojan Krkic (Mainz) replacing Pablo De Blasis.
Christian Streich has decided to substitute Janik Haberer and he is replaced by Onur Bulut (Freiburg).
Danny Latza (Mainz) is lucky to receive a yellow card from the referee because he could easily have been given a red card for his foul.
Vincenzo Grifo comes off the pitch to be replaced by Christian Gunter (Freiburg).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
What a cheeky free kick by Aaron Hunt (Hamburger). He unleashes a 19-metre daisy-cutter which goes into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper beaten. Absolutely fantastic!
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Poor challenge! Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) is penalised for tripping and Felix Zwayer blows his whistle. It's a penalty to Hoffenheim! Let's see who's going to take it.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the right side of the goal.
The yellow card is received by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim).
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Filip Kostic (Hamburger) is given a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Sebastian Rudy is replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Walace (Hamburger) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marco Terrazzino leaves the pitch and Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) receives a yellow card.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
It's a goal! Bobby Wood plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Aaron Hunt (Hamburger). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:1.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) will replace Ermin Bicakcic.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) unleashes a decent shot towards the roof of the net, but Oliver Baumann thwarts him with a nice save.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) takes a great touch after receiving a pass inside the box. He immediately unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a decent save!
It is time for a substitution. Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) is on for Filip Kostic.
The referee shows the yellow card to Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger).
The referee has issued a yellow card to Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim).
Markus Gisdol prepares a substitution. Bobby Wood is replaced by Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger).
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) executes the set piece from the edge of the box in a brilliant manner! His terrific effort looks goal bound, but it only hit the left post!
Substitution. Aaron Hunt makes way for Vasilije Janjicic (Hamburger).
Felix Zwayer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Excellent touch by Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig)! He latches on to a precise pass deep into the box and produces a low drive towards the right post. The goalkeeper pulls off a beautiful save to deny him. The linesman makes the right call and RB Leipzig will have a corner.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) was quite harsh and Robert Kampka didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Robert Kampka starts the second half.
Tayfun Korkut has made a change at the break. Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) has come on in place of Karim Bellarabi.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. He sends the ball into orbit. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) will replace Wendell.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Oliver Burke and he is replaced by Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig).
We are about to witness a substitution. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is replacing Julian Brandt.
Robert Kampka blows his whistle and Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
Here is a change. Timo Werner is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig).
Emil Forsberg passes the ball into the penalty area. Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) collects it and quickly sends it into the left side of the goal via the post! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:0!
The manager makes a subsitution with Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) coming on for Emil Forsberg.
Robert Kampka is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul.
Goal! Max Meyer produces a great pass that finds Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
What a sweet touch by Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Koen Casteels to hold.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) goes on a mazy run, gets into the box and from around the penalty spot he misses the target. What a chance that was!

Goal! Leon Goretzka (Schalke) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. Koen Casteels is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 2:0.
Mario Gomez links up with Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg), who fires just over the bar from the edge of the box.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Sebastian Jung will not participate anymore and Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg) is coming on.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the bottom right corner.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) sees a yellow card from Benjamin Brand after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The substitution is prepared. Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Maxim Choupo-Moting.
Substitution. Sead Kolasinac makes his way off the pitch and Coke (Schalke) comes on as his replacement.
What an opportunity! Leon Goretzka (Schalke) smashed a first-time shot from the edge of the box, but the ball only crashed against the crossbar!
Daniel Didavi comes off the pitch to be replaced by Vieirinha (Wolfsburg).
Goal! Thilo Kehrer puts a cross into the box and finds Guido Burgstaller (Schalke), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 4:0.

Matija Nastasic (Schalke) commits a minor foul to interrupt the attacking move of his opponent and is warned by the referee that he will get a yellow card if he does it again. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Wolfsburg.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) steps up to the penalty spot and confidently smashes the ball into the top right corner!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg) is coming onto the pitch as Mario Gomez cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to substitute Guido Burgstaller and he is replaced by Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke).
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A yellow card for a tackle by Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets into a shooting position! What a long-range cannonball of a shot! His nice effort, however, only crashes against the crossbar. Aim better, sir.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a pass on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards right side of the goal. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Felix Wiedwald pulls off an easy save.
Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked.
Alexander Nouri has decided to make a change. Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) replaces Milos Veljkovic.
Goal! Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the middle of the goal. 0:1.
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) scores as he latches on to a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a perfect strike that goes behind the goalkeeper.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Bastian Dankert has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Niko Kovac decided to make a change. Marco Russ is replaced by Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Goal! The resulting corner is whipped into the box and Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) buries the ball into the back of the net from a David Abraham knock down. 1:2.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Bastian Dankert ignores the protests.
Problems for Alexander Nouri as Luca Caldirola is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen) replaces him.
Niko Kovac is forced to make a change. Anderson Rafael Ordonez Valdez is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) makes an unfair challenge by holding his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball. No point in arguing there. Eintracht Frankfurt will take a penalty kick.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Felix Wiedwald to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Bastian Dankert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Alexander Nouri has decided to substitute Fin Bartels and he is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Branimir Hrgota walks off.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity from the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) strikes a volley towards goal, but one of the defenders blocks his effort. The linesman makes the right call and Werder Bremen will have a corner.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Great ball in from Markus Suttner. Florent Hadergjonaj (Ingolstadt) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the right post.
Goal! The rebound fell to Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt) and he fired home from close range. The score is 0:1.
GOAL! Pascal Gross curls the free kick into the box. Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past Marwin Hitz and into the bottom left corner. 0:2.
The foul by Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Marco Fritz.
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Florent Hadergjonaj (Ingolstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Jan Moravek (Augsburg) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
A substitution has been made. Gojko Kacar is replaced by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) leaps to connect with a delightful cross and places his sweet header into the roof of the net. The goalkeeper had no chance to make a save.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Konstantinos Stafylidis as he is replaced by Philipp Max (Augsburg).

Marwin Hitz can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
Roger (Ingolstadt) makes a rough challenge and Marco Fritz blows his whistle for a foul. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Augsburg!
A yellow-coloured card is received by Roger (Ingolstadt).
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) strikes a great penalty kick that ends up in the back of the net!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) will replace Dario Lezcano.
Here is a change. Jan Moravek is going off and Manuel Baum gives the last tactical orders to Halil Altintop (Augsburg).
Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Marco Fritz didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) scores as he latches on to a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a perfect strike that goes behind the goalkeeper.
Substitution. Sonny Kittel will be replaced by Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt).
Maik Walpurgis decides to make a substitution. Pascal Gross will be replaced by Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Goal! Lars Stindl tees up Laszlo Benes (B. Monchengladbach) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:0.

Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Yann Sommer is alert and denies him. Hertha Berlin have been awarded a corner kick.
That was close by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the right post.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) wastes a huge opportunity from inside the penalty area after unleashing a powerful first-time volley towards goal that goes well wide of the left post.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) takes the free kick from just outside the box and attempts to convert it into a goal. He hits it magnificently and the keeper must be relieved to see the ball hit the bar and ricochet away.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Rune Jarstein, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) wasted a clear opportunity. He fired a first-time shot from point-blank range, but it rattled the left post!

Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the bottom left corner. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Rune Jarstein with a fabulous save.
Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the right post! What a shot that was!
The substitution has been made. Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) has replaced Genki Haraguchi.
Today's referee Gunter Perl rightly decides to book Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.

Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went low towards the middle of the target, but Rune Jarstein was alert and the score remained the same.
Here's the change. Patrick Herrmann leaves the pitch and Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
Here comes a substitution. Julius Kade (Hertha Berlin) is brought on as a substitute for Salomon Kalou.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Laszlo Benes.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Thorgan Hazard walks off the pitch to be replaced by Nico Schulz (B. Monchengladbach).
Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but missed to the left of the target.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
It's 0:1! Kevin Volland feeds Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom left corner.
Sidney Sam is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Leon Guwara (Darmstadt).

Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent. Darmstadt earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Brand had an easy-decision to make.
Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) fires in the free kick from a promising position just outside the box. It's a fantastic strike and looks set for glory, but it only rattles the crossbar!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
That will be all from Mario Vrancic who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt).
Goal! Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the top of the net. He makes it 0:2.
