The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Terrance Boyd leaves the pitch and Felix Platte (Darmstadt) comes on.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) sends in a shot from a promising distance after a precise pass. His effort goes inches over the crossbar.
Substitution. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Karim Bellarabi walks off.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it to the middle of the goal, but Michael Esser makes a comfortable save to stop his effort.
Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
Substitution. Julian Brandt makes his way off the pitch and Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as his replacement.

Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) slammed the ball from a mid-range free kick towards the net! He unleashed a low shot that went to the left, exactly where the keeper was standing. Such an easy save for him.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to make a change. Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Kevin Volland.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) unleashes a shot goalwards from a mid-range free kick. The ball heads towards the right post, but the goalkeeper makes a decent save to thwart him. Mainz have a corner.

Golden chance! Bojan Krkic (Mainz) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and RB Leipzig will have a goal kick.
The referee Tobias Stieler awards Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) will replace Dayot Upamecano.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Goal! Emil Forsberg plays the ball into the area and Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) gets on the end of it to glance a header into the back of the net. He makes it 0:1.

Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) controls a nice low pass and shoots from just outside the box, but it's a poor effort that flies into the stands. Wasted opportunity! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) connects with the ball from the corner kick and places a precise header past the stranded goalkeeper. The opposing players are staring at each other, unable to understand what happened. Who will take the blame for that one? Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) has a reason to celebrate!
That will be all from Robin Quaison who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Jairo Samperio (Mainz).
Bernardo (RB Leipzig) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Tobias Stieler ignores the protests.
Bojan Krkic comes off the pitch to be replaced by Yoshinori Muto (Mainz).
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) coolly converts the penalty. His precise shot goes inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig).
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) for a tough tackle.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) is really unlucky not to score after heading the ball onto the right post!
A yellow card for a tackle by Jairo Samperio (Mainz). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) is given a yellow card.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Emil Forsberg walks off the pitch to be replaced by Rani Khedira (RB Leipzig).
Fabian Frei (Mainz) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Goal! Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 1:3.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) comes onto the pitch so that Naby Keita can be given a rest.
Here is a change. Jhon Cordoba is going off and Martin Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) takes out his opponent with a nasty slide tackle and receives a straight red card from the referee!
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the right side of the goal. The score is 2:3.
Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) is shown a yellow card.
Tobias Stieler rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Giulio Donati (Mainz) receives a yellow card for infringement.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.

Alexander Schwolow receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed for the bottom right corner.
Guido Winkmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
The manager makes a subsitution with Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) coming on for Jakub Blaszczykowski.
Christian Streich decides to make a substitution. Karim Guede will be replaced by Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box. The ball goes into the bottom right corner and past the goalkeeper.
It's time for a substitution. Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Vieirinha.
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Janik Haberer is replaced by Onur Bulut (Freiburg).
Golden chance! Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
The substitution has been made. Georg Niedermeier (Freiburg) has replaced Florian Niederlechner.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) has tested the patience of referee Markus Schmidt and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Another situation results in a direct free kick for Dortmund.

Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) struck with a perfectly taken free kick from the edge of the box. He curled the ball straight inside the right post. There are not enough superlatives that can be used to describe that goal.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the middle of the goal is smartly dealt with by Rene Adler.
Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Markus Schmidt had an easy-decision to make.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Bobby Wood (Hamburger), whose header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the bottom right corner, but Rene Adler is prepared and dives to thwart him.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Markus Schmidt starts the second half.

Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball is out of play. Dortmund will have a chance to score from a corner.
Emre Mor (Dortmund) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Emre Mor can be given a rest.
Markus Gisdol decides to make a substitution. Michael Gregoritsch will be replaced by Aaron Hunt (Hamburger).
Filip Kostic (Hamburger) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Golden chance! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.

Filip Kostic (Hamburger) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the left side of the goal, but Roman Burki pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. Hamburger SV will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Rene Adler pulls off a great save to deny Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Julian Weigl will be replaced by Felix Passlack (Dortmund).
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Raphael Guerreiro and he is replaced by Nuri Sahin (Dortmund).
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang rounded the goalkeeper and sent a sweet pass to Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund), who had an easy finish to put it into an empty net. 2:0.
That's the end of the game for Albin Ekdal, who is replaced by Vasilije Janjicic (Hamburger).
Markus Gisdol has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) replacing Bobby Wood.
Filip Kostic (Hamburger) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the crossbar, but Roman Burki easily deals with the threat.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Rene Adler with a strike into the bottom left corner. He makes it 3:0.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A cross from the corner kick arrives close to the penalty spot. Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the bar!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Wolfgang Stark starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Peter Stoger decided to make a change. Marco Hoger is replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln).
Milos Jojic (Koln) picks up a rebound just outside the box, steadies himself and unleashes a shot that deflects off the post into the bottom left corner, beating the helpless goalkeeper.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Taleb Tawatha as he is replaced by Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Niko Kovac has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Marco Fabian.
Christian Clemens comes off the pitch to be replaced by Neven Subotic (Koln).
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
Here is a change. Marius Wolf is going off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical orders to Anderson Rafael Ordonez Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt).
A substitution has been made. Konstantin Rausch goes off and Salih Ozcan (Koln) comes on.
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Wolfgang Stark had an easy-decision to make.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) receives a neat pass inside the box and instantly thumps the ball goalward, but a defender makes a last ditch block to deny him. Hoffenheim force a corner. They send men into the box.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the left post!

Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Sven Ulreich is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. The ball goes behind for a corner. Hoffenheim will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
What a hit that is! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) scores a great goal from approximately 23 metres out. His effort goes straight into the left side of the goal and he makes it 1:0.

Sven Ulreich was forced into action to thwart Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper. Hoffenheim earn a corner.

OFF THE BAR! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Oliver Baumann, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Bayern Munich get a corner.
Here is a change. Sandro Wagner is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
The substitution has been made. Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) has replaced Kerem Demirbay.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) for a tough tackle.
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to substitute Renato Sanches and he is replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Here's the change. David Alaba leaves the pitch and Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marco Terrazzino (Hoffenheim) replacing Sebastian Rudy.
Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Oliver Baumann pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) fires the ball towards the left side of the goal from close-range, but his shot is blocked by one of the defenders. The linesman makes the right call and Bayern Munich will have a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Zlatko Junuzovic produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) rises high to head the ball straight under the crossbar and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Alexander Nouri gives a chance to Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) and Thomas Delaney is off.
Felix Wiedwald pulls off a great save to deny Max Meyer (Schalke), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) will replace Claudio Pizarro.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) replacing Maxim Choupo-Moting.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Max Meyer will be replaced by Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke).
The foul by Leon Goretzka (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Hartmann.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Werder Bremen!
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Ralf Fahrmann to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!

Max Kruse sends a superb cross into the box. Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the right post, leaving Ralf Fahrmann beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 3:0.
Ralf Fahrmann (Schalke) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Robert Hartmann lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Guido Burgstaller comes off the pitch to be replaced by Franco Di Santo (Schalke).
Alexander Nouri has decided to substitute Max Kruse and he is replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
Robert Hartmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Deniz Aytekin after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
What a hit! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot low into the middle of the net. 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle to start the second half.
Andries Jonker has made a change at the break. Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg) has come on in place of Yunus Malli.
Half-time substitution. Wendell will not participate anymore and Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) tries his luck and takes a shot from inside the box. His effort on goal is blocked by a defender.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) jumps for a header from the corner kick, but fails to steer the ball into the goal as it flies high over the bar.
Substitution. Admir Mehmedi will be replaced by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen).
It's in the back of the net! Kai Havertz sprays a pass out to Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:0.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) latches on to the corner kick inside the box, but his header crashes against the crossbar! The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
Substitution. Riechedly Bazoer leaves the pitch and is replaced by Justin Mobius (Wolfsburg).
Tayfun Korkut decides to make a substitution. Stefan Kiessling will be replaced by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).

Goal! Jakub Blaszczykowski clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg), who jumps highest and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the left side of the goal. Bernd Leno had no chance of stopping that. 2:1.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) for a tough tackle.
Maximilian Arnold takes over corner duties and expertly finds Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the top right corner. The score is now 2:2.

Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Deniz Aytekin blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. PENALTY to Wolfsburg! Let's see who will take responsibility.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) fires the penalty inside the left post.

Karim Bellarabi passes to Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 3:3.
The game is interrupted. Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Substitution. Vieirinha makes his way off the pitch and Paul Seguin (Wolfsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The first half has started.

Goal! The ball is swung into the box from the resulting corner kick and finds Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt), who jumps highest and tries his luck with a header from around the penalty spot. His effort is both strong and precise enough to go into the top left corner. The score is 1:0.
A yellow card for a tackle by Leon Balogun (Mainz). Patrick Ittrich doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) is quickest to the rebound inside the box and produces a decent strike towards the bottom left corner. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a spectacular save to keep the ball out of the net. Great goalkeeping!
Patrick Ittrich blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Half-time substitution. Leon Balogun is replaced by Giulio Donati (Mainz).
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt).
Florent Hadergjonaj (Ingolstadt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Patrick Ittrich didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The game has come to an end for Niko Bungert. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Suat Serdar (Mainz).
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to  for a tough tackle.
Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) attempts to head the ball away after a cross into the penalty area, but instead he accidentally sends it inside the left post of his own goal. The goalkeeper was helpless.

Florent Hadergjonaj (Ingolstadt) scores an incredible goal! He receives a pass, makes some space for himself and unleashes a long-range thunderbolt of a shot past the goalkeeper into the left side of the net.
The yellow card goes to Danny Latza (Mainz).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt) comes onto the pitch for Mathew Leckie.
Martin Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Robin Quaison (Mainz) replacing Danny Latza.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Markus Suttner will be replaced by Marcel Tisserand (Ingolstadt).
Patrick Ittrich shows the yellow card to Marcel Tisserand (Ingolstadt) for a heavy challenge.
Substitution. Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) in, Dario Lezcano out.
Booking. Martin Hansen (Ingolstadt) receives a caution from the referee.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Jesus Vallejo (Eintracht Frankfurt) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a nice cross deep inside the 18-yard box and produces a fine header towards the left post, but the goalkeeper is well positioned and punches the ball away, deflecting it onto the post.
Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Harm Osmers starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Tony Jantschke is replaced by Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach).
Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) has tested the patience of referee Harm Osmers and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Yann Sommer pulls off a great save to deny Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ante Rebic.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Jonas Hofmann and he is replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
That will be all from Taleb Tawatha who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Although Tobias Sippel (B. Monchengladbach) is just on the bench, Harm Osmers has awarded him with a yellow card. Unsporting behavior says the referee.
The players claim that Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) handled the ball and it seems they are right. The referee gives a penalty kick to Eintracht Frankfurt!!
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) blows a huge chance to score! He sends the penalty to the left side of the goal, but it's not enough to beat Yann Sommer who easily stops the effort.
Substitution. Thorgan Hazard leaves the pitch and is replaced by Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach).
Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) makes a bad challenge and is given a second yellow card which means he's off.
What was Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Substitution. Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt) has come on for Mijat Gacinovic.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.

Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort into the top right corner.

OFF THE POST! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Goal! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. Robert Lewandowski assisted in the goal. 2:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Manuel Baum has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Georg Teigl (Augsburg) comes on the pitch for Jan Moravek.
Half-time substitution. Manuel Baum decided to make a change. Raul Bobadilla is replaced by Halil Altintop (Augsburg).

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Franck Ribery, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 3:0.
Goal! Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner. 4:0.
Substitution. Kingsley Coman makes his way off the pitch and Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) comes on as his replacement.
It should have been a goal! Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) fires a rocket of a shot but it only hits the crossbar!
Carlo Ancelotti prepares a substitution. Thiago Alcantara is replaced by Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Mats Hummels walks off the pitch to be replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
Kevin Danso (Augsburg) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the left by a whisker.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 5:0.
The game has come to an end for Paul Verhaegh. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg).

It's a goal! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Jerome Boateng. The score is now 6:0.
A yellow card is awarded to Christoph Janker (Augsburg).
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.

Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) fires in a promising strike from the free kick just outside the penalty area. His nice effort flies towards the bottom left corner but is denied by Felix Wiedwald, who pulls off a glorious save! Freiburg get a corner.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the top right corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Alexander Schwolow, so the score changes to 0:1.
Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case. Werder Bremen have been awarded a free kick.
Problems for Alexander Nouri as Robert Bauer is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) replaces him.
Santiago Garcia feeds the ball through to Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:2!
The end of the first half.
Half-time substitution. Aleksandar Ignjovski is replaced by Lukas Kubler (Freiburg).
Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Christian Streich makes a half-time substitution. Nils Petersen (Freiburg) comes on in place of Florian Niederlechner.
Christian Streich has made a change at the break. Julian Schuster (Freiburg) has come on in place of Amir Abrashi.
GOAL! Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Alexander Schwolow, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 0:3.

Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle for a foul. The referee blows his whistle and awards Freiburg a penalty after chaos inside the box.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) executes a penalty kick, but only fires the ball towards the middle of the goal, right into the gloves of Felix Wiedwald.
Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 1:3.
It's in the back of the net! Thomas Delaney plays it into the box, and Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 1:4.
Substitution. Fin Bartels is replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) finds some space just outside the penalty area after exchanging the ball with his teammate and strikes a shot towards goal that goes inside the right post!
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Wolfgang Stark had an easy-decision to make.
The ball is whipped in from the resulting set piece and finds the head of Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) who rises and produces an amazing header into the bottom right corner.
Substitution. Florian Grillitsch makes way for Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.

Anthony Modeste (Koln) controls a cross inside the six-yard box, but sends his shot slightly over the bar.

Milos Jojic (Koln) heads the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal after getting on the end of a brilliant delivery that was sent into the penalty box from out wide!
A dangerous towering header by Anthony Modeste (Koln) from around the penalty spot goes just over the bar. This corner kick didn't change the score.

Simon Zoller (Koln) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Yellow card. Milos Jojic (Koln) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.

Markus Gisdol makes a half-time substitution. Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) comes on in place of Gideon Jung.

Bobby Wood (Hamburger) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom left corner, but Timo Horn made a crucial save!
Nicolai Muller is being substituted because of an injury. Markus Gisdol sends Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) on the pitch.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) receives a yellow card for infringement.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Walace (Hamburger) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Walace comes off the pitch to be replaced by Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger).

Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Filip Kostic (Hamburger) finds himself some space inside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Timo Horn pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going inside the left-hand post.
Goal! Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 2:1.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Superb touch by Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) as he receives a precise pass inside the box. He finds the keeper prepared as he unleashes his shot to the left side of the goal. Wonderful save! The ball goes out of play. RB Leipzig are awarded a corner kick.
What a hit! Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot inside the left post. 1:0.

Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Daniel Heuer Fernandes guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. Now RB Leipzig have a corner.
A substitution has been made. Artem Fedetsky goes off and Wilson Kamavuaka (Darmstadt) comes on.

That was close by Sidney Sam (Darmstadt)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for RB Leipzig.
A neat pass is well received by Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball on goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Bastian Dankert had an easy-decision to make.

Fabian Holland (Darmstadt) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for RB Leipzig.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig) jumps for a header from the resulting corner kick and sends the ball in on goal, but the goalkeeper makes a very good save.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt) for his blatant foul.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) was quite harsh and Bastian Dankert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Marcel Heller as he is replaced by Leon Guwara (Darmstadt).

Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) strikes the ball towards goal after latching onto a defence-splitting pass on the edge of the penalty box and his shot sails inside the right post to leave the goalkeeper completely stranded!

Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) must have known he would be sent off for this foul, but he had to stop the opponent at all costs. Bastian Dankert shows him a second yellow card and the game has ended for him.
Fabian Holland will be replaced by Markus Steinhofer (Darmstadt).
Here is a change. Marcel Sabitzer is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig).
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the right side of the goal. The score is 4:0.
Goal! The rebound fell to Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) and he fired home from close range. The score is 4:0.
That will be all from Emil Forsberg who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Rani Khedira (RB Leipzig).

Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball is out of play and Schalke manage to earn a corner.
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Dortmund.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) comes close as his long-range free kick goes a whisker wide of the right post.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Ralf Fahrmann makes a decent save to deny his effort directed low to the middle of the target.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Shinji Kagawa puts the ball on a plate for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:1.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) earns the yellow card.

Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting corner and steers his header into the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper pulls off an astonishing save to deny him. Schalke win a corner.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Benjamin Stambouli walks off the pitch to be replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a change. Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) replaces Coke.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Felix Passlack leaves the pitch and Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) comes on.
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) shows off his amazing technique to get in front of goal by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the right post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
What a goal! Leon Goretzka plays it to Thilo Kehrer (Schalke), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Roman Burki into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
Thomas Tuchel is forced to make a change. Marcel Schmelzer is unable to continue due to injury, Emre Mor (Dortmund) comes on.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) is coming onto the pitch as Guido Burgstaller cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Sokratis (Dortmund) lunges into his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) goes into the referee's book for dissent.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) receives a pinpoint pass, takes one touch and produces a shot. It's a few inches shy of ending inside the left post. A great effort, though!

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the bottom right corner. Oliver Baumann is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save.

Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin) is the first to get to a rebound and his weak, but precise effort finds its way through the defenders inside the goalmouth into the back of the net, bouncing in off the right post.

Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) changes the direction of the ball using his hand, but he is angry when the referee gives a foul against him. It's a penalty to Hoffenheim! Let's see who's going to take it.
Benjamin Brand rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin).
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) slams home the penalty with a precise low shot into the bottom left corner.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Benjamin Brand and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the right post.

Rune Jarstein hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) takes the ball to the corner flag and sends it into the box.

Benjamin Brand blows his whistle and Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
Benjamin Brand shows the yellow card to Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
The referee signals a substitution. Mark Uth is brought on as a substitute for Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Jordan Torunarigha replaces Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin).
That will be all from Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Genki Haraguchi.
OFF THE BAR! Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) unleashes a thunderous effort from the edge of the box and the ball crashes off the woodwork. What a strike that was!
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) hits the right post with a rebound from just outside the box.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the right side of the target, but Rune Jarstein easily deals with the threat.
What a hit! Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) makes himself some space on the edge of the penalty area and pulls the trigger. His accurate effort goes off the post into the top left corner. He makes it 1:3.
Here comes a substitution. Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) is given a rest as he is replaced by Sami Allagui.
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Brand had an easy-decision to make.
It's in the back of the net! Sandro Wagner sprays a pass out to Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:3.
Julian Nagelsmann prepares a substitution. Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) is replaced by Adam Szalai.
It will be a substitution. Eugen Polanski is ready to enter the pitch as Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) walks off.
That's it for today, Benjamin Brand has blown his whistle and the game is over.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) zig-zags his way into the box and fails to direct a shot into the roof of the net as the goalkeeper pulls off a miraculous stop.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he fails to change the score as his effort deflects away off the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
It's in the back of the net! Thiago Alcantara plays it into the box, and Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the roof of the net. 0:1.
We are about to witness a substitution. Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) is replacing Patrick Herrmann.
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) replacing Franck Ribery.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) for Tony Jantschke.
Substitution. Xabi Alonso walks off the pitch and Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Andre Hahn goes off the pitch and Laszlo Benes (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.

The game has begun to heat up. Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
That's it for today, Tobias Stieler has blown his whistle and the game is over.

Today's referee Wolfgang Stark rightly decides to book Jairo Samperio (Mainz) for his harsh tackle.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) says something out of turn to the referee and is shown a yellow card.

Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) comes on the pitch for Leon Goretzka.
Goal! Guido Burgstaller plays a pass to the feet of Sead Kolasinac (Schalke), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 0:1.
Bojan Krkic (Mainz) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the left post, but Ralf Fahrmann is prepared and dives to thwart him.

Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Niko Bungert (Mainz) for a tough tackle.
A yellow card for a tackle by Holger Badstuber (Schalke). Wolfgang Stark doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Substitution. Danny Latza leaves the pitch and is replaced by Yoshinori Muto (Mainz).

Wolfgang Stark is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the right post.
Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) is afforded space inside the box after collecting a pass, but the chance is wasted as his shot goes harmlessly over the crossbar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Great ball in from Timothy Chandler. Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.
A dangerous towering header by David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) from around the penalty spot goes just over the bar. This corner kick didn't change the score.
The game has come to an end for Lewis Holtby. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger).
Benjamin Cortus shows a yellow card to Gideon Jung (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
Markus Gisdol has decided to substitute Aaron Hunt and he is replaced by Nicolai Muller (Hamburger).

Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt) finds himself some space inside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Rene Adler pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going into the bottom left corner.

The yellow card goes to Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt). Hamburger SV earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.

Niko Kovac decides to make a substitution. Branimir Hrgota will be replaced by Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Ante Rebic.

What a great touch by Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.

What a chance that is! Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Freiburg.

Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle after Marwin Hitz (Augsburg) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. The referee gives a penalty to Freiburg after a quick talk with the linesman, who had apparently seen the situation from a better perspective.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Marwin Hitz (Augsburg) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) smoothly converts the penalty with a stunning effort which ends up inside the right post.
Christian Gunter (Freiburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make.
Nicolas Hofler is substituted due to injury. Christian Streich gives a chance to Amir Abrashi (Freiburg).

Georg Teigl showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header into the bottom left corner. It's 1:1.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Alexander Schwolow pulls off a great save to deny Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal. Augsburg get a corner.
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Aleksandar Ignjovski (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch so that Lukas Kubler can be given a rest.
Manuel Baum is forced to make a change. Jan Moravek is unable to continue due to injury, Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) comes on.

A yellow card for a tackle by Aleksandar Ignjovski (Freiburg). Sascha Stegemann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
That's it for today, Sascha Stegemann has blown his whistle and the game is over.

Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom left corner is blocked by Rune Jarstein, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
What a goal! Yuya Osako (Koln) receives an accurate pass and tries his luck with a long-range shot. He unleashes a superb strike that goes into the top right corner and behind the goalkeeper.
Pal Dardai is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Salomon Kalou suffers an injury and Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) comes on.

What a save from Timo Horn! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising low header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the bottom right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 2:0.

Stunning strike! Anthony Modeste (Koln) latches on to a precise through ball from Matthias Lehmann before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the bottom left corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 3:0.
What was Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Pal Dardai makes a switch. Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) is coming on in place of Per Skjelbred at the start of the second period.
Dominic Maroh (Koln) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Timo Horn (1. FC Koln) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Marco Fritz no option but to blow his whistle. The referee makes a call and blows his whistle for an infringement. Hertha Berlin are awarded a penalty.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) sends Timo Horn the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Anthony Modeste (Koln) scores as he swirls past the opponent's defenders and releases an accurate effort which sails into the bottom right corner.

John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) jumps inside the box to meet the corner and aims a low header towards middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes to stop the effort.

That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen).

Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.

Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Bernd Leno leaps like a salmon to deny him.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The manager makes a subsitution with Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) coming on for Jeremy Toljan.

Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) shows good awareness deep inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and flies inches over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Bayer Leverkusen will have a goal kick.
The game has come to an end for Adam Szalai. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Goal! Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Steven Zuber, then sends the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Kevin Volland comes off the pitch to be replaced by Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen).
Tayfun Korkut has decided to substitute Julian Brandt and he is replaced by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen).

Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) shows good awareness deep inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and flies inches wide of the left-hand post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Julian Baumgartlinger.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) replacing Kerem Demirbay.

Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner of the net.

Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Christian Dingert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

It's in! Zlatko Junuzovic spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) doesn't think twice and curls a first-time shot into the top left corner. The score is now 2:0.
The game has come to an end for Claudio Pizarro. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen).

jumps into a tackle and Frank Willenborg blows his whistle for a foul. A penalty is awarded to Darmstadt!

That was a nice football moment. Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the left post. Koen Casteels guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! Now RB Leipzig have a corner.
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Peter Gulacsi pulls off a great save to deny Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! The referee points to the corner flag and Wolfsburg will take a corner.
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Andries Jonker is forced to make a change. Ricardo Rodriguez is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg).
The end of the first half.
Benjamin Brand blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Federico Palacios-Martinez (RB Leipzig) comes on the pitch for Dominik Kaiser.
What a big chance! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) cracks a splendid volley from just outside the box that brushes the left post. It was an incredible shot, but unfortunately for him it didn't end up in the net.

Peter Gulacsi makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.
Substitution. Paul Seguin (Wolfsburg) replaces Riechedly Bazoer.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the middle of the goal, but Koen Casteels was alert and made an amazing save!
Substitution. Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) on for Benno Schmitz.
Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Benjamin Brand after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Here comes a substitution. Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig) is brought on as a substitute for Emil Forsberg.

Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the middle of the target, but Koen Casteels was alert and the score remains the same.
A yellow card for a tackle by Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg). Benjamin Brand doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Daniel Didavi comes off the pitch to be replaced by Vieirinha (Wolfsburg).
Paul Seguin (Wolfsburg) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header directed towards the goal is brilliantly saved by the goalkeeper.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) gets into a shooting position! What a long-range cannonball of a shot! His nice effort, however, only crashes against the crossbar. Aim better, sir.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Tobias Stieler after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Tobias Stieler has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Felix Wiedwald was forced into action to thwart Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Bayer Leverkusen.
Substitution. Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) has come on for Karim Bellarabi.
A yellow card for a tackle by Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Alexander Nouri has decided to substitute Florian Grillitsch and he is replaced by Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen).
The substitution has been made. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) has replaced Julian Brandt.
Alexander Nouri has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) replacing Theodor Gebre Selassie.

Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) deflects his teammate's shot, which was heading in the opposite direction, using his body. The goalkeeper reacted to the earlier shot and the deflection confused him. No chance of stopping that.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Chicharito trots off the pitch and is replaced by Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen).

Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) must have known he would be sent off for this foul, but he had to stop the opponent at all costs. Tobias Stieler shows him a second yellow card and the game has ended for him.
Zlatko Junuzovic will be replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) commits an ugly tackle on his opponent, but there is no caution from the referee. Bayer Leverkusen are given a huge opportunity to score - it's a penalty kick!
Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) blows a huge chance to score! He sends the penalty to the bottom left corner, but it's not enough to beat Felix Wiedwald who easily stops the effort.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.

Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Rune Jarstein, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Hamburger SV get a corner.
Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Substitution. Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) on for Niklas Stark.
He has been shown a yellow card.
Markus Gisdol has decided to substitute Lewis Holtby and he is replaced by Filip Kostic (Hamburger).
Yellow card. Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Markus Gisdol prepares a substitution. Walace is replaced by Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger).
What a goal! Aaron Hunt plays it to Albin Ekdal (Hamburger), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Rune Jarstein into the right side of the goal. 1:0.
Here's the change. Genki Haraguchi leaves the pitch and Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) comes on as a substitute.
Markus Gisdol has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) replacing Aaron Hunt.
Felix Brych is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 1:0.
Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt) blew a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross deep inside the box, but his shot flew just over the bar.
Goal - 1:1! Nicolas Hofler laid the ball off to Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
A yellow card for a tackle by Christian Gunter (Freiburg). Gunter Perl doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Gunter Perl has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Goal! Vincenzo Grifo displays great vision and sends a pass to Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 1:2.
Here's the change. Taleb Tawatha leaves the pitch and Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
Substitution. Ante Rebic leaves the pitch and is replaced by Shani Tarashaj (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Today's referee Gunter Perl rightly decides to book Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his harsh tackle.
Substitution. Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Mijat Gacinovic.
Here is a change. Nicolas Hofler is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Amir Abrashi (Freiburg).
The substitution is prepared. Nils Petersen (Freiburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Florian Niederlechner.
The game has come to an end for Julian Schuster. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Marc Torrejon (Freiburg).

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
What a hit! Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot inside the right post. 1:0.
Referee Manuel Grafe sees the trip by Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. It's a penalty! Schalke have an opportunity to score from the penalty spot.
Goal! Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) slams home the penalty with a precise low shot into the bottom left corner.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) executes a nice mid-range free kick. His effort only flies inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day.
Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) squandered a big chance from inside the box, firing his volley narrowly over the bar. What a waste.
Manuel Grafe has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Dieter Hecking decided to make a change. Christoph Kramer is replaced by Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach).
What a chance that is! Thilo Kehrer swings the ball into the box, and Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the left post.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out. B. Monchengladbach have a corner.

It's unbelievable, Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) blows a huge opportunity! He is totally unmarked and fires a first-time shot towards goal from a few yards out, but Ralf Fahrmann reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
Goal! Lars Stindl displays great vision and sends a pass to Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the right post. The score is 2:1.
Here is a change. Patrick Herrmann is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).

GOAL! Superb work from Mahmoud Dahoud, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach), who beats Ralf Fahrmann with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 3:1.
Here comes a substitution. Guido Burgstaller is given a rest as he is replaced by Franco Di Santo (Schalke).
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a change. Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) replaces Daniel Caligiuri.
What a chance for Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post.

Goal! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the back of the net. Tobias Strobl assisted in the goal. 4:1.
Andreas Christensen goes off the pitch and Timothee Kolodziejczak (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.

Benedikt Howedes sends a superb cross into the box. Leon Goretzka (Schalke) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the right post, leaving Yann Sommer beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 4:2.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) replacing Holger Badstuber.
Thilo Kehrer (Schalke) sees a yellow card from Manuel Grafe after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Today's referee Manuel Grafe rightly decides to book Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) for his harsh tackle.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Franco Di Santo (Schalke) receives a yellow card.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a caution.
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) picks up the ball on the edge of the penalty box and produces a moment of magic with a brilliant shot that goes into the left side of the goal!
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot at goal. His effort is blocked by Bernd Leno with a brilliant diving save!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his low drive to the right post is smartly dealt with by Bernd Leno. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Dortmund.
Marc Bartra (Dortmund) gets himself onto the end of the corner, but his header is blocked.
Goal 2:0! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Christian Dingert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The substitution has been made. Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) has replaced Aranguiz.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Bernd Leno makes a great save to stop his effort.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Marco Reus limps off the pitch to be replaced by Christian Pulisic (Dortmund).
It must be a yellow card. It is. Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Roman Burki with a strike into the top left corner. He makes it 2:1.
Close! Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant foul.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Admir Mehmedi trots off the pitch and is replaced by Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen).
The foul by Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Christian Dingert.
Goal! A great cross from Ousmane Dembele finds Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who scores with a simple header into an empty net. 3:1.
Here comes a substitution. Ousmane Dembele is given a rest as he is replaced by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund).
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) sends a superb shot from a 18-metre free kick. His strike goes straight into the top right corner.
What a hit! Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 4:2.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang can be given a rest.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) makes an overly-aggressive challenge and Christian Dingert blows his whistle for a foul. A penalty is awarded to Dortmund!
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the bottom left corner.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) for Omer Toprak.
Fantastic team goal! Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) was set free in the area by Christian Pulisic and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom right corner. 6:2.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

What a save from Manuel Neuer! Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the top right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out. FC Koln have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Thomas Kessler dived superbly to block a header by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the roof of the net, but Thomas Kessler pulled off a remarkable save! Good work from Bayern Munich as they win a corner.
Goal! Arturo Vidal passes the ball to the feet of Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 0:1.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Thomas Kessler.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Goal! Thomas Muller passes the ball to Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Thomas Kessler couldn't do anything about it. 0:2.
Problems for Carlo Ancelotti as Douglas Costa is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) replaces him.
The substitution is prepared. Dominic Maroh (Koln) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Frederik Sorensen.
Here is a change. Christian Clemens is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Artjoms Rudnevs (1. FC Koln).

Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Peter Stoger prepares a substitution. Marco Hoger is replaced by Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Arturo Vidal departs the field of play to be replaced by Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) was quite harsh and Jochen Drees didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Rafinha (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch so that Kingsley Coman can be given a rest.

It's a goal! Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the top left corner. The assist goes to Juan Bernat and the score changes to 0:3.
That's it for today, Jochen Drees has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.

Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) produces a wonderful finish! He received a pass from Marco Terrazzino and unleashed a fantastic long-range strike into the bottom right corner via the post. The score is 1:0.
Today's referee Jochen Drees rightly decides to book Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) for his harsh tackle.
Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) receives a precise pass inside the box from Dario Lezcano and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the right side of the net. 1:1.
What an amazing save by Martin Hansen! Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot low towards the middle of the target, but fails.
Jochen Drees has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Substitution. Marco Terrazzino makes his way off the pitch and Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) comes on as his replacement.

That was a nice football moment. Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the left post. Martin Hansen guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
The foul by Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jochen Drees.
Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) attempts to head the ball away from inside the six-yard box, but unluckily he turns a cross from the resulting corner inside the left post of his own net.

Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) outjumps the defence in the centre of the box and connects with the free kick from Sebastian Rudy. He sends the ball into the top left corner with his towering header and alters the score to 2:2.
Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the middle of the goal, but Martin Hansen is prepared to thwart his effort.

Excellent touch by Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.

Oliver Baumann pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) fired on target from the rebound. His effort from inside the box was directed low to the middle of the goal.
A substitution has been made. Pascal Gross goes off and Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) comes on.
It's in the back of the net! Kerem Demirbay slips the ball through to Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot inside the left post. He makes it 3:2.
What a goal! Andrej Kramaric plays it to Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Martin Hansen low into the middle of the net. 4:2.
Substitution. Nadiem Amiri makes way for Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim).
Maik Walpurgis has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt) replacing Lukas Hinterseer.
Jochen Drees shows the yellow card to Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt) for a heavy challenge.

Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Martin Hansen guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch for Sandro Wagner.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Substitution. Alfredo Morales leaves the pitch and is replaced by Anthony Jung (Ingolstadt).
Kerem Demirbay takes the corner and Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) rises highest near the penalty spot to plant a brilliant header into the roof of the net. The score is 5:2.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the left side of the goal. The score is 0:1.
It's in the back of the net! Levin Oztunali is the provider as he slips the ball to Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:1.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Yoshinori Muto makes his way off the pitch and Jairo Samperio (Mainz) comes on as his replacement.
Jeffrey Bruma is substituted due to injury. Andries Jonker gives a chance to Jannes-Kilian Horn (Wolfsburg).
Andries Jonker prepares a substitution. Daniel Didavi is replaced by Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg).
