That was a nice football moment. Jairo Samperio (Mainz) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the left post. Koen Casteels guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! The linesman makes the right call and Mainz will have a corner.
It will be a substitution. Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) is ready to enter the pitch as Pablo De Blasis walks off.
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Jhon Cordoba and he is replaced by Robin Quaison (Mainz).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the underside of the crossbar is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper. Darmstadt force a corner. They send men into the box.
Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) connects with a cross from out wide in the six-yard box, but only plants his header onto the right post.
Alexander Nouri prepares a substitution. Zlatko Junuzovic is replaced by Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen).
Alexander Nouri is forced to make a change. Clemens Fritz is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen).
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the left post!
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies narrowly wide of the right post.
What was Hamit Altintop (Darmstadt) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Here is a change. Mario Vrancic is going off and Torsten Frings gives the last tactical orders to Leon Guwara (Darmstadt).
Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Guido Winkmann blows his whistle for a foul. Werder Bremen are awarded a penalty kick!
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) converts the penalty with ease by slotting the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal after the goalkeeper guesses wrong and dives the opposite way!
Substitution. Claudio Pizarro makes his way off the pitch and Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) comes on as his replacement.
Torsten Frings decides to make a substitution. Fabian Holland will be replaced by Terrance Boyd (Darmstadt).
Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Sidney Sam comes off the pitch to be replaced by Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt).
Goal! Fin Bartels tees up Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.

What a beautiful moment! Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way inside the right post. Peter Gulacsi just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 1:0.
Goal! Naby Keita displays great vision and sends a pass to Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the left post. The score is 1:1.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) for his blatant foul.
Jan Moravek (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Patrick Ittrich had an easy-decision to make.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) is booked for saying more than Patrick Ittrich was willing to tolerate.
The end of the first half.
Patrick Ittrich blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Georg Teigl (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch for Raphael Framberger.

Marvin Compper (RB Leipzig) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Emil Forsberg. His header was precise and ended up inside the right post, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 1:2.
We are about to witness a substitution. Moritz Leitner (Augsburg) is replacing Dong-Won Ji.
Goal! Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) gathered the ball off a rebound inside the box and fired home into the left side of the net.
Marwin Hitz (Augsburg) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Patrick Ittrich lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Today's match ends for Jan Moravek who will be replaced by Halil Altintop (Augsburg).
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to make a change. Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig) replaces Diego Demme.
A yellow card for a tackle by Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig). Patrick Ittrich doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) misses a great chance to score after his effort hits the left post!
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) gets a precise pass from the edge of the box and swiftly strikes, but his shot misses to the left of the target.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.

Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
What a goal! Guido Burgstaller plays it to Alessandro Schopf (Schalke), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Oliver Baumann into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Good chance for Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) as he latched on to a cross on the edge of the box and blasted the ball towards the net! It flew wide of the crossbar.
Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) attempts to score with a first-time shot from the edge of the box. His effort towards the bottom right corner is saved by Ralf Fahrmann.

Ralf Fahrmann can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim). The ball would have probably ended up inside the right post.
Deniz Aytekin has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a change. Max Meyer (Schalke) replaces Daniel Caligiuri.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Ermin Bicakcic as he is replaced by Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Nadiem Amiri walks off the pitch to be replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
The referee Deniz Aytekin awards Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) a yellow card.
The referee shows the yellow card to Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) replaces Marco Terrazzino.

A perfect lofted pass from Steven Zuber finds Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header in the countermovement of the goalkeeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Ralf Fahrmann had no chance of stopping that. 1:1.
That will be all from Sead Kolasinac who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Dennis Aogo (Schalke).
Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) slams the ball goalwards from 25 metres out, but his decent effort flies a whisker wide of the left post.
Markus Weinzierl decides to make a substitution. Guido Burgstaller will be replaced by Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke).
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) picks up a pass and has an effort from the edge of the box, but Oliver Baumann gets down to his right to keep it out.
Deniz Aytekin is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Anthony Jung (Ingolstadt) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads towards the bottom right corner, but is stopped by a great save from Martin Hansen and the score remains the same.
A dangerous towering header by Marcel Tisserand (Ingolstadt) from around the penalty spot goes just over the bar. This corner kick didn't change the score.
Anthony Jung (Ingolstadt) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Maik Walpurgis has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Roger (Ingolstadt) comes on the pitch for Anthony Jung.

Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Martin Hansen guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Marcel Tisserand (Ingolstadt) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the left side of the goal. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save.

Goal! Oscar Wendt sent in a fine cross from the corner kick. The perfect pass found Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) and his bullet header from around the penalty spot went straight into the right side of the goal. The score is 0:1.
Substitution. Tobias Strobl is replaced by Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach).
Yellow card! It's like Marcel Tisserand (Ingolstadt) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Christian Dingert agrees and books him.
Today's match ends for Marcel Tisserand who will be replaced by Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt).
Fabian Johnson links up with Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach), who fires just wide of the left post from the edge of the box.
It is time for a substitution. Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) is on for Pascal Gross.
Substitution. Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) on for Josip Drmic.
The substitution has been made. Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) has replaced Lars Stindl.

Yann Sommer hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) shoots from the edge of the box towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
What a goal! Mahmoud Dahoud plays it to Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Martin Hansen into the bottom left corner. 0:2.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a pass and hits the ball towards goal, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Rune Jarstein. The linesman points to the corner flag, Eintracht Frankfurt are going to take it.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Sascha Stegemann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

What a save from Lukas Hradecky! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Goal! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 1:0.
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Sascha Stegemann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Here's the change. Max Besuschkow leaves the pitch and Shani Tarashaj (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
We are about to witness a substitution. Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt) is replacing Guillermo Varela.
Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Sascha Stegemann shows a red card with no hesitation. Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) can have an early bath and think about his challenge.
Substitution. Salomon Kalou will be replaced by Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin).

Maximilian Mittelstadt sends a superb cross into the box. Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the right post, leaving Lukas Hradecky beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:0.
Sebastian Langkamp goes off the pitch and Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Pal Dardai has decided to substitute Vladimir Darida and he is replaced by Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot, but is thwarted by a decent save from Bernd Leno.

Stefan Bell (Mainz) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Levin Oztunali. His bullet header went towards the middle of the goal and behind the goalkeeper. It's 0:1.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Levin Oztunali (Mainz), whose header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Brand had an easy-decision to make. Mainz have a free kick.
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) fires the ball from the free kick with a knuckleball of a shot from distance, the ball changes direction in the air and forces the goalkeeper into making a complete howler!
A header by Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) from very close range goes towards the middle of the target, but doesn't get past Jonas Lossl, who makes a nice save.

Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) blew a promising chance when he got to a rebound just outside the penalty area. He struck it towards the top of the net, but the Jonas Lossl pulled off a nice save. Bayer Leverkusen have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Bernd Leno makes a great save to stop his effort.
Benjamin Brand has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Here comes a substitution. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Aleksandar Dragovic.

Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) takes the resulting free kick from 20 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the roof of the net, but Jonas Lossl is alert and keeps the ball out. The ball goes out of play. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
Here's the change. Kai Havertz leaves the pitch and Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
Here comes a substitution. Pablo De Blasis is given a rest as he is replaced by Robin Quaison (Mainz).
Here is a change. Lars Bender is going off and Roger Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Vladlen Yurchenko (Bayer Leverkusen).
Danny Latza (Mainz) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Martin Schmidt has decided to make a change. Jairo Samperio (Mainz) replaces Yoshinori Muto.
Today's match ends for Jhon Cordoba who will be replaced by Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz).
Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) is yellow-carded.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.

Douglas Santos (Hamburger) gets the ball from a rebound before trying his luck with a good long-range shot which threatens the goalkeeper! The ball sails painfully wide of the right post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.
What a goal! Thomas Muller plays it to Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Rene Adler into the bottom left corner. 1:0.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) fails to beat the keeper from a good chance. He received a nice lofted pass inside the box and shot towards the middle of the target, but the goalkeeper deflected the ball onto the post with a quick reaction save and maybe some luck.

Mergim Mavraj (Hamburger) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Bastian Dankert no option but to blow his whistle. Bayern Munich are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Rene Adler to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
What a chance that is! Douglas Costa swings the ball into the box, and Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the right post.
Douglas Santos (Hamburger) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

Rene Adler was forced into action to thwart Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 3:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Manuel Neuer to dive and make a save.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop.

Stunning strike! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise through ball from Arjen Robben before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 4:0.
Goal David Alaba (Bayern Munich)! David Alaba (Bayern Munich) was put through by Thomas Muller and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. 5:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) will replace Robert Lewandowski.
Markus Gisdol has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) replacing Michael Gregoritsch.
Substitution. Thiago Alcantara did his best and is replaced by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).
Nicolai Muller will be replaced by Aaron Hunt (Hamburger).

Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) scores a goal after nicely controlling a pass and unleashing a powerful close-range shot into the bottom right corner. The keeper couldn't do anything to stop this wonderful effort.
Substitution. Philipp Lahm will be replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).

Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the left post. He couldn't have done it any better. 7:0.
Markus Gisdol prepares a substitution. Filip Kostic is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger).
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Rene Adler with a strike into the bottom left corner. He makes it 8:0.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Substitution. Jan Rosenthal will be replaced by Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt).
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Jochen Drees starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Torsten Frings decided to make a change. Sidney Sam is replaced by Terrance Boyd (Darmstadt).
Jerome Gondorf provides Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Referee Jochen Drees sees the trip by Alexander Milosevic (Darmstadt) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. The referee blows the whistle and gives a penalty to Augsburg!!
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) smoothly converts the penalty with a stunning effort which ends up inside the right post.
We are about to witness a substitution. Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt) is replacing Antonio-Mirko Colak.
Manuel Baum decides to make a substitution. Jan Moravek will be replaced by Moritz Leitner (Augsburg).
Goal! Dong-Won Ji gets to the ball, slips Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) into the area and he scores with a delightful chipped finish to make it 1:2.
Jochen Drees shows a yellow card to Marcel Heller (Darmstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Julian Gunther-Schmidt (Augsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Raul Bobadilla.
Substitution. Raphael Framberger (Augsburg) replaces Ja-Cheol Koo.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
GOAL! Raphael Guerreiro curls the free kick into the box. Sokratis (Dortmund) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past Alexander Schwolow and into the right side of the net. 0:1.
Substitution. Onur Bulut walks off the pitch and Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg) comes on as a substitute.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Alexander Schwolow.
Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Goal! Marco Reus puts the ball across the area and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 0:2.
Christian Streich is forced to make a change. Nils Petersen is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg).
Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Daniel Siebert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Great ball in from Ousmane Dembele. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.
It's in the back of the net! Erik Durm sprays a pass out to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:3.
The manager makes a subsitution with Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) coming on for Ousmane Dembele.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang leaves the pitch and Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) comes on.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Marco Reus and he is replaced by Christian Pulisic (Dortmund).
Here is a change. Lukas Kubler is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Aleksandar Ignjovski (Freiburg).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
GOAL! Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 1:0.
What was Dominic Maroh (Koln) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the roof of the net. Thomas Kessler pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The referee signals a corner kick to RB Leipzig.
Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) latches on to the corner kick inside the box, but his header crashes against the crossbar! The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
Thomas Kessler receives a loud ovation as he stops a dangerous header towards the left post from Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) after a rebound. What a reflex save!
What a chance that is! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar.
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Dominic Maroh (Koln), who attempted to block the ball after a cross, but instead he sends it inside the bottom left corner of his own goal.
Konstantin Rausch (Koln) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Marco Fritz has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Peter Stoger decided to make a change. Dominic Maroh is replaced by Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln).
Goal Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln)! Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) was put through by Pawel Olkowski and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom right corner. 2:1.
Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Emil Forsberg trots off the pitch and is replaced by Rani Khedira (RB Leipzig).
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Thomas Kessler with a strike into the bottom left corner. He makes it 3:1.
Marco Hoger (Koln) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) leaps highest around the penalty spot to meet a cross from the free kick and produces a promising goal-bound header towards the roof of the net, but Thomas Kessler pulls off a fine save to deny him. RB Leipzig force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Substitution. Milos Jojic (Koln) replaces Marco Hoger.
Yellow card. Jonas Hector (Koln) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
We are about to witness a substitution. Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) is replacing Timo Werner.
Here is a change. Naby Keita is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig).
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) receives a quality pass and unleashes a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just over the crossbar. The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one.
Goal! Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) picks up the ball inside the box, finds himself in a good position and fires in a shot which is deflected past Diego Benaglio. He makes it 0:1.
Goal! Lamine Ludovic Sane connects with the free kick and heads it into the path of Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen), who makes no mistake and puts it into the net. 0:2.
GOAL - 1:2! The corner comes over and Daniel Didavi flicks on with his head to Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg), who makes no mistake and fires the ball into the back of the net.

Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Felix Wiedwald guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Felix Wiedwald can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg). The ball would have probably ended up inside the left post.
Close! Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) takes the resulting free kick from a promising positon, but his effort flies inches wide of the right post.

OFF THE POST! Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The foul by Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Wolfgang Stark.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Felix Wiedwald gets a well deserved ovation! He pulls off a remarkable save to block a long-range effort from Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) towards the roof of the net. Nice goalkeeping skills!
The referee allows time for a substitution. Fin Bartels will be replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
That will be all from Daniel Didavi who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg).
The expression of the referee Wolfgang Stark is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Felix Wiedwald (Werder Bremen) is shown a yellow card.
Valerien Ismael has decided to substitute Borja Mayoral and he is replaced by Paul Ntep de Madiba (Wolfsburg).
The substitution is prepared. Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Maximilian Eggestein.
Valerien Ismael decides to make a substitution. Christian Trasch will be replaced by Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Serge Gnabry makes way for Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Lamine Ludovic Sane (Werder Bremen) is booked.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Daniel Caligiuri sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 0:1.
Neven Subotic (Koln) gets a yellow card.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) accepts a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot towards the goal, but he only hits the left post! What an unlucky moment for him.
Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads under the crossbar, but is stopped by a great save from Ralf Fahrmann.
Goal! Yuya Osako slips it to Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom right corner with a great effort. The score is 1:1.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Tobias Stieler shows the yellow card to Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Naldo (Schalke) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Max Meyer (Schalke) has come on for Daniel Caligiuri.
The foul by Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Stieler.
We are about to witness a substitution. Simon Zoller (Koln) is replacing Milos Jojic.
What a big chance! Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Markus Weinzierl decides to make a substitution. Guido Burgstaller will be replaced by Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke).
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) received a precise pass and hammers the ball at goal from close range. Unfortunately for him, his aim was a bit off and it flies just over the bar.
Max Meyer (Schalke) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Thomas Kessler makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom right corner.
Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Tobias Stieler ignores the protests.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Thilo Kehrer (Schalke) is coming onto the pitch as Nabil Bentaleb cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

What a huge opportunity! Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with a close-range strike towards the bottom left corner. The amazing Yann Sommer deserves an ovation from the fans as he pulls off a spectacular save and pushes the ball onto the post. The referee signals a corner kick to RB Leipzig.
Brilliant finish! Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Timo Werner, then produced a nice strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:1.
Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.

Marvin Compper (RB Leipzig) makes a reckless foul in order to win the ball from his opponent. Felix Zwayer has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle. Penalty awarded! B. Monchengladbach will take a penalty kick.
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) receives a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) misses the penalty and holds his head in his hands after the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save by diving to the left side of the goal! B. Monchengladbach have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Goal Timo Werner (RB Leipzig)! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) was put through by Emil Forsberg and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 0:2.
Goal, no wait. Felix Zwayer blows his whistle for handball and Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) can't celebrate. Disallowed goal.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) receives a yellow card!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch for Oscar Wendt.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Andre Hahn and he is replaced by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) blows a clear opportunity to score a goal. He was one-on-one with Peter Gulacsi inside the six-yard box and attempted to put the ball low into the middle of the target, but was denied by a great save. It will be a corner kick for B. Monchengladbach.
The substitution has been made. Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) has replaced Oliver Burke.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) for his blatant foul.
Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. Naby Keita walks off the pitch and Rani Khedira (RB Leipzig) comes on as a substitute.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer had an easy-decision to make.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) is coming onto the pitch as Fabian Johnson cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Thorgan Hazard sends the resulting corner into the box and expertly finds Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the roof of the net. It's 1:2.
Substitution. Emil Forsberg will be replaced by Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.

Filip Kostic (Hamburger) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Filip Kostic (Hamburger) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Hamburger SV.
GOAL! Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) finishes off a sublime move with a delightful back-heel goal. Lewis Holtby provided the assist with a brilliant pass. 1:0.
Goal! Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Nils Petersen, then sends the ball inside the left post. 1:1.
Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the bottom right corner is thwarted by Rene Adler.
Johan Djourou (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Kyriakos Papadopoulos.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg).
Gideon Jung (Hamburger) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Vincenzo Grifo, but he can't get on the end of the pass.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Christian Dingert has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Dennis Diekmeier is replaced by Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger).
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) breaks into the penalty area but his shot is blocked.
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) picks up a yellow card.
Goal! Gotoku Sakai puts the ball on a plate for Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 2:1.
Filip Kostic (Hamburger) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Here comes a substitution. Mike Frantz (Freiburg) is brought on as a substitute for Amir Abrashi.
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Goal - 2:2! Nils Petersen laid the ball off to Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Johan Djourou (Hamburger) is booked.
This should have been a goal! Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) sends a killer pass into the box, but Walace can't trick the opposition's defence and loses possession.
A substitution has been made. Walace is replaced by Albin Ekdal (Hamburger).
Christian Streich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) replacing Janik Haberer.

Marc Torrejon (Freiburg) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Christian Dingert blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. The referee blows his whistle and awards Hamburger SV a penalty after chaos inside the box.
Alexander Schwolow anticipates the direction of the penalty by Aaron Hunt (Hamburger). He attempted to put the ball into the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper was there in time to deny him.
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Vincenzo Grifo is replaced by Onur Bulut (Freiburg).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick low shot towards the middle of the goal. His effort lacks pace and that allows Diego Benaglio to make a comfortable save.
Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg) attempts to head the ball away after a cross into the penalty area, but instead he accidentally sends it past his own goalkeeper.
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Diego Benaglio is alert and denies him.
Valerien Ismael is forced to make a change. Paul Seguin is unable to continue due to injury, Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) comes on.
The free kick from the edge of the box is taken by Andre Schurrle (Dortmund), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the left post. What a chance!
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) gets a precise pass from the edge of the box and swiftly strikes, but his shot misses to the left of the target.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Gunter Perl has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Matthias Ginter finds Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) with a headed pass and the latter glances a header past the goalkeeper to make it 2:0.
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) accepts a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot towards the goal, but he only hits the left post! What an unlucky moment for him.
Julian Weigl (Dortmund) has tested the patience of referee Gunter Perl and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

It's a goal! Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) makes it 3:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Lukasz Piszczek and planted his close-range header into the top right corner. Diego Benaglio was helpless.
The game has come to an end for Mario Gomez. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Paul Ntep de Madiba (Wolfsburg).
Here is a change. Ousmane Dembele is going off and Thomas Tuchel gives the last tactical orders to Christian Pulisic (Dortmund).
The manager makes a subsitution with Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) coming on for Ousmane Dembele.
Substitution. Vieirinha walks off the pitch and Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg) comes on as a substitute.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) tests the keeper from the free kick on the edge of the box. His decent effort goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to make a change. Mikel Merino (Dortmund) replaces Julian Weigl.
Booking. Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg) receives a caution from the referee.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Andre Schurrle (Dortmund).
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card.
Goal! Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the right post. He makes it 0:1.

It's a foul from David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt). Surprisingly, the referee comes and pulls out a red card. It was a very harsh one and David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) complains, but it's no use of course. The decision has been made.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is shown a yellow card by the referee for dissent.

Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the resulting corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly over the crossbar.
Niko Kovac is forced to make a change. Jesus Vallejo is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Guido Winkmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.

Lukas Hradecky (Eintracht Frankfurt) deprives his opponent of the ball, but the referee blows his whistle for a foul. He's not happy with the decision! Joy for one side, despair for the other as the referee gives a penalty to Ingolstadt!
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) is going to take the penalty!

Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot inside the right post. Martin Hansen anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and leaps to stop his effort.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) couldn’t be in a better position to score from the rebound! Nevertheless, he only smashes the ball into the crossbar!
The substitution is prepared. Roger (Ingolstadt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Marcel Tisserand.
Niko Kovac has decided to substitute Aymen Barkok and he is replaced by Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes a strong challenge and Guido Winkmann blows for a foul. A penalty is given to Ingolstadt!
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a yellow card.
Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) gave the goalkeeper no chance from the penalty. Lukas Hradecky failed to reach the ball, which slid off the crossbar into the roof of the net.
Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) receives a red card after his awful challenge. He completely lost his temper and referee Guido Winkmann sends him off the pitch.
The referee signals a substitution. Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Alexander Meier.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dario Lezcano trots off the pitch and is replaced by Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt).
The game has come to an end for Almog Cohen. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt).
That's it for today, Guido Winkmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
A cross from the free kick is whipped deep into the box by Marvin Plattenhardt and Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) gets in a shot, sending the ball inside the left post. 1:0.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.

What a chance! The ball is inside the box and Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) takes a first-time shot on goal, but his volley goes narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch so that Arturo Vidal can be given a rest.
Here is a change. Joshua Kimmich is going off and Carlo Ancelotti gives the last tactical orders to Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich).
What was Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch for Juan Bernat.
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) replacing Vedad Ibisevic.

David Alaba (Bayern Munich) has the opportunity to threaten the opponent's goal via a free kick on the edge of the box. He hits a fine strike towards the right side of the goal, but Rune Jarstein denies him with a great save. The ball goes out of play. Bayern Munich are awarded a corner kick.
Substitution. Salomon Kalou leaves the pitch and is replaced by Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin).
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Genki Haraguchi will be replaced by Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin).
Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Patrick Ittrich had an easy-decision to make.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) bursts into the box for a cross from the set piece and tries to score. The ball flies off his boot towards the right post, but one of the defenders meets it halfway and stops the shot.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 1:1.
Rune Jarstein (Hertha Berlin) goes into the referee's book for dissent.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.

What an opportunity! Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes towards the left side of the goal, but Michael Esser reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Torsten Frings is forced to make a change. Jan Rosenthal is unable to continue due to injury, Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) comes on.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Here is a change. Kerem Demirbay is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim).
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Terrance Boyd comes off the pitch to be replaced by Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt).
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
Marco Terrazzino goes off the pitch and Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Substitution. Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Nadiem Amiri walks off.
Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Torsten Frings has decided to substitute Jerome Gondorf and he is replaced by Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt).
Sidney Sam (Darmstadt) gets a yellow card.
A yellow card for a tackle by Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The yellow card goes to Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt).
The booking goes to Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt).
Hamit Altintop (Darmstadt) brings his opponent down. Felix Brych has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle for a foul. A penalty is awarded to Hoffenheim!
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Hamit Altintop (Darmstadt) is given a yellow card.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) is going to take the penalty!
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) sends Michael Esser the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header perfectly into the right side of the goal. He makes it 0:1.
Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) shoots from the free kick just outside the box, hitting the top right corner. Football supporters are always pleased to see such a fabulous goal.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Giulio Donati (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Deniz Aytekin had an easy-decision to make.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Martin Schmidt probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Levin Oztunali. He is replaced by Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Danny Latza (Mainz) has tested the patience of referee Deniz Aytekin and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. That's a free kick to Werder Bremen.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
Substitution. Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) on for Thomas Delaney.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Jairo Samperio (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
The referee signals a substitution. Aaron Seydel (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Bojan Krkic.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Deniz Aytekin had an easy-decision to make.
The manager makes a subsitution with Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) coming on for Serge Gnabry.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Giulio Donati walks off the pitch to be replaced by Gaetan Bussmann (Mainz).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) replaces Zlatko Junuzovic.
Felix Wiedwald (Werder Bremen) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
What a big chance! Georg Teigl (Augsburg) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball well wide of the left post.

This was a piece of cake for Marwin Hitz. Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper. Bayer Leverkusen have a corner.

Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Marwin Hitz guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
What a big chance! Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.

Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Bayer Leverkusen.
Goal - 0:1! Kai Havertz laid the ball off to Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen), who shot from close range low into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Goal! Lars Bender displays great vision and sends a pass to Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the top right corner. The score is 0:2.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Lars Bender walks off the pitch to be replaced by Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen).
The foul by Philipp Max (Augsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Harm Osmers.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Harm Osmers has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) controls a nice lofted pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but his attempt only went low to the middle of the goal, so Bernd Leno stops it easily.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) picks up a pass and fires a powerful long-range shot which goes painfully close to the left post.

Nice individual effort by Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the middle of the goal, but Bernd Leno does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.
A substitution has been made. Julian Brandt goes off and Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Goal! Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Ja-Cheol Koo, then sends the ball low into the middle of the net. 1:2.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card for a foul.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
GOAL! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Marwin Hitz, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:3.
Substitution. Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) in, Chicharito out.
Here is a change. Georg Teigl is going off and Manuel Baum gives the last tactical orders to Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Marwin Hitz is alert and denies him.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) stands over the resultant free kick from mid-range, but his shot goes just over the crossbar. It could have been a fantastic goal!
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Harm Osmers didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Dominik Kohr will be replaced by Moritz Leitner (Augsburg).

Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and releases a quick shot to the bottom right corner. His promising effort is kept out by Marwin Hitz, who pulls off a stunning save!
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Marc Torrejon (Freiburg) connects with a cross near the penalty spot and produces a decent header which rattles the left post!
Jonas Hector (Koln) jumps highest to meet an accurate cross and heads the ball towards the net. His fine header whistles just inches wide of the right post.
Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) makes a run to receive the ball and produces a powerful from mid-range which deflects in off the crossbar, beating the surprised goalkeeper.
Marco Hoger is substituted due to injury. Peter Stoger gives a chance to Christian Clemens (1. FC Koln).
Goal! Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range low towards the middle of the net, but Alexander Schwolow was alert and made an amazing save!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Janik Haberer (Freiburg) was quite harsh and Robert Hartmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
It's time for a substitution. Nils Petersen (Freiburg) comes on in place of Florian Niederlechner.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Mike Frantz walks off the pitch to be replaced by Julian Schuster (Freiburg).
Goal! Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 2:1.
Here is a change. Leonardo Bittencourt is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln).
A yellow card for bad language! Jonas Hector (Koln) couldn’t remain silent and the result is obvious.
Here comes a substitution. Aleksandar Ignjovski (Freiburg) is brought on as a substitute for Vincenzo Grifo.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul.

Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) takes the free kick from just outside the box and attempts to convert it into a goal. He hits it magnificently and the keeper must be relieved to see the ball hit the bar and ricochet away.
Mark Uth is substituted due to injury. Julian Nagelsmann gives a chance to Marco Terrazzino (Hoffenheim).
Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.

Kerem Demirbay produces a sweet pass and picks out Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 0:1!
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Valerien Ismael makes a switch. Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) is coming on in place of Riechedly Bazoer at the start of the second period.

Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the bottom left corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 1:1.

Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads towards the top left corner, but is stopped by a great save from Oliver Baumann and the score remains the same. Corner kick. Wolfsburg will have an opportunity.
Andrej Kramaric comes off the pitch to be replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).

Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his strike towards the top right corner as Diego Benaglio produces a good save. The ball is out of play and Hoffenheim manage to earn a corner.
Substitution. Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg) in, Vieirinha out.

What a great touch by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick.

Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) finds himself some space inside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Oliver Baumann pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going into the bottom left corner.
Goal! Robin Knoche gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 2:1.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Daniel Siebert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Oliver Baumann is alert and denies him.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nadiem Amiri leaves the pitch and Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) lunges into his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
A yellow card is awarded to Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim).
It will be a substitution. Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Yunus Malli walks off.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
CHANCE! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.

What a great touch by Leon Goretzka (Schalke)! He picks up a precise pass on the edge of the box and immediately unleashes a shot on goal. His effort, however, only rattles the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.

Leon Goretzka (Schalke) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom right corner, but Rune Jarstein was alert and the score remained the same. The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) converts a killer cross with a precise low shot that goes into the bottom left corner. What a brilliant finish!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Markus Schmidt has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) comes on the pitch for Valentin Stocker.
Close! Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Good team movement sets up Naldo (Schalke) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee gives a yellow card to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin).

Goal! Leon Goretzka (Schalke) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom left corner. Rune Jarstein had no chance of reaching it. The score is 2:0.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Salomon Kalou walks off the pitch to be replaced by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin).
What a huge chance for Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Daniel Caligiuri is replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).
Here comes a substitution. Genki Haraguchi is given a rest as he is replaced by Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin).
Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to substitute Leon Goretzka and he is replaced by Thilo Kehrer (Schalke).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) for Guido Burgstaller.
That's it for today, Markus Schmidt has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Goal! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Bernd Leno pulls off a great save to deny Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
Yellow card. Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot at goal. His effort is blocked by Bernd Leno with a brilliant diving save!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Florian Badstubner didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Florian Badstubner starts the second half.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes onto the pitch so that Mijat Gacinovic can be given a rest.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper blocks the effort.
Today's match ends for Lars Bender who will be replaced by Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen).
What a goal! Karim Bellarabi plays it to Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Lukas Hradecky into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
Here is a change. Alexander Meier is going off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical orders to Shani Tarashaj (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Chicharito leaves the pitch and Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Here's the change. Branimir Hrgota leaves the pitch and Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
Goal! Karim Bellarabi puts a cross into the box and finds Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen), who latches on to it and strikes the ball low into the middle of the net. He makes it 3:0.

Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Lukas Hradecky is alert and denies him with a nice save. Bayer Leverkusen have been awarded a corner kick.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Lukas Hradecky is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. It will be a corner kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Kai Havertz will be replaced by Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen).
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) latches on to a cross from the free kick and attempts to direct a bullet header into the top of the net. Roman Burki is alert, though, and makes a great save to deny him.
What a chance that is! Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the right post!
It's in the back of the net! Terrance Boyd (Darmstadt) gets on the end of a brilliant pass and scores a great goal after finding the back of the net by striking the ball past the goalkeeper!

Marco Reus (Dortmund) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Michael Esser makes a great save to stop the effort going into the bottom right corner.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box. His rocket of a shot crashes against the crossbar! What a shot.

Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the left post. He couldn't have done it any better. 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) replaces Terrance Boyd.
Thomas Tuchel prepares a substitution. Raphael Guerreiro is replaced by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund).
Here comes a substitution. Emre Mor is given a rest as he is replaced by Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund).

Goal! Sidney Sam plays in Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box slots it into the bottom left corner 2:1.

What a sweet touch by Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) after latching on to a fine pass on the edge of the box! He finds some space and unleashes a cannonball towards the roof of the net. The goalkeeper makes a brilliant save, pushing the ball onto the post.

Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) blew a promising chance when he got to a rebound just outside the penalty area. He struck it towards the middle of the target, but Roman Burki pulled off a nice save to stop the attempt.

Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the right side of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Michael Esser (Darmstadt) picks up a caution.
Marco Reus goes off the pitch and Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) comes on.
Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Dzenis Burnic (Dortmund) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Torsten Frings has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Leon Guwara (Darmstadt) replacing Fabian Holland.
Substitution. Artem Fedetsky makes way for Markus Steinhofer (Darmstadt).
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch for Xabi Alonso.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) for his blatant foul.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Joshua Kimmich makes his way off the pitch and Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) comes on as his replacement.
Maik Walpurgis prepares a substitution. Dario Lezcano is replaced by Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Pascal Gross is replaced by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt).
It's time for a substitution. Rafinha (Bayern Munich) comes on in place of Philipp Lahm.
What a shot! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) decides to unleash a long-range missile of a shot, but his effort smashes against the right post.
Substitution. Anthony Jung (Ingolstadt) replaces Mathew Leckie.

What a wonderful finish! Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and drills a low shot into the bottom right corner. There are not enough superlatives to describe that goal.

A superb goal from great team play! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the left post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) is awarded a yellow card.

Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) connects with the ball from the resulting corner and places a powerful header past the stranded goalkeeper and into the roof of the net. The opposing players are staring at each other, unable to understand what happened. Who will take the blame for that one? Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) has a reason to celebrate!
The resulting corner is whipped in by Nicolai Muller and Walace (Hamburger) is left unmarked to plant a precise header into the top left corner. The score is 0:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) comes onto the pitch for Dayot Upamecano.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Problems for Ralph Hasenhuttl as Yussuf Poulsen is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) replaces him.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make.
The game has come to an end for Bernardo. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Benno Schmitz (RB Leipzig).
A yellow card is awarded to Willi Orban (RB Leipzig).
We are about to witness a substitution. Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) is replacing Filip Kostic.
Gideon Jung (Hamburger) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.

What a chance that is! Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the crossbar!
The substitution has been made. Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) has replaced Lewis Holtby.
Markus Gisdol has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) replacing Bobby Wood.
It's in the back of the net! Nicolai Muller is the provider as he slips the ball to Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 0:3.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Felix Wiedwald is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:1.

Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Yann Sommer leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) blew a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross deep inside the box, but his shot flew just over the bar.
Benjamin Brand has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Milos Veljkovic is replaced by Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen).
The game is over for Santiago Garcia. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) comes on for the second half.

Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by Felix Wiedwald, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach).
Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann did his best and is replaced by Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
What was Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Serge Gnabry leaves the pitch and Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Andre Hahn and he is replaced by Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach).
Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
The game has come to an end for Mahmoud Dahoud. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Nico Schulz (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Jonas Lossl stops the ball from hitting the bottom left corner.

Stefan Bell sends a superb cross into the box. Levin Oztunali (Mainz) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Marwin Hitz beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Manuel Grafe has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Dong-Won Ji did his best and is replaced by Halil Altintop (Augsburg).
Manuel Baum decides to make a substitution. Jonathan Schmid will be replaced by Georg Teigl (Augsburg).
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Danny Latza (Mainz) gets booked.
Manuel Grafe blows the whistle, Marwin Hitz (Augsburg) is penalised for a foul. Mainz are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
Marwin Hitz (Augsburg) earns the yellow card.
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Marwin Hitz to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
A substitution has been made. Bojan Krkic is replaced by Yoshinori Muto (Mainz).
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg).
Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) is cautioned by the referee.
What a save from Jonas Lossl! Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Takashi Usami (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch so that Philipp Max can be given a rest.
Martin Schmidt has decided to make a change. Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) replaces Jairo Samperio.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jhon Cordoba departs the field of play to be replaced by Aaron Seydel (Mainz).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
