Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.

This was a piece of cake for Michael Esser. Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.

David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt). This could have been a legendary goal.
A yellow card for a tackle by Marcel Heller (Darmstadt). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
A cross arrives in the goalmouth from the resulting corner kick. Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the right post!
The foul by Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe.

Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Manuel Grafe starts the second half.

Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Torsten Frings prepares a substitution. Sidney Sam is replaced by Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt).

Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
A goal, which was scored by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt), was disallowed due to offside.
Here is a change. Terrance Boyd is going off and Torsten Frings gives the last tactical orders to Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt).

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads towards the middle of the goal, but is easily stopped by a save from Michael Esser and the score remains the same.

Manuel Grafe blows for a foul after Alexander Milosevic (Darmstadt) was too aggressive in the battle for the ball. PENALTY! One of the players from Eintracht Frankfurt is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Alexander Milosevic (Darmstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Manuel Grafe ignores the protests.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) is going to take the penalty!
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) steps up and confidently powers his spot-kick into the bottom right corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Branimir Hrgota leaves the pitch and Shani Tarashaj (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Torsten Frings has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Hamit Altintop (Darmstadt) replacing Peter Niemeyer.
Shani Tarashaj (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses an absolute sitter after connecting with a cross inside the penalty box.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.

Goal! Alexander Meier displays great vision and sends a pass to Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 2:0.
Here comes a substitution. Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Mijat Gacinovic.
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Max Besuschkow (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Omar Mascarell.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
Artem Fedetsky (Darmstadt) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

What a wasted opportunity by Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the middle of the net, but Felix Wiedwald makes a comfortable save to thwart him.
Goal! Robert Bauer connects with the free kick and heads it into the path of Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen), who makes no mistake and puts it into the net. 0:1.
Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) finds himself in a very promising position after getting on the end of a brilliant pass and fires the ball inside the right post!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Christian Dingert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Gojko Kacar (Augsburg) will replace Halil Altintop.
A yellow card is awarded to Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jonathan Schmid leaves the pitch and Georg Teigl (Augsburg) comes on.
Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Christian Dingert blows his whistle for a foul. The referee makes the call - penalty to Werder Bremen!
Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) gets a yellow card.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) scores from the penalty spot with a shot that goes inside the right post. How easy is that!
We are about to witness a subsitution. Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) for Fin Bartels.
Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. His effort sails well wide of the right post.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) meets a perfect cross from Paul Verhaegh deep inside the box, and he produces an accurate strike which goes into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:2.

Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the left post only for Marwin Hitz to dive and make a save. Werder Bremen will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Christian Dingert shows the yellow card to Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) for a heavy challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Serge Gnabry.
Goal! Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the left post. He makes it 3:2.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Bernardo (RB Leipzig) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Stieler didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) is strong enough to get to the ball and produces a header from close range. Even though the header was directed to the left side of the goal, Roman Burki didn't have a hard time stopping the attempt as it wasn't powerful enough.

Chance! Ousmane Dembele sends a brilliant curling cross into the heart of the defence and into the path of Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), whose header from the centre of the box goes a whisker over the bar.
Goal! Ousmane Dembele produces a brilliant lofted pass and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets on the end of it to finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang slides a brilliant pass into Marco Reus (Dortmund), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.

What an amazing save by Peter Gulacsi! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the bottom right corner, but fails.
Thomas Tuchel is forced to make a change. Ousmane Dembele is unable to continue due to injury, Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) comes on.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) is coming onto the pitch as Rani Khedira cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) takes a first-time shot from the edge of the box, but his effort is well blocked by the defender.
Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Ralph Hasenhuttl prepares a substitution. Davie Selke is replaced by Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig).
A substitution has been made. Raphael Guerreiro goes off and Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) comes on.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to make a change. Federico Palacios-Martinez (RB Leipzig) replaces Dominik Kaiser.
Marvin Compper (RB Leipzig) uses bad language while talking to the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
Julian Weigl links up with Marco Reus (Dortmund), who fires just wide of the left post from the edge of the box.
Thomas Tuchel is forced to make a change. Marcel Schmelzer is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Felix Passlack (Dortmund).

Marco Reus (Dortmund) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Peter Gulacsi is alert and denies him. Corner kick. Dortmund will have an opportunity.

What a great touch by Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. The ball is out of play and Dortmund manage to earn a corner.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) earns the yellow card.
Federico Palacios-Martinez (RB Leipzig) has a goal ruled out for offside!
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
Close! Andreas Christensen (B. Monchengladbach) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.

Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom right corner. Yann Sommer has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
A brilliant individual effort! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the left post.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Christian Gunter (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch for Andre Hahn.

Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) blows a huge opportunity from inside the 6-yard box. He pounced on a rebound but headed it just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Freiburg will have a goal kick.
Goal! Fabian Johnson slips it to Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom right corner with a great effort. The score is 1:0.
It's in the back of the net! Mahmoud Dahoud sprays a pass out to Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lukas Kubler leaves the pitch and Aleksandar Ignjovski (Freiburg) comes on.
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Havard Kallevik Nielsen (Freiburg) replaces Florian Niederlechner.
It is time for a substitution. Julian Schuster (Freiburg) is on for Amir Abrashi.
A substitution has been made. Lars Stindl is replaced by Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Raffael.

Thorgan Hazard passes to Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 3:0.
That's it for today, Felix Brych has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
GOAL! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Ralf Fahrmann, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:0.

What a goal! Naldo (Schalke) didn't hesitate and slammed the ball straight into the bottom left corner. His first-time effort from about 20 metres was beyond the reach of Manuel Neuer and ended up in the back of the net.
Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) volleys the ball towards goal, but the goalkeeper makes a great save to deny him attempt. The referee blows his whistle, Schalke are awarded a corner kick.
Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a great save to deny Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.
It should have been a goal! Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) fires a rocket of a shot but it only hits the crossbar!
OFF THE BAR! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and fires a bullet of a shot that crashes against the crossbar.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) has a goal ruled out for offside!
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Holger Badstuber as he is replaced by Matija Nastasic (Schalke).
The game has begun to heat up. Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Arjen Robben.
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Guido Burgstaller is replaced by Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke).
Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Marco Fritz's book.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and David Alaba (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch so that Juan Bernat can be given a rest.
Carlo Ancelotti decides to make a substitution. Rafinha will be replaced by Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich).
Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Today's match ends for Leon Goretzka who will be replaced by Thilo Kehrer (Schalke).
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) tries his luck and takes a shot from inside the box. His effort on goal is blocked by a defender. Bayern Munich force a corner. They send men into the box.
That's it for today, Marco Fritz has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Christian Clemens (1. FC Koln) for a tough tackle.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Patrick Ittrich has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) gets a shot from inside the penalty area and it flies just wide of the left post.
Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Patrick Ittrich after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Substitution. Christian Clemens makes his way off the pitch and Simon Zoller (Koln) comes on as his replacement.
Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) gets booked for the first time in this match.

Thomas Kessler makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) on the edge of the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the roof of the net. The ball is out of play and Wolfsburg manage to earn a corner.
Substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt is replaced by Salih Ozcan (Koln).
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Pawel Olkowski (1. FC Koln) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Patrick Ittrich didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Patrick Ittrich blows his whistle after Diego Benaglio (Wolfsburg) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. It's a penalty to FC Koln! Let's see who's going to take it.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) is going to take the penalty!
Anthony Modeste (Koln) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the left side of the net.
Caution goes to Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg).
It's a yellow card for Thomas Kessler (Koln).
Valerien Ismael decides to make a substitution. Josuha Guilavogui will be replaced by Paul Ntep de Madiba (Wolfsburg).
That's the end of the game for Vieirinha, who is replaced by Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg).
Yuya Osako will be replaced by Dominic Maroh (Koln).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.

It's in! Salomon Kalou spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) doesn't think twice and rifles a first-time shot into the bottom right corner. The score is now 1:0.

Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the roof of the net. Martin Hansen pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) picks up a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Frank Willenborg didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
A yellow card for a tackle by Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt). Frank Willenborg doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Valentin Stocker cannot continue after picking up an injury.

What an opportunity! Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) leaps high to meet a beautiful cross into the box from the free kick, and he plants a header from near the penalty spot which goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Substitution. Roger walks off the pitch and Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) comes on as a substitute.
Here is a change. Max Christiansen is going off and Maik Walpurgis gives the last tactical orders to Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Robert Leipertz (Ingolstadt) comes onto the pitch so that Anthony Jung can be given a rest.
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) replacing Salomon Kalou.

Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the bottom left corner. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save.
Booking. Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) receives a caution from the referee.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Vedad Ibisevic as he is replaced by Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

Sebastian Rudy passes to Mark Uth (Hoffenheim), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:0.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) is given a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
CHANCE! Pavel Kaderabek finds Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the right post!
Oliver Baumann (Hoffenheim) is booked by the referee.
Here is a change. Jhon Cordoba is going off and Martin Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Levin Oztunali (Mainz).
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) picks up a yellow card.
The game has come to an end for Andrej Kramaric. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute  and he is replaced by Fabian Frei (Mainz).

Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Oliver Baumann leaps like a salmon to deny him.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yoshinori Muto departs the field of play to be replaced by Bojan Krkic (Mainz).
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Marco Terrazzino (Hoffenheim) replaces Mark Uth.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) produces a decent strike goalwards from the resulting set piece. His effort crashes against the crossbar and the ball stays out of the net. The goalkeeper was quite lucky!
An unlucky rebound falls to Marco Terrazzino (Hoffenheim) and he scores with a bullet header.
Benjamini Hubner goes off the pitch and Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) smashes the ball smartly with a volley from close range deep into the bottom left corner!
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

It's a goal! Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) makes it 4:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Nadiem Amiri and planted his close-range header into the right side of the goal. Jonas Lossl was helpless.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a caution.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Roger Schmidt makes a switch. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on in place of Julian Baumgartlinger at the start of the second period.
OFF THE WOODWORK! Bobby Wood (Hamburger) picks up the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot that smashes against the crossbar!
Here is a change. Karim Bellarabi is going off and Roger Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).
Jochen Drees shows a yellow card to Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant foul.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) leaps to meet a beautiful cross and produces a header which goes low inside the left post.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Substitution. Admir Mehmedi did his best and is replaced by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen).
CHANCE! Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!
Markus Gisdol has decided to substitute Nicolai Muller and he is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger).
Johan Djourou (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Lewis Holtby.
Substitution. Filip Kostic will be replaced by Aaron Hunt (Hamburger).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Brilliant finish! Marco Reus (Dortmund) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Andre Schurrle, then produced a nice strike into the left side of the goal. The score is 0:1.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
The end of the first half.
Felix Zwayer blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The foul by Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Zwayer.

Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him. The referee points to the corner flag and Dortmund will take a corner.
Substitution.  in, Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) out.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Raphael Guerreiro and he is replaced by Mario Gotze (Dortmund).
The manager makes a subsitution with Aaron Seydel (Mainz) coming on for Fabian Frei.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) replacing Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
That will be all from Yoshinori Muto who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) picks up a caution.
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Danny Latza (Mainz) jumps for a cross and plants a perfect header inside the left post.
Substitution. Gonzalo Castro makes his way off the pitch and Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) comes on as his replacement.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
A yellow card for a tackle by Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin). Gunter Perl doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Gunter Perl lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Fantastic team goal! Janik Haberer (Freiburg) was set free in the area by Vincenzo Grifo and he made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) for Salomon Kalou.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) replaces Valentin Stocker.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nils Petersen (Freiburg) replaces Florian Niederlechner.
Christian Streich decides to make a substitution. Janik Haberer will be replaced by Onur Bulut (Freiburg).
Substitution. Lukas Kubler did his best and is replaced by Aleksandar Ignjovski (Freiburg).
Pal Dardai prepares a substitution. Per Skjelbred is replaced by Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin).

Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom right corner. Rune Jarstein had no chance of reaching it. The score is 2:0.
Goal! Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 2:1.

Onur Bulut (Freiburg) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards the roof of the net, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper with a stunning save. The ball goes out of play. Freiburg are awarded a corner kick.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.

Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Hakan Calhanoglu. His header was precise and ended up inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 1:0.
Goal! Karim Bellarabi gets up really well from the corner and heads the ball into the six-yard box where Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) glances a header into the net. 2:0.
Deniz Aytekin has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the right side of the net.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.

The ball hits the back of the net! Oscar Wendt showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) manages to convert it into a sweet goal. He heads it inside the right post and gets on the scoresheet – 2:2.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Good work from B. Monchengladbach as they win a corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) will replace Benjamin Henrichs.
Roger Schmidt prepares a substitution. Aranguiz is replaced by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Thorgan Hazard makes his way off the pitch and Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as his replacement.

Goal! Christoph Kramer displays great vision and sends a pass to Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 2:3.
Roger Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Karim Bellarabi will be replaced by Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Raffael will be replaced by Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach).
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Jonas Hofmann.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Christian Clemens (Koln) produces a shot from a direct free kick on the edge of the box. His effort sails narrowly over the crossbar. The goalkeeper was lucky there.
Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) missed a big chance! He produces a stunning volley from inside the box, but his effort goes not far wide of the right post.
The whistle blows and Anthony Modeste (Koln) is booked for an infringement.
Alexander Milosevic (Darmstadt) gets a yellow card.
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. A slightly disorientated Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) puts the ball into his own net.
Goal! Leonardo Bittencourt produces a brilliant lofted pass and Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) gets on the end of it to finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 0:2.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Christian Clemens (Koln) is given a yellow card.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) finds some space deep inside the box to fire a volley into the back of the net, leaving the keeper helpless. A stunning goal!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Kampka has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Torsten Frings has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Artem Fedetsky (Darmstadt) comes on the pitch for Jan Rosenthal.
Christian Clemens (Koln) squandered a big chance from inside the box, firing his volley narrowly over the bar. What a waste.
Substitution. Anthony Modeste walks off the pitch and Artjoms Rudnevs (Koln) comes on as a substitute.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Terrance Boyd (Darmstadt).
Peter Stoger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Dominic Maroh (Koln) replacing Konstantin Rausch.
Artjoms Rudnevs (Koln) picked up a yellow card from referee.
An opponent rises to his feet after being downed by Marco Hoger (1. FC Koln). Robert Kampka saw the sliding tackle and blows for a foul. It's a penalty to Darmstadt! Let's see who's going to take it.
Marco Hoger (Koln) is booked.
Sidney Sam (Darmstadt) is going to take the penalty!
Sidney Sam (Darmstadt) steps up and confidently directs the penalty into the left side of the goal!
Here comes a substitution. Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) is brought on as a substitute for Alexander Milosevic.

Yuya Osako (Koln) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards the goal. To the amazement of all, it goes all the way into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:4 with this magnificent strike.
Peter Stoger decides to make a substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt will be replaced by Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln).
Torsten Frings prepares a substitution. Terrance Boyd is replaced by Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt).
Goal! Artjoms Rudnevs puts the ball across the area and Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 1:5.

Goal! Yuya Osako displays great vision and sends a pass to Artjoms Rudnevs (Koln), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:6.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
It's 1:0! Mathew Leckie feeds Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the left side of the net.
Goal! The free-kick is fired in by Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) and the ball inadvertently flicks off a defender and spins into the net, leaving Christian Mathenia stranded. 2:0.
Problems for Maik Walpurgis as Mathew Leckie is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Anthony Jung (Ingolstadt) replaces him.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Markus Gisdol makes a switch. Gideon Jung (Hamburger) is coming on in place of Gian-Luca Waldschmidt at the start of the second period.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Markus Gisdol probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Matthias Ostrzolek. He is replaced by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger).
Referee Markus Schmidt sees the trip by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. A penalty is given to Ingolstadt!
Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Christian Mathenia to move before rolling the ball into the middle of the goal!
Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) unleashes a powerful shot from long distance. His precise attempt glances off the bar into the back of the net and leaves the goalkeeper beaten.
The manager makes a subsitution with Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) coming on for Michael Gregoritsch.
Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) receives a yellow card for chasing the referee and shouting at him.
That's the end of the game for Dario Lezcano, who is replaced by Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Tobias Levels (Ingolstadt) for Pascal Gross.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.

What a great chance for Willi Orban (RB Leipzig). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header inside the left post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save. The ball goes out of play and RB Leipzig have been awarded a corner kick.

Goal! Andrej Kramaric displays great vision and sends a pass to Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:1.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) squandered a big chance from inside the box, firing his volley narrowly over the bar. What a waste.
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) gets a yellow card.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Goal - 1:1! Naby Keita tees up Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Oliver Baumann.
The match has reached half-time.
Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Julian Nagelsmann has made a change at the break. Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim) has come on in place of Kevin Vogt.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) makes a horrible challenge on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
Andrej Kramaric will be replaced by Mark Uth (Hoffenheim).
Here is a change. Yussuf Poulsen is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Davie Selke (RB Leipzig).
The substitution is prepared. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Nadiem Amiri.
It's in the back of the net! Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) tries his luck from the edge of the box and his shot takes a deflection and goes past the stranded Oliver Baumann. He makes it 2:1.
Marvin Compper (RB Leipzig) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card from Wolfgang Stark after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Here's the change. Naby Keita leaves the pitch and Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) comes on as a substitute.
The referee gives a yellow card to Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) for talking back. He must be careful for the remainder of the match.
Ralph Hasenhuttl prepares a substitution. Timo Werner is replaced by Rani Khedira (RB Leipzig).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Alexander Nouri is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Claudio Pizarro suffers an injury and Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) comes on.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the top right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 0:1.
Today's referee Sascha Stegemann rightly decides to book Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) scores from the free kick from the edge of the box, sending the ball in off the right post in the top right corner. The goalkeeper didn't stand a chance.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Sascha Stegemann has ended it.
The whistle blows and Sascha Stegemann starts the second half.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) receives a brilliant pass inside the box from Zlatko Junuzovic, and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the roof of the net. He makes it 1:2.
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to make a change. Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) replaces Thomas Muller.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Arjen Robben walks off the pitch to be replaced by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).
Alexander Nouri prepares a substitution. Robert Bauer is replaced by Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen).
A yellow card for a tackle by Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen). Sascha Stegemann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Sascha Stegemann ignores the protests.
Here's the change. Franck Ribery leaves the pitch and Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Alexander Nouri has decided to substitute Santiago Garcia and he is replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.
Felix Wiedwald gets a well deserved ovation! Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) produces a decent first-time strike goalwards, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it.
Sascha Stegemann shows the yellow card to Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) for a heavy challenge.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Yunus Malli floats a lovely ball in from the free kick. Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) gathers the ball and strikes it into the bottom right corner, increasing the score to 1:0.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Philipp Max (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) only hits the crossbar with a bullet header!
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) is quickest to pounce on a rebound and steers a powerful header past the helpless goalkeeper, into the middle of the net.
Jan Moravek is being substituted because of an injury. Manuel Baum sends Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) on the pitch.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
The substitution is prepared. Georg Teigl (Augsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Takashi Usami.
Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
What a goal! Raphael Framberger plays it to Dominik Kohr (Augsburg), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Diego Benaglio into the bottom right corner. 1:2.
Vieirinha goes off the pitch and Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Valerien Ismael has decided to make a change. Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg) replaces Yunus Malli.
Substitution. Josuha Guilavogui makes way for Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card.
What a sensational goal that would have been! Georg Teigl (Augsburg) picks up the ball inside the box and fires a beautiful first-time shot, but it goes just a few inches wide of the right post.
Substitution. Raul Bobadilla makes his way off the pitch and Gojko Kacar (Augsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card for infringement.
That's it for today, Bastian Dankert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.

Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders. The ball is out of play. Eintracht Frankfurt win a corner kick.

Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball towards the roof of the net. Heinz Lindner shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net. The ball goes out of play and Schalke have been awarded a corner kick.

Goal! Makoto Hasebe displays great vision and sends a pass to Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:1.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) has a shot blocked from inside the box.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) jumps for a cross and produces a fine header from near the penalty spot, but it goes narrowly wide of the left post!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
Substitution. Johannes Geis walks off the pitch and Donis Avdijaj (Schalke) comes on as a substitute.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) finds himself in a promising position to finish! He unleashes a poor shot which flies into the stands. What a poor effort that was!
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) gets on the end of a cross from Nabil Bentaleb, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Branimir Hrgota leaves the pitch and Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) dribbles into the box, but Ralf Fahrmann is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to substitute Alessandro Schopf and he is replaced by Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke).
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but his shot missed the target close to the right post.
Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) sees a yellow card from Robert Hartmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The game has come to an end for Nabil Bentaleb. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Aymen Barkok.
Today's referee Robert Hartmann rightly decides to book Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) for his harsh tackle.
Substitution. Shani Tarashaj (Eintracht Frankfurt) in, Mijat Gacinovic out.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Jairo Samperio (Mainz) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires the ball from the edge of the box towards the roof of the net, but Thomas Kessler shows his agility and makes a save. The ball is out of play and Mainz manage to earn a corner.

An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Danny Latza (Mainz), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and FC Koln will have a goal kick.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Gaetan Bussmann (Mainz), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His low header flies toward the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper blocks the effort.

What an opportunity that was! The ball rebounded out to Pablo De Blasis (Mainz), whose shot from the edge of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and FC Koln will have a goal kick.
The foul by Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Brych.
Christian Clemens comes off the pitch to be replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln).
Martin Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mounir Bouziane (Mainz) replacing Jairo Samperio.
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Yoshinori Muto and he is replaced by Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz).
Felix Brych is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Roger Schmidt is forced to make a change. Aleksandar Dragovic is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen).
Goal! Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:0.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches over the top.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) clearly handles the ball, but he is surprised when the referee blows his whistle. Bayer Leverkusen are about to take a penalty!
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) gives no chance to the keeper and converts the penalty with a sharp low drive into the left side of the net.
Goal! The rebound fell to Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) and he fired home from close range. The score is 2:1.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
Karim Bellarabi plays a lovely pass into Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.
Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

A nice cross arrived in the box from the corner kick and found the head of Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen). He steered the ball low towards the middle of the target, but one of the defenders is there to cover the goalkeeper and keep it out.
Substitution. Alexander Esswein makes his way off the pitch and Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) comes on as his replacement.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot towards the bottom left corner. His effort is blocked by Bernd Leno with a brilliant diving save!
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Julian Brandt as he is replaced by Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen).
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Vladimir Darida will be replaced by Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin).
The substitution is prepared. Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Karim Bellarabi.
Here is a change. Per Skjelbred is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin).

An absolutely sensational volley by Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen). He took a shot from inside the penalty area and the ball went straight into the top left corner. All credit to Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen), excellent finish.

Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) receives a quality pass and releases a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just wide of the left post! The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one. The ball goes out of play and Bayer Leverkusen will have a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Lukas Hradecky (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a red card due to his mindless behaviour. His team will now have to play with a man down.
Forced substitution due to red card. Branimir Hrgota comes off the pitch to be replaced by Heinz Lindner (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Goal! Marvin Compper (RB Leipzig) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:0.

Unbelievable! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) wastes a huge scoring opportunity! He finds himself unmarked right in front of goal and fires in a first-time shot. Heinz Lindner pulls off one of the best saves of his career and stops the effort from hitting the net.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Deniz Aytekin had an easy-decision to make.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) dribbles into the box, but Peter Gulacsi is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the left-hand post. However, he couldn't beat Peter Gulacsi, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
GOAL! Naby Keita curls the free kick into the box. Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past Heinz Lindner and into the right side of the net. 2:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) has come on for Yussuf Poulsen.

Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Heinz Lindner anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the right side of the target.
OWN GOAL! Jesus Vallejo (Eintracht Frankfurt) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 3:0.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig) comes onto the pitch for Stefan Ilsanker.
Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) has tested the patience of referee Deniz Aytekin and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Mijat Gacinovic.
Substitution. Ante Rebic makes his way off the pitch and Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as his replacement.
The referee signals a substitution. Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) is brought on as a substitute for Timo Werner.
Goal disallowed! Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) scores but Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle for a foul.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
The expression of the referee Markus Schmidt is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) is shown a yellow card.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Markus Schmidt had an easy-decision to make.
Philipp Ochs (Hoffenheim) gets booked for the first time in this match.

Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) latches onto a precise cross from the free kick and produces a header at goal from the penalty spot, but his attempt towards the left side of the target fails to beat Oliver Baumann, who makes a sensational save.
Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) gets a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Philipp Ochs comes off for Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim).
Half-time substitution. Manuel Baum decided to make a change. Ja-Cheol Koo is replaced by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg).
Fantastic team goal! Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) was set free in the area by Nadiem Amiri and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the left side of the net. 0:1.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.
It's a goal! Mark Uth plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 0:2.
That's the end of the game for Konstantinos Stafylidis, who is replaced by Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).
Here is a change. Jan Moravek is going off and Manuel Baum gives the last tactical orders to Halil Altintop (Augsburg).
It is time for a substitution. Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim) is on for Kerem Demirbay.

That was a nice football moment. Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the left post. Oliver Baumann guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
Julian Nagelsmann prepares a substitution. Nadiem Amiri is replaced by Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim).
Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim) gets a yellow card.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Michael Esser pulls off a great save to deny Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) has tested the patience of referee Marco Fritz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Off the post! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range bounced off the left post.
It is time for a substitution. Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) is on for Jan Rosenthal.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Jonas Hofmann.

Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) wastes a great chance from the resulting corner. He times his header superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross, but can't aim better than into the middle of the goal, straight into the arms of the goalkeeper.
Today's match ends for Raffael who will be replaced by Ba-Muaka Simakala (B. Monchengladbach).
Mario Vrancic is being substituted because of an injury. Torsten Frings sends Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) on the pitch.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt) is coming onto the pitch as Antonio-Mirko Colak cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Marco Fritz had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Harm Osmers starts the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Markus Weinzierl probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Johannes Geis. He is replaced by Guido Burgstaller (Schalke).
A substitution has been made. Max Meyer goes off and Donis Avdijaj (Schalke) comes on.
Maik Walpurgis prepares a substitution. Pascal Gross is replaced by Anthony Jung (Ingolstadt).
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Harm Osmers had an easy-decision to make.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Dennis Aogo as he is replaced by Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).
Maik Walpurgis has decided to make a change. Robert Leipertz (Ingolstadt) replaces Dario Lezcano.
Goal! Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.
Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Felix Wiedwald with a strike into the left side of the goal. He makes it 0:1.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Serge Gnabry leaves the pitch and Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Jaroslav Drobny (Werder Bremen) makes an ugly tackle on his opponent and is sent off by the referee!
Here comes a substitution. Felix Wiedwald (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Claudio Pizarro.
Yellow card. Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

What a great touch by Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Daniel Siebert has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Thomas Tuchel decides to make a substitution. Marcel Schmelzer will be replaced by Erik Durm (Dortmund).
Marco Reus (Dortmund) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Felix Wiedwald is alert and denies him.

GOAL! Superb work from Clemens Fritz, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen), who beats Roman Weidenfeller with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) latched on to a lofted pass inside the box, but his header misses to the right of the target.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marco Reus departs the field of play to be replaced by Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund).
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Gonzalo Castro and he is replaced by Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund).
Substitution. Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Gonzalo Castro walks off.
Goal! Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 1:2.
Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) has tested the patience of referee Daniel Siebert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) for Clemens Fritz.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Felix Zwayer shows the yellow card to Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) for a heavy challenge.
Diego Benaglio (Wolfsburg) argues with the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
RED CARD! Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Felix Zwayer. He can have an early bath.
Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests.
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Daniel Caligiuri walks off the pitch to be replaced by Vieirinha (Wolfsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg) replaces Yunus Malli.
Goal! Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a change. Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) replaces Matthias Ostrzolek.
A yellow card for a tackle by Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee signals a substitution. Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Paul Ntep de Madiba.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.

GOAL! Superb work from Vincenzo Grifo, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Janik Haberer (Freiburg), who beats Manuel Neuer with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 1:0.

Alexander Schwolow pulls off a great save to deny Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! The ball goes out for a corner. Bayern Munich can continue in their attacking effort.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) has tested the patience of referee Manuel Grafe and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort. Bayern Munich force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Goal! Douglas Costa takes over corner duties and picks out Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who fires into the middle of the net from close range. 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Manuel Grafe had an easy-decision to make.

Close! Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) takes the resulting free kick from a promising positon, but his effort flies inches wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich will have a goal kick.
Carlo Ancelotti is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Arturo Vidal suffers an injury and Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) comes on.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the top left corner, but Alexander Schwolow made an astonishing save! The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Florian Niederlechner departs the field of play to be replaced by Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Carlo Ancelotti prepares a substitution. Douglas Costa is replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
The game has come to an end for David Alaba. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich).
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) receives a yellow card.
Here is a change. Janik Haberer is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Onur Bulut (Freiburg).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Lukas Kubler (Freiburg) will replace Pascal Stenzel.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Freiburg.
Alexander Schwolow (Freiburg) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.

Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.

Nils Petersen (Freiburg) was in a good shooting position just outside the box and unleashed a first-time shot towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper made a decent save to thwart his effort.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) scores an easy goal. He receives a precise pass inside the box and sends the ball past the goalkeeper, glancing in off the downside of the left post.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) wasted a clear opportunity. He fired a first-time shot from point-blank range, but it rattled the right post.

The ball finds its way to Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) after a confusing situation inside the goalmouth. He finds some space and easily knocks the ball in with his body and alters the score to 1:0.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball, though, only brushes the left post.
Goal! Thiago Alcantara produces a great pass that finds Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
A header by Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) from very close range goes towards the right-hand post, but doesn't get past Manuel Neuer, who makes a brilliant save.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) makes a horror tackle on his opponent and the referee sends him off!

Felix Zwayer blows for a foul after Peter Gulacsi (RB Leipzig) was too aggressive in the battle for the ball. The referee blows his whistle and awards Bayern Munich a penalty after chaos inside the box.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) smoothly converts the penalty with a stunning effort which ends up inside the right post.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) comes on the pitch for Naby Keita.
Half-time substitution. Arjen Robben will not participate anymore and Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) is coming on.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Peter Gulacsi.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Yellow card. Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The game has come to an end for Timo Werner. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Davie Selke (RB Leipzig).
We are about to witness a substitution. Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) is replacing David Alaba.
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to make a change. Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) replaces Arturo Vidal.
Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Marcel Sabitzer and he is replaced by Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig).
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top left corner only for Peter Gulacsi to dive and make a save.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) creates a good chance for himself and fires in a powerful close-range shot, but his effort ricochets off the crossbar.

Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball is out of play. Bayern Munich win a corner kick.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) meets a perfect cross from Frederik Sorensen deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the roof of the net. It's 1:0.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 25 metres out. Thomas Kessler pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going into the left side of the goal.

Yuya Osako (Koln) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 30 metres out. Bernd Leno pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going into the bottom right corner. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to FC Koln.
Goal! Kai Havertz puts a cross into the box and finds Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:1.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Roger Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Kevin Kampl will be replaced by Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen).
Peter Stoger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Simon Zoller (Koln) replacing Artjoms Rudnevs.

Konstantin Rausch (1. FC Koln) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with an accurate shot from the free kick, which is placed dangerously close to the penalty area. However, Bernd Leno pulls off a great save to stop his attempt towards the left side of the goal.
Here is a change. Admir Mehmedi is going off and Roger Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
A dangerous towering header by Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) from around the penalty spot goes just wide of the left post. This corner kick didn't change the score.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) produces a good strike that sails to the middle of the goal, but his low effort ends up in the goalkeeper's gloves.

Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) dribbles into space and finds himself in a shooting position, but his shot from the edge of the box is bravely blocked. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Darmstadt.
Rune Jarstein gets a well deserved ovation! Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt) produces a decent first-time strike towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and releases a quick shot to the bottom right corner. His promising effort is kept out by Michael Esser, who pulls off a stunning save! Hertha Berlin have been awarded a corner kick.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Hartmann ignores the protests.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the top right corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 1:0.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header inches over the bar.
A yellow card for a tackle by Artem Fedetsky (Darmstadt). Robert Hartmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) peels away from his marker to meet the resulting free kick from Marvin Plattenhardt, and he steers a powerful header from the centre of the box inside the right post. What a finish that is - 2:0!
That's the end of the game for Sven Schipplock, who is replaced by Anis Ben-Hatira (Darmstadt).
Today's referee Robert Hartmann rightly decides to book Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) for his harsh tackle.
Ramon Berndroth decides to make a substitution. Jan Rosenthal will be replaced by Roman Bezjak (Darmstadt).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) comes onto the pitch so that Mario Vrancic can be given a rest.
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) replacing Valentin Stocker.
Salomon Kalou slides a brilliant pass into Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Substitution. Vladimir Darida makes way for Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin).

Excellent touch by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin)! He latches on to a precise pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a terrific save. The linesman makes the right call and Hertha Berlin will have a corner.
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Hartmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) replaces Salomon Kalou.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
It's in the back of the net! Kerem Demirbay plays it into the box, and Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) gets on the end of the cross to put it inside the right post. 1:0.

Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. His dangerous effort is blocked by Jaroslav Drobny, who makes a glorious save! The linesman makes the right call and Hoffenheim will have a corner.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Alexander Nouri has made a change at the break. Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) has come on in place of Philipp Bargfrede.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Jaroslav Drobny makes a great save to stop his effort.
Substitution. Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) on for Kerem Demirbay.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) replaces Mark Uth.
Benjamin Cortus shows a yellow card to Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) for his blatant foul. That's a free kick to Hoffenheim.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Lamine Ludovic Sane as he is replaced by Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) was quite harsh and Benjamin Cortus didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
It is time for a substitution. Baris Atik (Hoffenheim) is on for Nadiem Amiri.

Goal! The rebound fell to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:1.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) displays great tekkers inside the box leading to a fantastic goal, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.

Mario Gotze (Dortmund) fires in a shot from the edge of the box which deflects off one of the defending players and hits the left post! Dortmund will take a corner kick.

Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Roman Weidenfeller, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

The whistle blows and Guido Winkmann starts the second half.
Thomas Tuchel makes a half-time substitution. Sven Bender (Dortmund) comes on in place of Marc Bartra.
Goal! Shinji Kagawa produces a great pass that finds Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
A brilliant individual effort! Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot at goal. His effort is blocked by Marwin Hitz with a brilliant diving save!
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) has tested the patience of referee Guido Winkmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Halil Altintop (Augsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Roman Weidenfeller guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Augsburg.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! David Abraham feeds Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 1:0.

Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Lukas Hradecky to get hold of the ball.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) covers his face with his hands after wasting a glorious chance. The ball rebounded to him but his close-range header went a whisker wide of the left post.
Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper blocks the effort.

Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) gets inside the penalty area and sends a powerful shot that almost ends inside the net. The keeper is alert and makes a good save. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Mainz.
