Gunter Perl blows his whistle and the second half starts.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Martin Schmidt probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Karim Onisiwo. He is replaced by Levin Oztunali (Mainz).

What a sweet touch by Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) after latching on to a fine pass on the edge of the box! He finds some space and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net. The goalkeeper makes an excellent reflex save, pushing the ball onto the post.
It's a yellow card for Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Gunter Perl shows a yellow card to Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) has an effort on goal, but he misses to the right of the goal.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) can have an early bath after being sent off by the referee for a tackle that simply has no place in football!
Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes out his opponent with a horrible challenge and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Substitution. Shani Tarashaj (Eintracht Frankfurt) has come on for Ante Rebic.

What a wasted opportunity by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the right side of the goal, but Jonas Lossl makes an astonishing save to thwart him. Johan Djourou (Hamburger) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg) connects with the ball from the resulting corner and places a precise header past the stranded goalkeeper and into the top left corner. Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) has tested the patience of referee Felix Brych and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming onto the pitch as Michael Hector cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul. Wolfsburg are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
Felix Brych blows his whistle after Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. That's a penalty to Eintracht Frankfurt! They have a good chance to score now.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses the penalty! His poor effort goes well over the crossbar.

What a wonderful moment! Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a perfect pass in the middle of the pitch, lines up the ball and unloads a powerful strike towards the bottom right corner. His effort fails to surprise Diego Benaglio, who makes a nice save.

The substitution is prepared. Halil Altintop (Augsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jan Moravek.

Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header home from close range after a fine cross following the corner kick. The ball bounces in off the bottom of the left post. He alters the score – 1:0.

What a chance that is! Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the crossbar!

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Danny Latza (Mainz) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Christian Mathenia. 1:1.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) receives a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Emir Spahic (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Deniz Aytekin had an easy-decision to make.

Goal! Danny Latza (Mainz) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. Christian Mathenia is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 2:1.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Danny Latza (Mainz) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the top left corner of the net.
That's a clear yellow card. Danny Latza (Mainz) goes into the book.

Markus Gisdol decides to make a substitution. Dennis Diekmeier will be replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger).

Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) for his blatant foul.

Anthony Modeste (Koln) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Goal! The rebound fell to Artjoms Rudnevs (1. FC Koln) and he fired home from close range. The score is 0:1.

Nice piece of skill by Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen). He perfectly collected a pass from Clemens Fritz and unleashed a fantastic long-range strike which went into the bottom right corner. The score is 1:1.

Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) unleashes a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Thomas Kessler thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) gets to a rebound on the edge of the box and strikes, but he only hits the right post and wastes a promising chance!
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Wolfgang Stark starts the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Alexander Nouri probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Clemens Fritz. He is replaced by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen).
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and releases a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies painfully close to the right post.

Jaroslav Drobny makes a brilliant save! Dominique Heintz (1. FC Koln) easily weaves through the defence and fires the ball from mid-range. His effort goes towards the top left corner but is saved by the keeper! The referee points to the corner flag and FC Koln will take a corner.

Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) is quickest to the rebound inside the box and produces a decent strike towards the bottom left corner. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a spectacular save to keep the ball out of the net. Great goalkeeping!

Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. Werder Bremen force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
Here comes a substitution. Claudio Pizarro is given a rest as he is replaced by Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen).

Artjoms Rudnevs (1. FC Koln) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Jaroslav Drobny shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Substitution. Simon Zoller (Koln) has come on for Artjoms Rudnevs.
Peter Stoger prepares a substitution. Anthony Modeste is replaced by Sehrou Guirassy (1. FC Koln).
Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Yellow card. Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Marco Hoger (Koln) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Fin Bartels departs the field of play to be replaced by Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen).
Jonas Hector (Koln) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Matthias Ginter sends a terrific cross into the box. Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just over the bar.

Marco Reus sprays a wonderful pass out to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who cannot get enough power or direction to cause Oliver Baumann problems and the goalkeeper is able to watch the ball go just wide of the right post.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Benjamin Brand ignores the protests.

It's in! Ousmane Dembele spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Mario Gotze (Dortmund) doesn't think twice and rifles a first-time shot into the bottom right corner. The score is now 1:1.

Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) has a good chance to score with a mid-range attempt after collecting a pass. He aims for the right side of the goal, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Roman Weidenfeller. Good work from Hoffenheim as they win a corner.
Goal! Nice headed pass by Benjamini Hubner to Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim), who latches on to it and puts the ball into the back of the net with a fine header. 2:1.

Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) has tested the patience of referee Benjamin Brand and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!

What a chance that is! Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly wide of the right post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.

Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) blows an opportunity from close range as he heads a rebound onto the right post!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.

Golden chance! Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Darmstadt will have a goal kick.

A perfect lofted pass from Filip Kostic finds Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the left side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Michael Esser had no chance of stopping that. 0:1.
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) for his blatant foul.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Johan Djourou (Hamburger) receives the caution after an awful tackle.

It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Michael Gregoritsch as he is replaced by Bobby Wood (Hamburger).

Filip Kostic (Hamburger) attempts to find one of his teammates with a sweet pass into the box, but one of the defending players reacts well and intercepts the effort. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Hamburger SV.
What a chance for Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post.

Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) picked up a yellow card from referee.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Guido Winkmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That's it for today, Guido Winkmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.

Ralf Fahrmann (Schalke) jumps into a tackle and Bastian Dankert blows his whistle for a foul. RB Leipzig are awarded a penalty kick!

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) is going to take the penalty!
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) takes the penalty and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom the right corner!

Ralph Hasenhuttl is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Benno Schmitz suffers an injury and Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) comes on.

Peter Gulacsi can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Leon Goretzka (Schalke). The ball would have probably ended up in the middle of the net.
Goal! Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) launches himself at the ball from the free kick and produces a header which lacks accuracy, sending it just wide of the right post.

OWN GOAL! The free kick is whipped in and Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) is unlucky enough to head the ball into his own net. 2:1.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) was quite harsh and Bastian Dankert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) latches on to a pin-point through ball, but one of the defending players dispossess him. Brilliant defending. The linesman points to the corner flag, RB Leipzig are going to take it.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper leaps from the ground and makes a stunning save. The ball is out of play. RB Leipzig will have a chance to score from a corner.

Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the bottom right corner. Alexander Schwolow is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save.

Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) is going to take the penalty!

Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot low into the middle of the goal. Alexander Schwolow anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and doesn't have to move to stop the effort.

Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) connects with the ball from the resulting corner and places a precise header past the stranded goalkeeper and into the top right corner. Jonas Lossl can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.

Superb finishing from Marcel Heller (Darmstadt). Sandro Sirigu plays a fantastic through ball and finds Marcel Heller (Darmstadt), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a low shot from close range past the goalkeeper. It's 0:1.

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot into the middle of the target, but Michael Esser pulls off a save.
