Substitution. Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) in, Thomas Muller out.
Substitution. Douglas Costa walks off the pitch and Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Today's match ends for Philipp Lahm who will be replaced by Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich).
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) wasted a chance to score! He pinged a fine header from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it flew narrowly wide of the right post.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Oliver Baumann is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.

Brilliant finish! Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Christoph Kramer, then produced a nice strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Deniz Aytekin starts the second half.
Julian Nagelsmann makes a half-time substitution. Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) comes on in place of Adam Szalai.
Half-time substitution. Fabian Schar is replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Goal! Sebastian Rudy slips it to Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) on the edge of the box and he finds the left side of the net with a great effort. The score is 1:1.
The substitution is prepared. Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Steven Zuber.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Deniz Aytekin didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
That will be all from Thorgan Hazard who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach).
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
Mahmoud Dahoud links up with Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach), who fires just wide of the left post from the edge of the box.
Andre Schubert has decided to substitute Christoph Kramer and he is replaced by Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach).
Andre Schubert has decided to make a change. Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Lars Stindl.

Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes well over the bar.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Lukas Hradecky pulls off a great save to deny Andre Schurrle (Dortmund), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund). This could have been a legendary goal.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Wolfgang Stark didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
The second half gets underway.

Goal! Timothy Chandler displays great vision and sends a pass to Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the top of the net. The score is 1:0.
Here comes a substitution. Julian Weigl is given a rest as he is replaced by Sebastian Rode (Dortmund).
Thomas Tuchel prepares a substitution. Adrian Ramos is replaced by Marco Reus (Dortmund).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Andre Schurrle can be given a rest.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Sokratis (Dortmund) for his blatant foul.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Alexander Meier as he is replaced by Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) is the one who receives a yellow card.

It's a goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) makes it 1:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Ousmane Dembele and planted his close-range header into the bottom right corner. Lukas Hradecky was helpless.

Brilliant finish! Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Szabolcs Huszti, then produced a nice strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 2:1.
Substitution. Szabolcs Huszti will be replaced by Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Wolfgang Stark had an easy-decision to make.
It's a yellow card for Lukas Hradecky (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he fails to change the score as his effort deflects away off the bar.
Substitution. Marco Fabian makes way for Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) receives a yellow card.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Yuya Osako (Koln) got in a good shooting position on the edge of the box and pulled the trigger. The ball flew towards the right side of the goal, but Marwin Hitz punched it onto the post.
Markus Schmidt shows the yellow card to Dominique Heintz (1. FC Koln) for a heavy challenge.

Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Thomas Kessler to dive and make a save. Augsburg will take a corner kick.
A yellow card for a tackle by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg). Markus Schmidt doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The foul by Christoph Janker (Augsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Markus Schmidt.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Markus Schmidt ignores the protests.
Jonas Hector (Koln) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marco Hoger leaves the pitch and Artjoms Rudnevs (Koln) comes on.
Substitution. Simon Zoller is replaced by Marcel Hartel (Koln).
That will be all from Jonathan Schmid who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Georg Teigl (Augsburg).
A substitution has been made. Philipp Max is replaced by Takashi Usami (Augsburg).

Marwin Hitz makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Marcel Hartel (Koln) inside the box and he drills a strike goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.
It will be a substitution. Salih Ozcan (Koln) is ready to enter the pitch as Yuya Osako walks off.
A substitution has been made. Halil Altintop goes off and Gojko Kacar (Augsburg) comes on.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) leaps to connect with a delightful cross and places his sweet header inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance to make a save.
Thanos Petsos (Werder Bremen) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Brilliant finish! Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Clemens Fritz, then produced a nice strike into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:1.

Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) receives a quality pass and unleashes a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just over the crossbar. The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one.
Goal! Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Nicolai Muller. The score is 2:1.

Filip Kostic (Hamburger) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the top left corner, but Jaroslav Drobny was alert and the score remains the same. Hamburger SV have been awarded a corner kick.

Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Christian Mathenia makes a great save to stop the effort going into the top of the net. Good work from Werder Bremen as they win a corner.
Yellow card. Nikolas Moisander (Werder Bremen) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

An amazing individual effort from Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the right side of the goal and makes it 2:2. Christian Mathenia was helpless.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Felix Brych starts the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Alexander Nouri probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Thanos Petsos. He is replaced by Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dennis Diekmeier leaves the pitch and Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) comes on.
Alexander Nouri decides to make a substitution. Serge Gnabry will be replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Johan Djourou (Hamburger) is given a yellow card.
Substitution. Michael Gregoritsch makes way for Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger).
Substitution. Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) on for Fin Bartels.
What was Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) latches on to a superb cross into the box and hits the left post with a fine header. What a chance!

Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Daniel Siebert blows his whistle for a foul. PENALTY to Ingolstadt! Almost the entire opposition team is gathered around the referee and complaining. However, the decision has been made and it's final.
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) is going to take the penalty!
Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the left post, but Diego Benaglio leaps out to thwart his attempt.

Florent Hadergjonaj showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Anthony Jung (Ingolstadt) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header into the bottom right corner. It's 1:0.
Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make. It's a free kick to Wolfsburg, but it's in no position for a direct shot on goal.

That was a nice football moment. Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom right corner. Diego Benaglio guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Maximilian Arnold is replaced by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
Half-time substitution. Valerien Ismael decided to make a change. Daniel Didavi is replaced by Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg).
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) has tested the patience of referee Daniel Siebert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Roger (Ingolstadt) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case. Wolfsburg are awarded a free kick.
Great touch by Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
Substitution. Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) in, Anthony Jung out.
Good chance for Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg) as he latched on to a cross on the edge of the box and blasted the ball towards the net! It flew wide of the right post.
Substitution. Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) has come on for Julian Draxler.
Here is a change. Moritz Hartmann is going off and Maik Walpurgis gives the last tactical orders to Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt).
Goal! Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
Chance! Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) gets to the rebound on the edge of the box and smashes the ball towards the left side of the goal, but Diego Benaglio is alert and makes a save to deny him.

OFF THE POST! Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Diego Benaglio is alert and denies him with a nice save. The ball is out of play and Ingolstadt manage to earn a corner.
Substitution. Pascal Gross leaves the pitch and is replaced by Robert Leipertz (Ingolstadt).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Goal - 0:1! Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the top right corner. Marcel Sabitzer provided an assist for the goal.

It's a goal! Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) makes it 1:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Pascal Stenzel and planted his close-range header low into the middle of the goal. Peter Gulacsi was helpless.
Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Brand had an easy-decision to make.

Diego Demme sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:2.
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt. Freiburg are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.

Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) was close to scoring from the resulting free kick. He unleashed a decent strike from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper made a great save to keep him out.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Timo Werner (RB Leipzig). Emil Forsberg plays a fantastic through ball and finds Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 1:3.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Benno Schmitz (RB Leipzig) was quite harsh and Benjamin Brand didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Christian Streich makes a half-time substitution. Janik Haberer (Freiburg) comes on in place of Marc Torrejon.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) has tested the patience of referee Benjamin Brand and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Freiburg have a free kick.
OFF THE BAR! Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) finds some space to meet the corner kick and unleashes a shot that only crashes against the bar!
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) for his blatant foul. There is a free kick near the sideline to RB Leipzig.
Good chance for Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) as he latched on to a cross on the edge of the box and blasted the ball towards the net! It flew wide of the crossbar.
A goal, which was scored by Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), was disallowed due to offside.
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Jonas Fohrenbach (Freiburg) replaces Manuel Gulde.

OFF THE POST! Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nils Petersen trots off the pitch and is replaced by Mats Daehli (Freiburg).
Ralph Hasenhuttl decides to make a substitution. Yussuf Poulsen will be replaced by Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig).
Goal! Emil Forsberg tees up Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:4.

Alexander Schwolow was forced into action to thwart Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Ralph Hasenhuttl prepares a substitution. Timo Werner is replaced by Davie Selke (RB Leipzig).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Marcel Sabitzer as he is replaced by Rani Khedira (RB Leipzig).
Benjamin Brand is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) finds himself unmarked in the penalty box and gets himself on the end of a brilliant cross to smash the ball into the top left corner.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Kampka has ended it.
Robert Kampka blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Substitution. Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) in, Szabolcs Huszti out.
Goal! Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:1.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) blows a clear opportunity to score a goal. He was one-on-one with Felix Wiedwald inside the six-yard box and attempted to put the ball low into the middle of the target, but was denied by a great save.
Jesus Vallejo (Eintracht Frankfurt) has tested the patience of referee Robert Kampka and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Florian Grillitsch comes off the pitch to be replaced by Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Robert Kampka didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Mijat Gacinovic.

What a wasted opportunity by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen)! He creates himself some space inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the top of the net, but Lukas Hradecky makes an astonishing save to thwart him. The ball is out of play and Werder Bremen manage to earn a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Serge Gnabry.
That will be all from Claudio Pizarro who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Lennart Thy (Werder Bremen).
Niko Kovac decides to make a substitution. Branimir Hrgota will be replaced by Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the left side of the net.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
Kevin Vogt is being substituted because of an injury. Julian Nagelsmann sends Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) on the pitch.
It's in the back of the net! Lewis Holtby picks out Filip Kostic (Hamburger) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 0:1.
Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Hartmann had an easy-decision to make.
The game has begun to heat up. Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Christian Mathenia is alert and denies him.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) wins himself some space inside the box after the corner kick and finishes into the bottom left corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
What a hit! Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 2:1.
Goal! Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 2:2. He was ably assisted there by Lewis Holtby.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) rips an amazing volley from deep inside the box that goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Substitution. Kerem Demirbay makes way for Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim).
What a big chance! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Here is a change. Andrej Kramaric is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) replaces Michael Gregoritsch.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he drags his effort wide of the left post.
A substitution has been made. Filip Kostic is replaced by Aaron Hunt (Hamburger).
Markus Gisdol decides to make a substitution. Nicolai Muller will be replaced by Finn Porath (Hamburger).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Goal Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund)! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) was put through by Mario Gotze and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
The foul by Marc Bartra (Dortmund) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Stieler.

It's unbelievable, Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) blows a huge opportunity! He is totally unmarked and fires a first-time shot towards goal from a few yards out, but Manuel Neuer reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Manuel Neuer is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) sees a yellow card from Tobias Stieler after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Today's match ends for Joshua Kimmich who will be replaced by Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich).
Crossbar! Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) picks up a precise pass and produces a bullet of a strike from distance that smashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal.
Substitution. Philipp Lahm did his best and is replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
Thomas Tuchel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Erik Durm (Dortmund) replacing Andre Schurrle.
That will be all from Xabi Alonso who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich).
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Mario Gotze and he is replaced by Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund).
Thomas Tuchel is forced to make a change. Marcel Schmelzer is unable to continue due to injury, Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) comes on.
Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Tobias Stieler ignores the protests.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but powers his header just wide of the left post.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.

A neat pass is well received by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot. Hertha Berlin will take a corner kick.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg)'s poor effort is easily saved by Rune Jarstein. He connects well with a cross, but mistimes it a little, and it heads low towards the middle of the target and straight into the grateful hands of the goalkeeper. Corner kick. Augsburg will have an opportunity.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Substitution. Salomon Kalou is replaced by Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin).
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) replaces Alexander Esswein.

Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) has a good chance to score with a mid-range attempt after collecting a pass. He aims for the right side of the goal, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Marwin Hitz.
Substitution. Georg Teigl (Augsburg) in, Jonathan Schmid out.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Martin Hinteregger doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Gojko Kacar (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch to replace him.

Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) collects the ball from the free kick and immediately sends his close-range effort narrowly wide of the left post! The ball goes out of play and Augsburg will have a goal kick.
Jan Moravek (Augsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Halil Altintop.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) was quite harsh and Bastian Dankert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) meets a delivery on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards the top of the net. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Thomas Kessler produces an easy save. B. Monchengladbach have been awarded a corner kick.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and curls the ball inside the left post in trademark fashion.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Frederik Sorensen (Koln) for his blatant foul.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Dominique Heintz (1. FC Koln) was quite harsh and Manuel Grafe didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) fires in the free kick from a promising position just outside the box. It's a fantastic strike and looks set for glory, but it only rattles the crossbar!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Peter Stoger gives a chance to Artjoms Rudnevs (1. FC Koln) and Matthias Lehmann is off.

Golden chance! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for FC Koln.

Dominique Heintz sends a superb cross into the box. Anthony Modeste (Koln) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Yann Sommer beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
Thomas Kessler blocks a long-range effort from Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) towards the bottom right corner.
Artjoms Rudnevs (Koln) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and can count himself very lucky that the referee didn't issue a red card.
Substitution. Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) on for Thorgan Hazard.
Peter Stoger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Salih Ozcan (Koln) replacing Yuya Osako.
Substitution. Ibrahima Traore makes way for Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach).
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Thomas Kessler makes a great save to stop his effort.
Jonas Hector (Koln) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) gets a yellow card.
Mahmoud Dahoud will be replaced by Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach).

Marcel Risse (Koln) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the top right corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 1:2.
Peter Stoger prepares a substitution. Marcel Risse is replaced by Pawel Olkowski (1. FC Koln).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Anis Ben-Hatira (Darmstadt) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and can count himself very lucky that the referee didn't issue a red card.

Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Michael Esser. Ingolstadt have a corner.
Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) gets himself onto the end of the corner, but his header is blocked.
OFF THE BAR! Anis Ben-Hatira (Darmstadt) strikes a brilliant shot towards goal from the free kick, but his effort rattles the crossbar.
Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) sends in a direct shot from a dangerously positioned free kick. The ball sails towards the left post, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save.
Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.
Problems for Maik Walpurgis as Markus Suttner is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) replaces him.
Christian Dingert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Norbert Meier has made a change at the break. Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt) has come on in place of Laszlo Kleinheisler.
Marcel Heller sprays a pass out to Anis Ben-Hatira (Darmstadt), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes well wide of the left post.
Yellow card. Roger (Ingolstadt) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The referee signals a substitution. Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) is brought on as a substitute for Anis Ben-Hatira.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Marcel Tisserand (Ingolstadt) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the top left corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 0:1.
Florent Hadergjonaj (Ingolstadt) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Norbert Meier has decided to substitute Jerome Gondorf and he is replaced by Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt).
We are about to witness a substitution. Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt) is replacing Moritz Hartmann.

Marcel Heller (Darmstadt) gets to the rebound on the edge of the penalty area and fires a shot towards the left side of the goal, but Martin Hansen gets a hand to it and keeps it out. The ball goes out of play. Darmstadt are awarded a corner kick.
It will be a substitution. Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt) is ready to enter the pitch as Almog Cohen walks off.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) sees a yellow card from Manuel Grafe after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Christian Streich is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Maximilian Philipp suffers an injury and Nils Petersen (Freiburg) comes on.

Goal! Niko Bungert (Mainz) jumps highest inside the box to meet the resulting corner from Yunus Malli. His well-placed header ends up in the top of the net, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. 1:0.
A clumsy foul by Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg) and Manuel Grafe blows his whistle. It's a penalty to Mainz! Let's see who's going to take it.
A yellow card for a tackle by Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) coolly converts the penalty, sending the ball into the top right corner.

Nice individual effort by Yunus Malli (Mainz). He gets all the way to the goalkeeper, produces a strike towards the right side of the target, but Alexander Schwolow does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out with a save.

That was a nice football moment. Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom right corner. Jonas Lossl guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Stefan Bell (Mainz) for a heavy challenge.

What a great touch by Fabian Frei (Mainz)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.
CHANCE! Florian Niederlechner finds Mike Frantz (Freiburg) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the left post!
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) rises above the defence and powers a header at the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper denies him with a superb save.
Manuel Grafe has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
Fabian Frei (Mainz) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Manuel Grafe didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Nils Petersen (Freiburg) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the top right corner. Jonas Lossl pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort rattles the left post! What a shot that was!
The foul by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe.
GOAL - 2:1! Florian Niederlechner found Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Jonas Lossl off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
Substitution.  on for Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Jonas Fohrenbach is replaced by Mats Daehli (Freiburg).
Yunus Malli takes over corner duties and expertly finds Stefan Bell (Mainz), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the right side of the goal. The score is now 2:0.
It is time for a substitution. Janik Haberer (Freiburg) is on for Florian Niederlechner.
Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) fires the rebound into the roof of the net after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:2.
The main referee, Manuel Grafe, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) attempts to discuss the decision with Manuel Grafe, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Leon Balogun (Mainz) will replace Jhon Cordoba.
Martin Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jairo Samperio (Mainz) replacing Yunus Malli.

Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) meets a perfect cross from Jairo Samperio on the edge of the penalty area and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike low behind the goalkeeper. It's 2:1.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) fires the ball in from a mid-range free kick, but the effort goes just wide of the right post.
Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Valerien Ismael prepares a substitution. Jakub Blaszczykowski is replaced by Vieirinha (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) on for Daniel Caligiuri.
Paul Seguin (Wolfsburg) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting set piece and aims a header towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes a superb save.

Diego Benaglio was forced into action to thwart Alessandro Schopf (Schalke). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball is out of play. Schalke win a corner kick.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The game has come to an end for Paul Seguin. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg).

It's a goal! Leon Goretzka (Schalke) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the middle of the target. The assist goes to Sead Kolasinac and the score changes to 0:1.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) for his blatant foul.
Here's the change. Nabil Bentaleb leaves the pitch and Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) comes on as a substitute.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a change. Baba Rahman (Schalke) replaces Max Meyer.
It is time for a substitution. Thilo Kehrer (Schalke) is on for Maxim Choupo-Moting.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
It's in the back of the net! Julian Brandt is the provider as he slips the ball to Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:0.

It's an own goal! A pitiful moment for Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen), who tries to clear a cross into the six-yard box from the corner but instead sends the ball behind his own keeper. The score is 1:1.
Marvin Compper is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Benno Schmitz (RB Leipzig).

Goal! Hakan Calhanoglu displays great vision and sends a pass to Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 2:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) for a tough tackle.
Felix Brych blows his whistle after Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. Penalty! A huge opportunity to score for Bayer Leverkusen.
Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Brych didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Peter Gulacsi dives to the left side of the goal and brilliantly saves the penalty taken by Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen)!
Today's referee Felix Brych rightly decides to book Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) for his harsh tackle.
A substitution has been made. Hakan Calhanoglu is replaced by Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen).
Here is a change. Yussuf Poulsen is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig).
What a hit! Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) tries his luck with a long-range shot and beats Bernd Leno. The ball goes into the middle of the net. He makes it 2:2.

Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the roof of the net. Peter Gulacsi is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. Bayer Leverkusen have been awarded a corner kick.
The foul by Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Brych.
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a change. Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Admir Mehmedi.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Bernd Leno, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
Emil Forsberg launches a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. 2:1.
Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Julian Baumgartlinger.
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) is quickest inside the box and leaps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it floats just over the crossbar.
Emil Forsberg goes off the pitch and Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) comes on.
Felix Brych is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.

Ralf Fahrmann hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) shoots from the edge of the box towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. The ball goes behind for a corner. Werder Bremen will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Max Meyer (Schalke) gets a shot from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar!
Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Gunter Perl didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Naldo (Schalke) tries his luck from a long-range free kick and the ball is aimed to the bottom left corner, but Felix Wiedwald is alert and thwarts the effort.
Goal! Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 2:0.
Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) is going to take the penalty!
Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Ralf Fahrmann to move before rolling the ball into the middle of the goal!
Thanos Petsos (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Gunter Perl after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
A goal, which was scored by Benedikt Howedes (Schalke), was disallowed due to offside.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Gunter Perl blows his whistle to start the second half.
A yellow card for a tackle by Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke). Gunter Perl doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick low shot towards the middle of the goal. His effort lacks pace and that allows Felix Wiedwald to make a comfortable save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Schalke.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) covers his face with his hands after spurning a great chance. The ball rebounded to him and his close-range header went a whisker wide of the right post.
Goal - 2:1! Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) receives a precise pass inside the box from Sead Kolasinac and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.
The substitution is prepared. Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Clemens Fritz.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Gunter Perl ignores the protests.
Here is a change. Fin Bartels is going off and Alexander Nouri gives the last tactical orders to Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nabil Bentaleb trots off the pitch and is replaced by Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke).
Gunter Perl shows the yellow card to Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
A substitution has been made. Max Meyer goes off and Abdul Baba Rahman (Schalke) comes on.
Markus Weinzierl decides to make a substitution. Maxim Choupo-Moting will be replaced by Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) controls the ball with a great first touch just outside the penalty area after receiving a pass and smashes the ball into the roof of the net to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Goal Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig)! Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) was put through by Timo Werner and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yunus Malli (Mainz) is coming onto the pitch as Suat Serdar cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) gets on the end of a pass and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but it's blocked by one of the defending players.
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) picks up the rebound just a few yards out of the box. He attempts to beat the goalkeeper with a fine shot, but the goalkeeper is on hand to deny him.
GOAL! Superb work from Emil Forsberg, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), who beats Jonas Lossl with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 3:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Marco Fritz blows his whistle to start the second half.
Martin Schmidt has made a change at the break. Stefan Bell (Mainz) has come on in place of Jairo Samperio.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Marco Fritz ignores the protests.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) will be replaced by .
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Timo Werner and he is replaced by Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig).
Goal! Alexander Hack finds Stefan Bell (Mainz) with a headed pass and the latter glances a header past the goalkeeper to make it 3:1.
It's time for a substitution. Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) comes on in place of Yussuf Poulsen.
The main referee, Marco Fritz, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Stefan Bell (Mainz) is given a yellow card for dissent.
can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Marco Fritz didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Emil Forsberg walks off.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) jumps for a cross and plants a perfect header inside the right post.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
What was Konstantin Rausch (Koln) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Peter Stoger gives a chance to Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) and Konstantin Rausch is off.
Marco Hoger swings the cross over. Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) gets his head to it but it goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a goal kick.
Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes out his opponent with a horrible challenge and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
It will be a substitution. Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) is ready to enter the pitch as Matthias Lehmann walks off.
Substitution. Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Alexander Meier walks off.
Mergim Mavraj (Koln) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Substitution. Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt) has come on for Mijat Gacinovic.
Here comes a substitution. Szabolcs Huszti is given a rest as he is replaced by Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Yuya Osako (Koln) is punished with the yellow card.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) is shown a deserved yellow card for saying too much to the referee.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Alexander Milosevic (Darmstadt) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the middle of the goal. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Bernd Leno with a fabulous save.
Goal! Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot into the bottom left corner.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Harm Osmers blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Anis Ben-Hatira comes off for Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt).
Norbert Meier makes a switch. Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) is coming on in place of Sven Schipplock at the start of the second period.
Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) finds some space inside the box to meet a beautiful cross and with a precise low drive puts the ball into the bottom right corner.

Julian Baumgartlinger sends a superb cross into the box. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the top right corner, leaving Michael Esser beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Admir Mehmedi trots off the pitch and is replaced by Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen).
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot inside the right post. His attempt was beyond the reach of Michael Esser, so the score changes to 1:1.
Here is a change. Laszlo Kleinheisler is going off and Norbert Meier gives the last tactical orders to Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt).

Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Michael Esser, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The ball goes out of play. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
It will be a substitution. Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) is ready to enter the pitch as Omer Toprak walks off.

Goal! Jerome Gondorf launched the corner kick and superbly found the head of Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt), whose accurate effort from near the penalty spot went straight into the top left corner. It's 3:2.
Substitution. Julian Brandt leaves the pitch and is replaced by Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen).
Leon Guwara (Darmstadt) is booked.
That's it for today, Harm Osmers has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Goal - 0:1! Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the top left corner. Nadiem Amiri provided an assist for the goal.
Own goal! Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) suffers a good deal of misfortune as he accidentally puts a pass from one of the attacking players into his own net. The score is 1:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Benjamini Hubner makes his way off the pitch and Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) comes on as his replacement.
Today's referee Markus Schmidt rightly decides to book Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) for his harsh tackle.
Substitution. Nadiem Amiri walks off the pitch and Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
Robert Lewandowski slides a brilliant pass into Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
It's time for a substitution. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) comes on in place of Arturo Vidal.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Andrej Kramaric and he is replaced by Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim).
Arjen Robben will be replaced by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).
Carlo Ancelotti decides to make a substitution. Jerome Boateng will be replaced by David Alaba (Bayern Munich).

OFF THE POST! Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
It's a yellow card for Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim).
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) connects with a perfect cross and blasts the ball at goal, but his effort only crashes against the right post!
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Alexander Schwolow is alert and denies him.
Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) makes room to connect with a cross, but his strike from the penalty spot isn't accurate at all and the ball goes well over the bar.
Booking. Amir Abrashi (Freiburg) receives a caution from the referee.
Close effort! Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) takes the resulting free kick from a promising distance, but he sends it narrowly wide of the right post.

Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) connects with the ball from the resulting corner and places a powerful header past the stranded goalkeeper and into the roof of the net. The opposing players are staring at each other, unable to understand what happened. Who will take the blame for that one? Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) has a reason to celebrate!
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Christian Gunter (Freiburg) for his blatant foul.
Felix Brych has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
It's in the back of the net! Christian Trasch slips the ball through to Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:2.
Substitution. Nils Petersen (Freiburg) has come on for Amir Abrashi.
Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
That will be all from Jakub Blaszczykowski who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg).
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg) for Mario Gomez.

It's a foul from Christian Gunter (Freiburg). Surprisingly, the referee comes and pulls out a red card. It was a very harsh one and Christian Gunter (Freiburg) complains, but it's no use of course. The decision has been made.

Christian Gunter (Freiburg) holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows for a foul after seeing the whole situation. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Wolfsburg!
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) is going to take the penalty!
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the left side of the net.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Florian Niederlechner will be replaced by Janik Haberer (Freiburg).
Valerien Ismael decides to make a substitution. Daniel Caligiuri will be replaced by Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg).
Christian Streich has decided to substitute Nicolas Hofler and he is replaced by Jonas Fohrenbach (Freiburg).
Felix Brych is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Emre Mor (Dortmund) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Rene Adler makes a great save to stop his effort.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) fires the rebound low into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Emre Mor, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 0:2.

Close! Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) is a whisker away from finishing-off the move he started. His close-range effort flies just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.

Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom right corner. Rene Adler had no chance of reaching it. The score is 0:3.
We are about to witness a substitution. Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) is replacing Cleber.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
Goal - 0:4! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Christian Pulisic provided an assist for the goal.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the right post.
Today's match ends for Pierre-Michel Lasogga who will be replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger).
Goal - 1:4! Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt provided an assist for the goal.
Superb touch by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) as he receives a precise pass inside the box. He finds the keeper prepared as he unleashes his shot to the left side of the goal. Wonderful save!
Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make.
The referee signals a substitution. Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) is brought on as a substitute for Christian Pulisic.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to substitute Emre Mor and he is replaced by Andre Schurrle (Dortmund).
Sokratis (Dortmund) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it's not accurate and goes narrowly over the bar.
Substitution. Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) in, Dennis Diekmeier out.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang tees up Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:5.
Problems for Thomas Tuchel as Sokratis is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Felix Passlack (Dortmund) replaces him.

What a goal! Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) receives an accurate pass and tries his luck with a long-range shot. He unleashes a superb strike that goes into the bottom left corner and behind the goalkeeper.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Douglas Santos (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
A yellow card for a tackle by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt). Jochen Drees doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) cracks a splendid volley from just outside the box that brushes the left post. It was an incredible shot and the goalkeeper was really lucky not to concede a goal.

Excellent touch by Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.
Dong-Won Ji slides a brilliant pass into Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Markus Kauczinski has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) comes on the pitch for Lukas Hinterseer.
Jochen Drees shows the yellow card to Philipp Max (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
Substitution. Halil Altintop (Augsburg) on for Jonathan Schmid.
Markus Kauczinski has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) replacing Stefan Lex.
The substitution is prepared. Sonny Kittel (Ingolstadt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Almog Cohen.
That will be all from Philipp Max who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).
Romain Bregerie (Ingolstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Jochen Drees ignores the protests.

Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) struck with a perfectly taken free kick from the edge of the box. He curled the ball straight inside the left post. There are not enough superlatives that can be used to describe that goal.
The referee interrupts the game and gives a red card to Tobias Levels (Ingolstadt). He can take an early bath.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly fires the ball into the middle of the net.
A substitution has been made. Ja-Cheol Koo is replaced by Gojko Kacar (Augsburg).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
A yellow card for a tackle by Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header narrowly over the crossbar!
CLOSE! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that whistles over the bar.
What a big chance! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.

It's a goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) makes it 0:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Mitchell Weiser and planted his close-range header into the right side of the goal. Yann Sommer was helpless.

John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the left side of the goal. Yann Sommer shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 2:0.
The substitution has been made. Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) has replaced Patrick Herrmann.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!
Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Stieler didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) for Tobias Strobl.
That was close. Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) fires a shot from the edge of the box which goes a whisker wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Allan (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Fabian Lustenberger cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) rises above the defending players to meet the corner kick. His header goes to the middle of the goal, but Yann Sommer is alert and manages to keep the ball out.
Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) picked up a yellow card from referee.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Genki Haraguchi departs the field of play to be replaced by Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin).

Rune Jarstein makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the roof of the net by Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) after a cross from the side. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to B. Monchengladbach.
What a big chance! Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Rune Jarstein, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
Goal - 3:0! Mitchell Weiser tees up Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) inside the box and he curls the ball into the left side of the net and past Yann Sommer.
Here is a change. Jonas Hofmann is going off and Andre Schubert gives the last tactical orders to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Salomon Kalou walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sinan Kurt (Hertha Berlin).
That's it for today, Tobias Stieler has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Bobby Wood (Hamburger) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom left corner. His dangerous effort is blocked by Timo Horn, who makes a glorious save! The ball goes out for a corner. Hamburger SV can continue in their attacking effort.
Dominic Maroh is substituted due to injury. Peter Stoger gives a chance to Dominique Heintz (1. FC Koln).
The whistle blows and Anthony Modeste (Koln) is booked for an infringement.
The foul by Marco Hoger (1. FC Koln) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Benjamin Brand.
Artjoms Rudnevs (1. FC Koln) sees a yellow card from Benjamin Brand after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Dangerous play by Ashton Gotz (Hamburger). Benjamin Brand blows his whistle for a foul. FC Koln are awarded a penalty kick!
Ashton Gotz (Hamburger) is booked by the referee.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) fails to score from the penalty spot! His effort crashes against the left post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Benjamin Brand has ended it.
The second half has just started.
The manager makes a subsitution with Simon Zoller (Koln) coming on for Artjoms Rudnevs.
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) knows that the game is over for him after receiving a red card from the referee for fouling his opponent!
It's in the back of the net! Simon Zoller plays it into the box, and Anthony Modeste (Koln) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
Today's match ends for Ashton Gotz who will be replaced by Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger).
Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
Substitution. Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) on for Filip Kostic.
Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.

Marcel Risse sends a superb cross into the box. Anthony Modeste (Koln) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the right post, leaving Rene Adler beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:0.
We are about to witness a substitution. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) is replacing Pierre-Michel Lasogga.
It's in the back of the net! Marcel Risse slips the ball through to Anthony Modeste (Koln), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent low shot into the back of the net. He makes it 3:0.
The substitution is prepared. Konstantin Rausch (Koln) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Marco Hoger.
That's it for today, Benjamin Brand has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) reacts quickest to get to the rebound and produces a header which ricochets off the crossbar and away!

Superbly taken set piece! Kerem Demirbay takes the free kick and sends a cross into the six-yard box. Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) flicks the ball lightly with his head towards the middle of the goal. Rune Jarstein can't react quickly enough and the score changes to 1:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his low drive to the middle of the goal is smartly dealt with by Oliver Baumann.
Today's match ends for Alexander Esswein who will be replaced by Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin).
Benjamin Cortus shows a yellow card to Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.
Substitution. Steven Zuber did his best and is replaced by Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim).
Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Benjamin Cortus didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
It will be a substitution. Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) is ready to enter the pitch as Per Skjelbred walks off.
The foul by Allan Allan (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Benjamin Cortus.
Here comes a substitution. Kerem Demirbay is given a rest as he is replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Vedad Ibisevic will be replaced by Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin).
Benjamin Cortus shows a yellow card to Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Substitution. Lukas Rupp makes his way off the pitch and Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) comes on as his replacement.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Yellow card. Julian Weigl (Dortmund) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) has tested the patience of referee Felix Brych and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Tempers flare after Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.
The yellow card is received by Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund).

That will be all from Franco Di Santo who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke).
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Sokratis (Dortmund) for his blatant foul.
Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Felix Passlack.

The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.

Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) picks up a pass and has an effort from the edge of the box, but Manuel Neuer gets down to his right to keep it out. Augsburg win a corner.

Goal! Arjen Robben plays in Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders. He shoots from inside the box into the right side of the net! Great finish - 0:1.
Goal - 0:2! Robert Lewandowski tees up Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) inside the box and he slams the ball past Marwin Hitz.
Carlo Ancelotti is forced to make a change. Javi Martinez is unable to continue due to injury, Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) comes on.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Great ball in from Arjen Robben. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the left post.

Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the bottom left corner. However, but he couldn't beat Manuel Neuer, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Christian Dingert has ended it.
The second half has just started.
It's in the back of the net! Arjen Robben picks out Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 0:3.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jonathan Schmid trots off the pitch and is replaced by Philipp Max (Augsburg).
Substitution. Jerome Boateng makes way for Holger Badstuber (Bayern Munich).

Goal! Daniel Baier rounded the goalkeeper and sent a sweet pass to Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg), who had an easy finish to put it into an empty net. 1:3.

What a great chance for Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header inside the left post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save. The referee signals a corner kick to Bayern Munich.

Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) wastes a great chance from the resulting corner. He times his header superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross, but can't aim better than into the middle of the goal, straight into the arms of the goalkeeper.
Georg Teigl (Augsburg) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
The referee signals a substitution. Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) is brought on as a substitute for Arjen Robben.
Substitution. Jan Moravek (Augsburg) has come on for Gojko Kacar.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it to the middle of the goal, but Marwin Hitz makes a comfortable save to stop his effort.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Wolfgang Stark had an easy-decision to make.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt) was quite harsh and Wolfgang Stark didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Yellow card. Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Yussuf Poulsen and he is replaced by Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig).
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the right-hand post.
Goal! Timo Werner puts a cross into the box and finds Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:1.
The substitution is prepared. Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Sven Schipplock.
Marvin Compper (RB Leipzig) is lucky to receive a yellow card from the referee because he could easily have been given a red card for his foul.
Bernardo just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig) replaces him.
Norbert Meier decides to make a substitution. Jerome Gondorf will be replaced by Mario Vrancic (Darmstadt).
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Immanuel Hohn (Darmstadt) is given a yellow card.

Goal! Oliver Burke puts a cross into the box and finds Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the right post. He makes it 0:2.
Tempers flare after a clattering challenge by Anis Ben-Hatira (Darmstadt), who receives a yellow card from the referee. It could have been worse for him!
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Timo Werner walks off the pitch to be replaced by Davie Selke (RB Leipzig).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
