Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) cracks a splendid volley from just outside the box that brushes the left post. It was an incredible shot and the goalkeeper was really lucky not to concede a goal.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

The game is interrupted. Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) has violated the rules in the battle for the ball. No protests or gestures are being made as he is quite aware of what he did. Mainz are awarded a penalty!
Yunus Malli (Mainz) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) fires the penalty into the right side of the net!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Almog Cohen departs the field of play to be replaced by Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt).
Markus Kauczinski decides to make a substitution. Dario Lezcano will be replaced by Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt).
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) has tested the patience of referee Robert Kampka and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The game has come to an end for Moritz Hartmann. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt).
Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Kampka had an easy-decision to make.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the left post.
Jairo Samperio goes off the pitch and Levin Oztunali (Mainz) comes on.
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
Max Christiansen (Ingolstadt) makes a bad challenge and is given a second yellow card which means he's off.
Here is a change. Yunus Malli is going off and Martin Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Leon Balogun (Mainz).
Here comes a substitution. Pablo De Blasis is given a rest as he is replaced by Jose Rodriguez (Mainz).
That's it for today, Robert Kampka has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Ousmane Manneh (Werder Bremen) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads towards the top of the net, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him.
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) for his blatant foul.
The foul by Mike Frantz (Freiburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Guido Winkmann.

Goal! Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom left corner. Felix Wiedwald had no chance of reaching it. The score is 0:1.
Foul! Ousmane Manneh (Werder Bremen) is penalised for pulling back his opponent. The referee gives a penalty kick to Freiburg!!
Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) is going to take the penalty!
Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) coolly converts the penalty. His precise shot goes inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Substitution. Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) in, Lamine Ludovic Sane out.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Guido Winkmann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Alexander Nouri probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Florian Grillitsch. He is replaced by Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen).
Golden chance! Ousmane Manneh (Werder Bremen) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Substitution. Karim Guede did his best and is replaced by Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Felix Wiedwald pulls off a great save to deny Nils Petersen (Freiburg) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.

Well-positioned Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the bottom right corner, but Felix Wiedwald reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop! Freiburg win a corner.

Zlatko Junuzovic sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:2.
Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) is booked for saying more than Guido Winkmann was willing to tolerate.
It's in the back of the net! Amir Abrashi (Freiburg) tries his luck from the edge of the box and his shot takes a deflection and goes past the stranded Felix Wiedwald. He makes it 1:3.
Maximilian Philipp comes off the pitch to be replaced by Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg).
Alexander Nouri decides to make a substitution. Izet Hajrovic will be replaced by Lennart Thy (Werder Bremen).
A yellow card for a tackle by Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg). Guido Winkmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mike Frantz trots off the pitch and is replaced by Janik Haberer (Freiburg).

Valerien Ismael is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Robin Knoche suffers an injury and Hendrik Hansen (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the right post! What a shot that was!
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.

GOAL! Superb work from Daniel Caligiuri, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg), who beats Bernd Leno with a brilliant shot into the right side of the net. 1:0.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) meets a fine cross on the edge of the box from the resulting corner kick and shoots. His shot flies just wide of the left post.

Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) comes onto the pitch because Lars Bender simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.

CHANCE! Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top.

What a huge opportunity! Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with a close-range strike towards the middle of the target. The amazing Lukas Hradecky deserves an ovation from the fans as he pulls off a spectacular save and pushes the ball onto the post.

Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Stefan Bell (Mainz), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
That's it for today, Daniel Siebert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The foul by Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Hartmann.
What a huge chance for Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Hartmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Robert Hartmann shows the yellow card to Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) for a heavy challenge.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

An amazing individual effort from Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball low into the middle of the goal and makes it 1:0. Felix Wiedwald was helpless.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Peter Gulacsi (RB Leipzig) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the bottom left corner that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
What a great touch by Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the centre of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
Here comes a substitution. Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Izet Hajrovic.
The substitution is prepared. Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Clemens Fritz.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to make a change. Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) replaces Timo Werner.
Davie Selke produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) rises high to head the ball into the middle of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 2:0.
Fin Bartels provides Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Substitution. Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) replaces Florian Grillitsch.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) replacing Emil Forsberg.
Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Peter Gulacsi.
A substitution has been made. Yussuf Poulsen goes off and Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig) comes on.
Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but it's just a bit too high and misses the bar by a whisker.
Today's referee Robert Hartmann rightly decides to book Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) scores as he latches on to a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a perfect strike that goes behind the goalkeeper.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) starts an individual run, not looking to pass to a teammate, and easily weaves through the defence to get deep inside the box. He shoots low, but misses the goal by a whisker!
What a chance that is! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the left post!
Rafinha produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) rises high to head the ball straight under the crossbar and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:0.
It's a goal! Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) scores with a brilliant shot into the middle of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from David Alaba. The score is now 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Jochen Drees blows his whistle and the second half starts.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Andre Schubert probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Jonas Hofmann. He is replaced by Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nico Schulz (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch for Oscar Wendt.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) takes a nice first touch to control a cross and shoots at goal from near the penalty spot, but his effort only hits the right-hand post!
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Jochen Drees didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to substitute Douglas Costa and he is replaced by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Andre Hahn makes way for Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch so that Arjen Robben can be given a rest.
Rafinha just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) replaces him.
That's it for today, Jochen Drees has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) dribbles into the box, but Bernd Leno is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.

That was really pointless! Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) made a mindless challenge and the referee Bastian Dankert showed him a red card. Hoffenheim win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) decides to have a direct shot at goal from the free kick, but the ball hits the right post.
Sandro Wagner feeds the ball through to Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly drills it into the roof of the net! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:1!
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) received a precise pass and hammers the ball at goal from close range. Unfortunately for him, his aim was a bit off and it flies just wide of the right post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Bastian Dankert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Roger Schmidt makes a switch. Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on in place of Lars Bender at the start of the second period.
Goal! Andrej Kramaric plays a pass to the feet of Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim), and he shoots inside the left post from inside the box. It's 0:2.

Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) had a good chance to change the score. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a shot from just outside the penalty area which went towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper was ready and made an amazing save.
Bernd Leno pulls off a great save to deny Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
Omer Toprak is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen).
The game has come to an end for Admir Mehmedi. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen).
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Sebastian Rudy and he is replaced by Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim).
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) attempted to pick out a free teammate inside the box, but Bernd Leno comes off the line to clear the ball away.
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) picks up a rebound in the box and unleashes a brilliant effort, leaving the goalkeeper no chance.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Andrej Kramaric will be replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).

Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) finds himself free inside the box and pulls the trigger, but his effort is brilliantly stopped by one of the defending players. The ball goes out of play. Hoffenheim are awarded a corner kick.
The referee signals a substitution. Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) is brought on as a substitute for Kerem Demirbay.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg) makes a horror tackle on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
Anis Ben-Hatira (Darmstadt) scores a beautiful goal from the resulting free kick. He bends the ball into the top right corner. A technically stunning goal.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Daniel Caligiuri as he is replaced by Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg).

Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Koen Casteels leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the left post by a whisker.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Anis Ben-Hatira, but he hits a shot just wide of the left post.
A substitution has been made. Roman Bezjak goes off and Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) comes on.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the bottom right corner. The score is 1:1.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg).
Goal! Laszlo Kleinheisler (Darmstadt) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the right post. It's 2:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcel Schafer leaves the pitch and Paul Seguin (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Norbert Meier has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) replacing Sven Schipplock.
GOAL! Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 3:1.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Markus Schmidt didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Laszlo Kleinheisler departs the field of play to be replaced by Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt).
Valerien Ismael prepares a substitution. Julian Draxler is replaced by Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg).
That's it for today, Markus Schmidt has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Marc Torrejon (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch because Amir Abrashi simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) latches on to a lovely pass inside the box and fires towards the left side of the net, but the effort is smothered by the keeper.
Manuel Grafe has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Onur Bulut (Freiburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The substitution has been made. Nils Petersen (Freiburg) has replaced Florian Niederlechner.
A cross from the free kick is whipped deep into the box by Vincenzo Grifo and Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) gets in a shot, sending the ball into the middle of the net. 1:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Philipp Max (Augsburg) replaces Ja-Cheol Koo.
Dirk Schuster prepares a substitution. Gojko Kacar is replaced by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg).
Goal! Maximilian Philipp feeds Nils Petersen (Freiburg), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 2:0.
It's a goal! Halil Altintop (Augsburg) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Dong-Won Ji. The score is now 1:0.
Today's match ends for Konstantinos Stafylidis who will be replaced by Julian Gunther-Schmidt (Augsburg).
Christian Streich decides to make a substitution. Vincenzo Grifo will be replaced by Georg Niedermeier (Freiburg).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Timo Horn guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Goal! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Mitchell Weiser, then sends the ball inside the left post. 1:0.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the right-hand post, but Timo Horn was alert and the score remains the same.
Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) gets a yellow card.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Frank Willenborg has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Peter Stoger has made a change at the break. Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) has come on in place of Yuya Osako.

Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it. Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) quickly picks up the rebound and shoots under the crossbar, but the goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save to deny him. The referee points to the corner flag and Hertha Berlin will take a corner.
It's a goal! Leonardo Bittencourt plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Anthony Modeste (Koln). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:1.
Substitution. Konstantin Rausch makes way for Simon Zoller (Koln).
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) replaces Alexander Esswein.

John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up in the roof of the net, but Timo Horn pulls off a decent save to thwart him. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin have been awarded a corner kick.
Dominique Heintz (Koln) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) finds some space inside the box and scores with a terrific header inside the right post, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Peter Stoger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Artjoms Rudnevs (Koln) replacing Dominique Heintz.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Salomon Kalou as he is replaced by Allan Rodrigues de Souza (Hertha Berlin).
Simon Zoller (Koln) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the penalty spot wasn't accurate enough and the ball bounced away off the left post!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Vedad Ibisevic leaves the pitch and Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Goal disallowed! Artjoms Rudnevs (1. FC Koln) scores but Frank Willenborg blows his whistle for a foul.
The referee shows the yellow card to John Brooks (Hertha Berlin).
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) scores! He controls the ball from the free kick inside the 6-yard box and drills a superb strike into the top of the net.
Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Roman Weidenfeller.
The ball from the free kick finds its way to Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) who rises and scores with a thunderous header inside the left post. An incredible long-range header!

Roman Weidenfeller was forced into action to thwart Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper. Good work from Ingolstadt as they win a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) comes on the pitch for Joo-Ho Park.
A substitution has been made. Gonzalo Castro goes off and Mario Gotze (Dortmund) comes on.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header inside the left post. Excellent finish.
Florent Hadergjonaj provides Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.

Moritz Hartmann (Ingolstadt) latches on to a cross on the edge of the box. He shows a good first touch and drills a low drive towards the left post, but the goalkeeper manages to punch the ball onto the post.
Goal! Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Christian Pulisic, then sends the ball low into the middle of the net. 2:1.
A yellow card for a tackle by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Dario Lezcano walks off the pitch to be replaced by Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt).
Here is a change. Shinji Kagawa is going off and Thomas Tuchel gives the last tactical orders to Felix Passlack (Dortmund).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) comes onto the pitch so that Lukas Hinterseer can be given a rest.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the bottom right corner, but Orjan Nyland is prepared and dives to thwart him.
Goal! Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:1.

Felix Passlack sends a terrific cross into the box. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Ingolstadt.
That's it for today, Felix Zwayer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Gunter Perl shows the yellow card to Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets booked.

Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 20 metres out, but it flew just over the bar.
This is definitely not what Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) wanted. Attempting to intercept an offensive pass, he scored an own goal and made it 0:1.
Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) has received a yellow card for his foul.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Gunter Perl starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Markus Gisdol decided to make a change. Alen Halilovic is replaced by Bobby Wood (Hamburger).
Substitution. Emir Spahic makes his way off the pitch and Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) comes on as his replacement.
RED CARD! Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Gunter Perl. He can have an early bath.
Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

Goal! Marco Fabian displays great vision and sends a pass to Shani Tarashaj (Eintracht Frankfurt), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the top of the net. The score is 0:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Shani Tarashaj.
Close! Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.

Rene Adler was forced into action to thwart Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot towards the roof of the net but couldn't beat the keeper. The linesman points to the corner flag, Eintracht Frankfurt are going to take it.

GOAL! Superb work from Marco Fabian, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who beats Rene Adler with a brilliant shot into the left side of the net. 0:3.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Filip Kostic walks off the pitch to be replaced by Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger).
Niko Kovac has decided to substitute Branimir Hrgota and he is replaced by Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt).
A brilliant individual effort! Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Bastian Oczipka trots off the pitch and is replaced by Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Yellow card! It's like Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Gunter Perl agrees and books him.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.

Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) takes a brilliant touch after he latches on to a pass on the edge of the box and strikes the ball to the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper dives low and saves his attempt.
Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the right post.
Marcel Sabitzer is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig).

Koen Casteels (Wolfsburg) brings his opponent down. Sascha Stegemann has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle for a foul. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to RB Leipzig.
Koen Casteels (Wolfsburg) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) doesn't keep his cool and fails to convert the penalty. His shot flies miles wide of the left post.

Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) releases a powerful first-time effort from the edge of the box which goes in the direction of the bottom right corner of the target, but the keeper leaps like a salmon to deny him. Excellent goalkeeping!
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the left-hand post.
The end of the first half.
Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the bottom right corner. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Koen Casteels with a fabulous save.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Bruno Henrique (Wolfsburg) replaces Paul Seguin.
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Vieirinha will be replaced by Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg).

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) was quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. There is a free kick near the sideline to Wolfsburg.

Nice piece of skill by Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig). He perfectly collected a pass from Yussuf Poulsen and unleashed a fantastic long-range strike which went into the bottom right corner. The score is 0:1.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Borja Mayoral (Wolfsburg) replacing Luiz Gustavo.
Substitution. Yussuf Poulsen did his best and is replaced by Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig).
Here is a change. Emil Forsberg is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Naby Keita (RB Leipzig).

Peter Gulacsi receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed towards the left side of the goal.
Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a great reaction save to stop the effort.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Fantastic team goal! Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) was set free in the area by Gaetan Bussmann and fired past Michael Esser. 1:0.

Laszlo Kleinheisler (Darmstadt) unloads a powerful first-time shot from 28 metres. It goes under the crossbar, but Jonas Lossl is alert and stops his effort. The ball is out of play and Darmstadt manage to earn a corner.

Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Jhon Cordoba (Mainz). This could have been a legendary goal.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Alexander Milosevic (Darmstadt) for his blatant foul.

Yunus Malli (Mainz) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. The ball goes out for a corner. Mainz can continue in their attacking effort.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. A free kick is awarded to Darmstadt.
A player from Mainz commits a rough challenge. Felix Brych blows for a foul and keeps the game under control. The referee points to the penalty spot. Darmstadt are awarded a penalty kick!
Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) is going to take the penalty!
Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) places the ball on the penalty spot and strikes, but Jonas Lossl produces a brilliant piece of goalkeeping to thwart him.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Felix Brych blows his whistle and the second half starts.
One of the Darmstadt players unfairly tackled his opponent and conceded a foul. PENALTY to Mainz! Let's see who will take responsibility.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) confidently powers his spot-kick into the left side of the goal.
The referee signals a substitution. Anis Ben-Hatira (Darmstadt) is brought on as a substitute for Marcel Heller.
Norbert Meier has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt) replacing Roman Bezjak.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Levin Oztunali will be replaced by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Immanuel Hohn as he is replaced by Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Suat Serdar (Mainz) replaces Yunus Malli.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, but it is straight at Michael Esser.
Here is a change. Pablo De Blasis is going off and Martin Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Niko Bungert (Mainz).

The game is interrupted. One of the players from Mainz is cautioned for aggressive play. PENALTY to Darmstadt! Almost the entire opposition team is gathered around the referee and complaining. However, the decision has been made and it's final.
Sven Schipplock (Darmstadt) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) steps up and confidently directs the penalty into the left side of the goal!
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) receives a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Ousmane Manneh (Werder Bremen) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Bernd Leno.
Goal! Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.

Goal! Kevin Kampl clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen), who gets on the end of it and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the right side of the goal. Felix Wiedwald had no chance of stopping that. 1:1.
Serge Gnabry is being substituted because of an injury. Alexander Nouri sends Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) on the pitch.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
We are about to witness a substitution. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) is replacing Kevin Volland.
Goal! Ousmane Manneh (Werder Bremen) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Clemens Fritz will be replaced by Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen).
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant foul.
Here is a change. Julian Brandt is going off and Roger Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen).
A goal, which was scored by Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen), was disallowed due to offside.
Substitution. Aranguiz will be replaced by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen).
Alexander Nouri has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen) replacing Izet Hajrovic.
Ousmane Manneh (Werder Bremen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Bernd Leno is alert and denies him.
Ousmane Manneh (Werder Bremen) is the one who receives a yellow card.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.
Markus Weinzierl is forced to make a change. Breel Embolo is unable to continue due to injury, Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) comes on.
Johannes Geis (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Stieler had an easy-decision to make.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Halil Altintop (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Tobias Stieler blows his whistle to start the second half.
The yellow card goes to Benedikt Howedes (Schalke).
Today's match ends for Alessandro Schopf who will be replaced by Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).
Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) makes himself some space on the edge of the penalty area and pulls the trigger. His accurate effort goes off the post into the top right corner and the score changes to 0:0.

Daniel Baier (Augsburg) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the top right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 1:1.
It will be a substitution. Max Meyer (Schalke) is ready to enter the pitch as Johannes Geis walks off.
Dirk Schuster prepares a substitution. Gojko Kacar is replaced by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg).
Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Stieler and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The game has come to an end for Daniel Baier. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Jan Moravek (Augsburg).
Dirk Schuster has decided to substitute Halil Altintop and he is replaced by Tim Rieder (Augsburg).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Close! Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) takes the resulting free kick from a promising positon, but his effort flies inches wide of the right post.
Cleber (Hamburger) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle for a foul. The referee gives a penalty to B. Monchengladbach!
Red card! Cleber (Hamburger) simply can't believe his eyes. The referee makes the call and sends him off.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.

Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) blows a huge chance to score! He sends the penalty to the left side of the goal, but it's not enough to beat Rene Adler who easily stops the effort. Good work from B. Monchengladbach as they win a corner.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) has tested the patience of referee Wolfgang Stark and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Andre Schubert makes a half-time substitution. Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) comes on in place of Patrick Herrmann.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) was quite harsh and Wolfgang Stark didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Yellow card. Emir Spahic (Hamburger) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. Rene Adler pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
It's a penalty! What an opportunity to score for B. Monchengladbach. Douglas Santos (Hamburger) is penalised for holding. Wolfgang Stark signals a set piece.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
The referee gives a yellow card to Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger).
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) fails to score from the penalty spot! His effort only crashes against the crossbar.
Here's the change. Pierre-Michel Lasogga leaves the pitch and Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.
What was Filip Kostic (Hamburger) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Today's match ends for Filip Kostic who will be replaced by Bobby Wood (Hamburger).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Aaron Hunt walks off the pitch to be replaced by Gideon Jung (Hamburger).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) is coming onto the pitch as Mahmoud Dahoud cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Andre Schubert has decided to make a change. Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Fabian Johnson.

What a chance that is! Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the left post! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) looks furious with himself after spurning a great chance. He pounces on the rebound around the penalty spot and drags a shot well wide of the right post.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
David Alaba plays a neat ball into the path of Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich), who makes room for a shot and sends in a low drive which bounces in off the right post! 0:1.

Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) attempts to test the goalkeeper after collecting a cross inside the penalty area. Luck doesn't appear to be on his side today as his attempt rattles the left post.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) has too much to say to the referee and receives a caution.
Manuel Neuer makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the top left corner by Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) after a cross from the side.
The game is interrupted. Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
CLOSE! Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post!
Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Manuel Neuer with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Carlo Ancelotti has made a change at the break. Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) has come on in place of Xabi Alonso.
That was close by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Lukas Hradecky blocks a long-range effort from Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) towards the left side of the goal.
Goal! Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:2.
It's the second caution for Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) and that's the last we'll see of him in this game. There was no other option for Bastian Dankert.
Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) receives a yellow card.
Substitution. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) replaces Kingsley Coman.
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Ante Rebic.
Substitution. Michael Hector leaves the pitch and is replaced by Shani Tarashaj (Eintracht Frankfurt).
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich).
We are about to witness a substitution. Rafinha (Bayern Munich) is replacing Arjen Robben.
Niko Kovac has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Alexander Meier.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) displays good awareness in the six-yard box and finds an unusual way to score by using his body to knock the ball behind the keeper. He makes it 1:1.
Booking. Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a caution from the referee.
Jerome Boateng sends a terrific cross into the box. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just wide of the left post.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Lukas Hradecky (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card!
Bastian Dankert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Crossbar! Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) picks up a precise pass and produces a bullet of a strike from distance that smashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal.
Close! Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) scores a goal! He picks up a sweet pass and coolly slots the ball into the top right corner.
What was Matthias Lehmann (Koln) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Tobias Levels (Ingolstadt) clearly holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows his whistle for a foul. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to FC Koln.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) gives no chance to the keeper and converts the penalty with a sharp low drive into the left side of the net.
Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Substitution. Stefan Lex makes his way off the pitch and Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) comes on as his replacement.
Anthony Modeste (1. FC Koln) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar.
Substitution. Roger makes way for Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt).
Peter Stoger decides to make a substitution. Konstantin Rausch will be replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln).
Markus Kauczinski has decided to make a change. Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) replaces Moritz Hartmann.
Marco Hoger (Koln) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
We are about to witness a substitution. Artjoms Rudnevs (Koln) is replacing Yuya Osako.
Substitution. Marco Hoger is replaced by Salih Ozcan (Koln).
Frederik Sorensen (Koln) gets a yellow card.
Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) escapes without any punishment from the referee after using excessive force to foul his opponent. Penalty awarded! Ingolstadt will take a penalty kick.
Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a low shot inside the left post.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Tobias Levels (Ingolstadt) for his blatant foul.
That's it for today, Tobias Welz has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.

What an opportunity! Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes low towards the middle of the goal, but Alexander Schwolow reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
Goal! Some very poor defending from the opponent allows Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) the chance to get to the edge of the box and he makes no mistake with a lovely finish. It's 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Christian Streich gives a chance to Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) and Aleksandar Ignjovski is off.
Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Deniz Aytekin's book.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Nils Petersen (Freiburg) will replace Jonas Meffert.
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Marc Torrejon (Freiburg) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier. A free kick has been awarded to Freiburg.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Deniz Aytekin ignores the protests.
Substitution. Lukas Rupp makes his way off the pitch and Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) comes on as his replacement.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mike Frantz trots off the pitch and is replaced by Janik Haberer (Freiburg).
Julian Nagelsmann decides to make a substitution. Kerem Demirbay will be replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
GOAL! Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Oliver Baumann, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:1.
Deniz Aytekin blows for a foul after Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg) was too aggressive in the battle for the ball. The referee's verdict is crystal clear. A penalty is awarded to Hoffenheim!
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) sends Alexander Schwolow the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Benjamini Hubner departs the field of play to be replaced by Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim).
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) picks up a yellow card.
Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg) was probably a bit loose with his words to Deniz Aytekin, who decides to show him a yellow.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Emre Mor (Dortmund) finds some space inside the box and latches on to a brilliant cross, but he wastes his chance as his shot goes way wide of the left post.
What a chance that is! Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar.
Patrick Ittrich shows the yellow card to Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge.
Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) connects with a cross and has an effort on goal from the edge of the box, but it ends somewhere in row Z.
Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just over the crossbar.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Patrick Ittrich blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! Vedad Ibisevic displays great vision and sends a pass to Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the right post. The score is 0:1.
A yellow card for a tackle by John Brooks (Hertha Berlin). Patrick Ittrich doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The manager makes a subsitution with Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) coming on for Sebastian Rode.
Thomas Tuchel prepares a substitution. Mario Gotze is replaced by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund).
Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) collects a pass and has an effort from distance to the left side of the goal, but Rune Jarstein answers with a superb save to deny him. Dortmund get a corner.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) has a great chance to score from deep inside the box! He creates some space for the shot, but blazes it high over the crossbar. Very bad attempt.
Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Patrick Ittrich pulls out a yellow card.
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.

Rune Jarstein pulls off a great save to deny Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal. Dortmund force a corner. They send men into the box.

What a huge opportunity! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with a close-range strike towards the roof of the net. The amazing Rune Jarstein deserves an ovation from the fans as he pulls off a spectacular save and pushes the ball onto the bar.
The substitution has been made. Joo-Ho Park (Dortmund) has replaced Marcel Schmelzer.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) handles the ball inside the box. Joy for one side, despair for the other as the referee gives a penalty to Dortmund!
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Rune Jarstein anticipates the direction of the penalty by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund). He attempted to put the ball inside the right post, but the goalkeeper was there in time to deny him.
Substitution.  Allan (Hertha Berlin) on for Per Skjelbred.
It's in the back of the net! Ousmane Dembele sprays a pass out to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:1.
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Vedad Ibisevic will be replaced by Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin).
The foul by Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Patrick Ittrich.
The game is interrupted by the referee. He pulls out a red card and sends Emre Mor (Dortmund) off.
Yellow card! It's like Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Patrick Ittrich agrees and books him.
We have witnessed a sending-off! Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) is given a red card for his dangerous challenge. Patrick Ittrich's decision is final.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexander Esswein departs the field of play to be replaced by Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin).
Patrick Ittrich is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) leaps like a salmon to produce a header from the resulting corner, but one of the defending players intercepts the ball and averts the danger.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Andre Schubert makes a switch. Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) is coming on in place of Jannik Vestergaard at the start of the second period.

Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle for an infringement. No point in arguing there. Schalke will take a penalty kick.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) confidently powers his spot-kick into the left side of the goal.
Goal! Sead Kolasinac puts the ball across the area and Breel Embolo (Schalke) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 2:0.

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Yann Sommer is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Goal! The rebound fell to Leon Goretzka (Schalke) and he fired home from close range. The score is 3:0.
Substitution. Mahmoud Dahoud is replaced by Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Leon Goretzka will be replaced by Franco Di Santo (Schalke).
Andre Schubert has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Fabian Johnson.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Breel Embolo (Schalke), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 4:0.
Maxim Choupo-Moting will be replaced by Abdul Baba Rahman (Schalke).
Here is a change. Breel Embolo is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Max Meyer (Schalke).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.

Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Martin Schmidt is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Fabian Frei suffers an injury and Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) comes on.
It will be a substitution. Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Daniel Caligiuri walks off.
Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) shoots from inside the box after his amazing individual effort. He beats the goalkeeper, but hits one of the defending players and it bounces away.
Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Levin Oztunali will be replaced by Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
The substitution has been made. Bruno Henrique (Wolfsburg) has replaced Jakub Blaszczykowski.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Maximilian Arnold leaves the pitch and Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Yunus Malli and he is replaced by Suat Serdar (Mainz).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

What a save from Roman Burki! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out. The linesman points to the corner flag, Bayer Leverkusen are going to take it.
Hakan Calhanoglu takes the corner and Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) rises highest near the penalty spot to plant a brilliant header into the left side of the goal. The score is 1:0.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Manuel Grafe ignores the protests.
Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) for a heavy challenge.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) uses the wrong choice of words while trying to explain something to the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang passes to Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund), but he produces a wild shot from the edge of the box which goes high over the bar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Lars Bender is replaced by Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen).
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Christian Pulisic comes off for Emre Mor (Dortmund).
The game is over for Gonzalo Castro. Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) comes on for the second half.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) blows a clear opportunity! He needed only to tap the ball in, but narrowly misses the goal.
The foul by Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe.
Substitution. Julian Brandt leaves the pitch and is replaced by Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen).
Thomas Tuchel prepares a substitution. Sebastian Rode is replaced by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund).

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Bernd Leno guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Manuel Grafe didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
It's a goal! Hakan Calhanoglu plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) sends a pass into the penalty area, but the opponent manages to cut it out.

Nice individual effort by Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom left corner, but Roman Burki does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.
A goal, which was scored by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), was disallowed due to offside.
A yellow card for a tackle by Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) for Aranguiz.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
That was close by Rafinha (Bayern Munich)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes by a whisker over the crossbar.
Juan Bernat produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) rises high to head the ball into the middle of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:0.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Daniel Siebert starts the second half.
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to make a change. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) replaces Arjen Robben.
Chance! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Juan Bernat, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the left post.
A cross from the corner kick arrives close to the penalty spot. Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the right post!
Substitution. Konstantin Rausch will be replaced by Simon Zoller (Koln).
Here is a change. Marco Hoger is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Salih Ozcan (1. FC Koln).

Marcel Risse sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Anthony Modeste (Koln) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:1.
A yellow card for a tackle by Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln). Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The main referee, Daniel Siebert, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) sees a yellow card from Daniel Siebert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Substitution. Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) in, Renato Sanches out.
Carlo Ancelotti prepares a substitution. Kingsley Coman is replaced by David Alaba (Bayern Munich).
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) inside the box and he manages to steer it to the middle of the target. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Timo Horn makes a save in the nick of time and maintains the current score.

What a chance that is! Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the left post!
It is time for a substitution. Artjoms Rudnevs (Koln) is on for Yuya Osako.
What a big chance! Simon Zoller (Koln) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) takes a mid-range free kick and his beautiful strike only rattles the right post.
Jochen Drees shows the yellow card to Artem Fedetsky (Darmstadt) for a heavy challenge.
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. Darmstadt are awarded a penalty kick!
Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) sends Jaroslav Drobny the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) replaces Artem Fedetsky.
The foul by Aytac Sulu (Darmstadt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jochen Drees.
A superb shot by Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) after a mid-range free kick! His attempt, however, flies just over the crossbar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Jochen Drees blows his whistle to start the second half.
Alexander Nouri has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) comes on the pitch for Robert Bauer.
Half-time substitution. Izet Hajrovic will not participate anymore and Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) is coming on.

Goal! Theodor Gebre Selassie peels away from his marker to connect with the resulting free kick and heads the ball towards Lamine Ludovic Sane (Werder Bremen), who does brilliantly to nod the ball into the net. He makes it 1:1.

Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the roof of the net, but Daniel Heuer Fernandes was alert and the score remains the same. Werder Bremen have been awarded a corner kick.
Here's the change. Michael Esser leaves the pitch and Daniel Heuer Fernandes (Darmstadt) comes on as a substitute.

Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) gathers a nice lofted pass deep inside the box and attempts to put the ball low into the middle of the goal, but his shot is deflected away by one of the defending players. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Darmstadt.
It's in the back of the net! Ousmane Manneh is the provider as he slips the ball to Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:2.

What a goal! Jerome Gondorf plays it to Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Jaroslav Drobny into the left side of the goal. 2:2.
What a big chance! Roman Bezjak (Darmstadt) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen will have a goal kick.
That will be all from Laszlo Kleinheisler who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Jan Rosenthal (Darmstadt).
The referee signals a substitution. Lukas Frode (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Clemens Fritz.
That's it for today, Jochen Drees has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) receives a precise pass inside the box from Onur Bulut and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the right side of the net. 1:0.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Jesus Vallejo (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.

Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) collects a pass and has an effort from distance to the bottom right corner, but Lukas Hradecky answers with a superb save to deny him. The ball goes out of play. Freiburg are awarded a corner kick.
Yellow card. Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Marco Fritz starts the second half.
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Szabolcs Huszti (Eintracht Frankfurt) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Shani Tarashaj (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes onto the pitch so that Haris Seferovic can be given a rest.
Onur Bulut (Freiburg) goes into the referee's book for dissent.
Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card.
Amir Abrashi (Freiburg) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Florian Niederlechner as he is replaced by Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Substitution. Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Szabolcs Huszti.
Christian Streich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Georg Niedermeier (Freiburg) replacing Mike Frantz.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt) will replace Bastian Oczipka.
Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Marco Fritz had an easy-decision to make.
Problems for Christian Streich as Onur Bulut is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Janik Haberer (Freiburg) replaces him.

A neat pass is well received by Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the right post, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible diving save to block his shot.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Douglas Santos (Hamburger) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Guido Winkmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball towards the roof of the net. Rene Adler shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) wins himself enough space to connect with a cross inside the box, but his fine header goes narrowly over the crossbar!
Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity that was!
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Guido Winkmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
Goal! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Guido Winkmann had an easy-decision to make.
Yellow card. Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.

The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) for a tough tackle.
A substitution has been made. Bobby Wood is replaced by Alen Halilovic (Hamburger).
Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) is penalised after knocking an opponent down. That is a penalty kick for Hertha Berlin.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) is going to take the penalty!

Valentin Stocker will be replaced by  Allan (Hertha Berlin).

It's in the back of the net! Andrej Kramaric is the provider as he slips the ball to Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 0:1.

Marvin Matip (Ingolstadt) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the right post. Oliver Baumann is alert and denies him with a nice save. It will be a corner kick for Ingolstadt.

That was a nice football moment. Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the roof of the net. Orjan Nyland guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! Hoffenheim force a corner. They send men into the box.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot inside the left post. His attempt was beyond the reach of Orjan Nyland, so the score changes to 0:2.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

A precise cross towards the penalty spot was latched onto by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt). He outjumped the defence and produced a decent header which went a whisker wide of the left post.

Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the left post. Orjan Nyland guesses his intentions and denies him with a fine save.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!

Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) touches the ball with his hand inside the box!

The referee blows for the end of today's match.

Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Marwin Hitz stops the ball from going inside the left post.
Goal! Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:0.
Daniel Baier feeds the ball through to Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the top left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:1!
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the bar!
Yellow card. Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.

Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to RB Leipzig.
Marcel Sabitzer feeds the ball through to Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly drills it into the roof of the net! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:1!
It's a yellow card for Gojko Kacar (Augsburg).
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) blows a big chance to score! He slammed the ball from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it went narrowly over the crossbar.

Substitution. Timo Werner will be replaced by Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig).

Marwin Hitz gets a well deserved ovation! Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) produces a decent first-time strike goalwards, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it.
That's it for today, Harm Osmers has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.

Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Welz had an easy-decision to make.

Leon Goretzka (Schalke) dribbled past his opponents before finding himself in a great position to strike. His attempt from just outside of the box went towards the bottom left corner, but it wasn't dangerous and Oliver Baumann made a comfortable save.

Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) takes the free kick from the edge of the box, but Koen Casteels dives superbly to deny him. His shot went towards the left side of the goal. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Werder Bremen.

Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) receives a quality pass and releases a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just wide of the left post! The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one.
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.

Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Michael Esser made a crucial save!
