The foul by Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Zwayer.
The substitution is prepared. Filip Kostic (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Nabil Bahoui.
Douglas Santos (Hamburger) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Zwayer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) receives a yellow card.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Rene Adler makes a great save to stop his effort. Corner kick. Bayern Munich will have an opportunity.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) for a tough tackle.

Bruno Labbadia has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) replacing Albin Ekdal.
Today's referee Felix Zwayer rightly decides to book Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) for his harsh tackle.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Martin Schmidt is forced to make a change. Leon Balogun is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Alexander Hack (Mainz).
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) has tested the patience of referee Gunter Perl and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Gunter Perl didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) reacts quickly in the penalty area and scores with aplomb, giving the goalkeeper no chance!
Stefan Bell (Mainz) wins himself some space inside the box after the corner kick and finishes with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Gunter Perl shows a yellow card to Stefan Bell (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on the pitch for Aleksandar Dragovic.
Substitution. Joel Pohjanpalo will be replaced by Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Admir Mehmedi will be replaced by Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen).

Substitution. Pablo De Blasis walks off the pitch and Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Levin Oztunali and he is replaced by Suat Serdar (Mainz).
What a finish that is! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a brilliant cross and gets his head on the ball to put it low inside the right post. No chance of stopping that.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Nice individual effort by Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a shot to the middle of the goal, but Roman Burki does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the left post.
Sokratis (Dortmund) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends his bullet header just wide of the right post.
Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) takes a shot from the edge of the box, but it's not a big threat for the goalkeeper as his effort is blocked by a defender. Dortmund will take a corner kick.

Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) wins himself enough space to meet the resulting corner and fires the ball at goal, but the keeper does well to stop his effort. The ball goes behind for a corner. Dortmund will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The foul by Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Christian Dingert.
It's in the back of the net! Ousmane Dembele sprays a pass out to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:0.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Christian Dingert blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Alexander Schwolow pulls off a great save to deny Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal. It will be a corner kick for Dortmund.
Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) produces a dangerous low pass into the penalty area, but the defence manage to cut it out.
Goal 2:0! Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
The manager makes a subsitution with Janik Haberer (Freiburg) coming on for Nils Petersen.
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Georg Niedermeier (Freiburg) replaces Manuel Gulde.
Goal - 2:1! Janik Haberer laid the ball off to Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The referee Christian Dingert awards Christian Gunter (Freiburg) a yellow card.
It's time for a substitution. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) comes on in place of Emre Mor.
Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Christian Dingert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Maximilian Philipp.
Sokratis (Dortmund) gets a yellow card. The referee Christian Dingert made the right call.
It is time for a substitution. Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) is on for Mario Gotze.

Onur Bulut (Freiburg) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Roman Burki leaps like a salmon to deny him. The ball is out of play and Freiburg manage to earn a corner.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
A substitution has been made. Ousmane Dembele goes off and Sebastian Rode (Dortmund) comes on.
Goal - 3:1! Gonzalo Castro laid the ball off to Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund), who shot from close range into the right side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
That's it for today, Christian Dingert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt under the bar fails to beat Marwin Hitz, who makes a sensational save.

Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Bayer Leverkusen will take a corner kick.

Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Augsburg.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Dirk Schuster makes a switch. Philipp Max (Augsburg) is coming on in place of Ja-Cheol Koo at the start of the second period.

Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) picked up a yellow card from referee. Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) is obviously not following the Golden Rule: „Treat others as you want to be treated.“ He makes a bad challenge and leaves Jochen Drees with no other option than to blow for a foul.
Substitution. Chicharito makes way for Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen).
Roger Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Hakan Calhanoglu will be replaced by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).
A player from Augsburg commits a rough challenge. Jochen Drees blows for a foul and keeps the game under control. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Bayer Leverkusen!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Jochen Drees didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) is going to take the penalty!
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) misses the penalty as he smashes the ball against the crossbar! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Augsburg.

Jan Moravek (Augsburg) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. His dangerous effort is blocked by Bernd Leno, who makes a glorious save! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
Substitution. Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) has come on for Lars Bender.

Bernd Leno (Bayer Leverkusen) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Augsburg will have a goal kick.
Jan Moravek comes off the pitch to be replaced by Halil Altintop (Augsburg).
Dirk Schuster has decided to make a change. Christoph Janker (Augsburg) replaces Gojko Kacar.

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Marwin Hitz, who pulls off a comfortable save!
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

A header by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) from very close range goes towards the crossbar, but doesn't get past Rune Jarstein, who makes a brilliant save. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Bayern Munich.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the left post.
Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) meets a cross and produces a header towards the right side of the goal, but one of the defending players blocks the effort. Bayern Munich get a corner.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) displays great tekkers inside the box leading to a fantastic goal, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
CHANCE! Thomas Muller finds Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the left post!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Marco Fritz starts the second half.
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) replacing Vedad Ibisevic.
Alexander Esswein comes off the pitch to be replaced by Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin).

Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by Manuel Neuer, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
We are about to witness a substitution. Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) is replacing Jerome Boateng.
Substitution. Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) has come on for Thomas Muller.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 2:0.
Goal! Thiago Alcantara plays it to Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Rune Jarstein. 3:0.
That's the end of the game for Franck Ribery, who is replaced by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) sees a yellow card from Marco Fritz after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Today's match ends for Mitchell Weiser who will be replaced by Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Andre Schubert is forced to make a change. Tobias Strobl is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach).
Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) controls a cross deep inside the box and hits the crossbar!
Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) misses an absolute sitter after connecting with a cross inside the penalty box.

Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Lars Stindl, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:1.
Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig) takes a great touch after receiving a pass inside the box. He immediately unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a decent save!
The foul by Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe.

Naldo (Schalke) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but he sends his header straight at the goalkeeper.

The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Konstantin Rausch (Koln) is coming onto the pitch as Milos Jojic cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
Peter Stoger decides to make a substitution. Yuya Osako will be replaced by Salih Ozcan (1. FC Koln).
Goal! Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) scores after an assist by Salih Ozcan that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:3.
Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.

Jonas Lossl pulls off a great save to deny Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot inside the right post.
Today's referee Wolfgang Stark rightly decides to book Ousmane Manneh (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Wolfgang Stark has ended it.
The whistle blows and Wolfgang Stark starts the second half.
Substitution. Lennart Thy (Werder Bremen) replaces Ousmane Manneh.

Christian Clemens (Mainz) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the roof of the net. Jaroslav Drobny pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Jaroslav Drobny makes a great save to stop his effort.
What a sweet touch by Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Jonas Lossl to hold.

The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) replaces Fabian Frei.
Jhon Cordoba feeds the ball through to Yunus Malli (Mainz), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the left side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:0!
The main referee, Wolfgang Stark, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Gerrit Holtmann showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 1:2.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.

Michael Esser pulls off a great save to deny Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.
Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar.
Alexander Milosevic (Darmstadt) blows a clear opportunity! He needed only to tap the ball in, but narrowly misses the goal.
Frank Willenborg has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Goal - 0:1! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Sebastian Rudy provided an assist for the goal.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch so that Andrej Kramaric can be given a rest.

Michael Esser was forced into action to thwart Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball is out of play and Hoffenheim manage to earn a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Eugen Polanski trots off the pitch and is replaced by Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim).
Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) gets to the rebound and shoots, but the effort is blocked.

Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) was about to celebrate after he was first to the rebound and produced a header from a difficult position inside the box, but Oliver Baumann managed to pull off a magnificent save to stop the ball from ending up inside the bottom right corner.

Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the bottom right corner. Oliver Baumann shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Julian Nagelsmann prepares a substitution. Nadiem Amiri is replaced by Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim).
Laszlo Kleinheisler goes off the pitch and Denys Olijnyk (Darmstadt) comes on.
Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) sees a yellow card from Frank Willenborg after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Eduardo Vargas (Hoffenheim) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Frank Willenborg ignores the protests.
Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Artem Fedetsky.
Goal! Denys Olijnyk (Darmstadt) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.

The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Mike Frantz (Freiburg) is given a yellow card.
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) throws the chance away as he attempts to produce a shot from inside the box. His attempt simply rattles the right post. The goalkeeper can remain calm.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
It will be a substitution. Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger) is ready to enter the pitch as Gian-Luca Waldschmidt walks off.
Christian Streich has decided to substitute Mike Frantz and he is replaced by Georg Niedermeier (Freiburg).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Florian Niederlechner will be replaced by Nils Petersen (Freiburg).

Nicolai Muller will be replaced by Alen Halilovic (Hamburger).
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) replaces Bobby Wood.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Maximilian Philipp leaves the pitch and Janik Haberer (Freiburg) comes on.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Ante Rebic is being substituted because of an injury. Niko Kovac sends Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) on the pitch.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom right corner, but Orjan Nyland was alert and the score remained the same. Eintracht Frankfurt have been awarded a corner kick.

Marco Fabian takes over corner duties and expertly finds David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the right side of the goal. The score is now 0:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle to start the second half.

Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes the resulting free kick from 24 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the right side of the goal, but Orjan Nyland is alert and keeps the ball out. The referee blows his whistle, Eintracht Frankfurt are awarded a corner kick.

Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards the goal. To the amazement of all, it goes inside the right post. He makes it 0:2 with this magnificent strike.

Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the right side of the target, but Lukas Hradecky keeps the ball out.
Mathew Leckie comes off the pitch to be replaced by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt).
Here is a change. Roger is going off and Markus Kauczinski gives the last tactical orders to Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt).
The foul by Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Sascha Stegemann.
Substitution. Mijat Gacinovic is replaced by Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Robert Leipertz (Ingolstadt) for Marvin Matip.
That will be all from Marco Fabian who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Sascha Stegemann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! Marc Bartra plays it to Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Koen Casteels. 0:1.
Roman Burki pulls off a great save to deny Bruno Henrique (Wolfsburg) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Thomas Tuchel is forced to make a change. Marc Bartra is unable to continue due to injury, Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) comes on.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

An amazing individual effort from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the right side of the goal and makes it 0:2. Koen Casteels was helpless.

Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Koen Casteels is alert and denies him with a nice save. Dortmund force their opponents to concede a corner.
A big opportunity missed by Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg). He got on the ball inside the box and thumped a splendid first-time shot on goal, but it went narrowly wide of the right post.
Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Roman Burki guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) sends a direct shot in from the free kick that's in a promising position. The ball sails towards the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.

Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) attempts to turn the rebound in from close range. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save and stops the ball from hitting the net. Great goalkeeping.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg). Paul Seguin plays a fantastic through ball and finds Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 1:2.
It's in the back of the net! Gonzalo Castro sprays a pass out to Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:3.

Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Koen Casteels guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) unleashes a promising shot towards the bottom right corner after his wonderful solo run, but Koen Casteels thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was!

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his shot towards the right post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it.
Leon Goretzka sends over an inswinging corner and Naldo (Schalke) gets his head on the ball, but it goes just wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle to start the second half.
The game is over for Breel Embolo. Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) comes on for the second half.
Problems for Pal Dardai as Vladimir Darida is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) replaces him.
Substitution. Leon Goretzka makes way for Max Meyer (Schalke).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Ralf Fahrmann (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
Goal! Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Peter Pekarik, then sends ball into the top left corner. 1:0.
Goal! Mitchell Weiser sends a precise cross into the box, Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) latches on to it and puts the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:0.
Substitution. Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) replaces Per Skjelbred.
Today's match ends for Benjamin Stambouli who will be replaced by Franco Di Santo (Schalke).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Vedad Ibisevic walks off the pitch to be replaced by Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
The ball was swung into the box by Yunus Malli from the corner kick. He perfectly found the head of Jhon Cordoba (Mainz), who planted a long-range header inside the right post to make the score 0:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Bastian Dankert has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Bastian Dankert ignores the protests.
Jonas Lossl pulls off a great save to deny Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Dirk Schuster has decided to make a change. Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) replaces Ja-Cheol Koo.

Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Jonas Lossl anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the bottom right corner.
CHANCE! Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.
The referee signals a substitution. Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Jhon Cordoba.

What a beautiful moment! Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the bottom right corner. Jonas Lossl just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 1:1.

Daniel Brosinski showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Yunus Malli (Mainz) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header inside the right post. It's 1:2.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) for a tough tackle.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Karim Onisiwo and he is replaced by Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Goal! Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 1:3.
Substitution. Dong-Won Ji makes his way off the pitch and Halil Altintop (Augsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Substitution. Jose Rodriguez (Mainz) in, Jean-Philippe Gbamin out.
Jose Rodriguez (Mainz) receives a red card after his awful challenge. He completely lost his temper and referee Bastian Dankert sends him off the pitch.
Dirk Schuster is forced to make a change. Dominik Kohr is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Gojko Kacar (Augsburg).
Bastian Dankert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the right post. Jaroslav Drobny is alert and denies him with a nice save. The ball is out of play. B. Monchengladbach win a corner kick.
Goal - 1:0! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Fabian Johnson provided an assist for the goal.
Goal - 2:0! Jannik Vestergaard tees up Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) inside the box and he curls the ball into the left side of the net and past Jaroslav Drobny.

Poor challenge! Jaroslav Drobny (Werder Bremen) is penalised for tripping and Tobias Stieler blows his whistle. PENALTY! One of the players from B. Monchengladbach is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) converts the spot kick with a blast into the roof of the net.
A yellow card for a tackle by Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) tries to send the ball in front of the goal, but the opposition's defence averts the threat. B. Monchengladbach force a corner. They send men into the box.

Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) takes a good first touch from a cross and fires a powerful low shot from the edge of the box towards the right post. The goalkeeper, though, is ready and denies him with a brilliant save.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) gets on the end of a long pass that is slotted through the defence and easily sends the ball into the bottom left corner!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Viktor Skripnik probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Clemens Fritz. He is replaced by Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen).
Half-time substitution. Raffael is replaced by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Viktor Skripnik makes a half-time substitution. Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) comes on in place of Fallou Diagne.
What a big chance! Sambou Yatabare (Werder Bremen) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and misses the net well wide of the right post.
Florian Grillitsch (Werder Bremen) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Andre Schubert has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Lars Stindl.

Ulisses Garcia (Werder Bremen) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom right corner. Yann Sommer pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Werder Bremen.
Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and drills a shot to the middle of the goal, but is denied by a reflex save from Yann Sommer.

It's in the back of the net! Serge Gnabry (Werder Bremen) fires a brilliant volley into the roof of the net from the edge of the box, leaving the goalkeeper helpless. Aron Johannsson provided the assist. What a finish! 4:1.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) has a sight of goal and fires from the edge of the box, but his strike rattles the left post!

What is going on? At first it seemed that Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) would get away without any booking, then all of a sudden Tobias Stieler pulls out a red card! Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) must have said something really inappropriate! He is sent off!
The substitution is prepared. Nico Schulz (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Fabian Johnson.
Lamine Sane (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Tobias Stieler after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Viktor Skripnik has decided to substitute Sambou Yatabare and he is replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Mathew Leckie provides Dario Lezcano (Ingolstadt) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
GOAL! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Orjan Nyland, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:1.
Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the bottom left corner, but Manuel Neuer easily deals with the threat.
Patrick Ittrich has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
We are about to witness a substitution. Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) is replacing Kingsley Coman.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) fires in a first-time projectile from about 21 metres. Orjan Nyland stretches but the ball is out of his reach and ends up inside the left post.

What an amazing save by Manuel Neuer! Mathew Leckie (Ingolstadt) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot under the crossbar, but fails. Ingolstadt earn a corner.
Marcel Tisserand (Ingolstadt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Patrick Ittrich ignores the protests.
Substitution. Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Renato Sanches walks off.
Here is a change. Alfredo Morales is going off and Markus Kauczinski gives the last tactical orders to Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt).
What a big chance! Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.

Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Orjan Nyland anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going low into the middle of the target.
Here comes a substitution. Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) is brought on as a substitute for Moritz Hartmann.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) for a tough tackle.
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Patrick Ittrich didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) comes onto the pitch so that Mathew Leckie can be given a rest.
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to substitute Douglas Costa and he is replaced by Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich).
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) unleashes a ferocious shot from just outside the penalty area and the ball goes into the left side of the goal!
Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
That's it for today, Patrick Ittrich has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Goal! Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:0. He was ably assisted there by Ousmane Dembele.

Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) leaps highest in the penalty area to get on the end of a cross from the set piece, and he produces a promising goal-bound header towards the middle of the goal, but Michael Esser pulls off a comfortable save to deny him.
What a chance that is! Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.

Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the roof of the net. Michael Esser pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. Dortmund will take a corner kick.
Benjamin Brand shows the yellow card to Anis Ben-Hatira (Darmstadt) for a heavy challenge.
A yellow card for a tackle by Alexander Milosevic (Darmstadt). Benjamin Brand doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Dortmund earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Anis Ben-Hatira as he is replaced by Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt).
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Immanuel Hohn (Darmstadt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) sees a yellow card from Benjamin Brand after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Norbert Meier has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Roman Bezjak (Darmstadt) comes on the pitch for Mario Vrancic.
Goal! The rebound fell to Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) and he fired home from close range. The score is 2:0.
The foul by Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Benjamin Brand.
Goal! Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:0.
Peter Niemeyer (Darmstadt) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Raphael Guerreiro can be given a rest.
Thomas Tuchel prepares a substitution. Ousmane Dembele is replaced by Emre Mor (Dortmund).
Emre Mor (Dortmund) strikes from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball heads towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper denies him with a fantastic save.
The manager makes a subsitution with Antonio-Mirko Colak (Darmstadt) coming on for Sven Schipplock.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to make a change. Sebastian Rode (Dortmund) replaces Marcel Schmelzer.
Christian Pulisic provides Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Goal! Gonzalo Castro passes the ball to the feet of Sebastian Rode (Dortmund), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 5:0.
Goal! Christian Pulisic puts a cross into the box and finds Emre Mor (Dortmund), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner. He makes it 6:0.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
What a brilliant finish! Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and slams the ball into the top left corner. Unstoppable shot!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) comes onto the pitch for Julian Baumgartlinger.
Here is a change. Admir Mehmedi is going off and Roger Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen).
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
Substitution. Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Mijat Gacinovic walks off.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
Niko Kovac has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Haris Seferovic.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. His effort sails well wide of the left post.
Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) was probably a bit loose with his words to Christian Dingert, who decides to show him a yellow.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Alexander Meier walks off the pitch to be replaced by Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt).
It's in the back of the net! Ante Rebic is the provider as he slips the ball to Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 2:1.
Roger Schmidt prepares a substitution. Tin Jedvaj is replaced by Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen).
Here comes a substitution. Tin Jedvaj is given a rest as he is replaced by Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen).
Christian Dingert blows the whistle, Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) is penalised for a foul. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a penalty!
The whistle blows and Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked for an infringement.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) fails to score from the penalty spot! His effort crashes against the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.

Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Rene Adler guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) has tested the patience of referee Robert Kampka and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Emir Spahic (Hamburger) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Bernardo (RB Leipzig) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the top left corner, but Rene Adler keeps the ball out.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Robert Kampka blows his whistle to start the second half.
Ralph Hasenhuttl makes a half-time substitution. Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) comes on in place of Naby Keita.
Johan Djourou (Hamburger) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Here is a change. Marcel Sabitzer is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig).

Rene Adler (Hamburger) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Robert Kampka blows his whistle for an infringement. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to RB Leipzig.
Rene Adler (Hamburger) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) coolly converts the penalty, sending the ball into the top right corner.
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) is punished with the yellow card.
Here comes a substitution. Aaron Hunt is given a rest as he is replaced by Alen Halilovic (Hamburger).
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) finds some space inside the box to meet a beautiful cross and with a precise low drive puts the ball into the middle of the goal.
Marvin Compper (RB Leipzig) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

Emil Forsberg passes to Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 0:3.
It's time for a substitution. Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) comes on in place of Yussuf Poulsen.
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Bobby Wood is replaced by Michael Gregoritsch (Hamburger).
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) replaces Filip Kostic.
Davie Selke (RB Leipzig) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the bottom right corner of the net.
That's it for today, Robert Kampka has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

Koen Casteels earns applause from the crowd! He dives superbly to deny a dangerous first-time effort from the edge of the six-yard box. Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) was the player who tested the keeper's reflexes. Nice goalkeeping skills. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg).

Oliver Baumann pulls off a great save to deny Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Wasted opportunity. Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) gets to the rebound inside the box and smashes the ball just wide of the right post.

Julian Draxler (Wolfsburg) was very close to scoring a goal after unleashing a first-time effort from inside the six-yard box. The ball was aimed towards the top of the net, but the goalkeeper read it well and pulled off a brilliant save to deflect it onto the crossbar. Wolfsburg get a corner.
Gunter Perl shows the yellow card to Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
Niklas Sule is being substituted because of an injury. Julian Nagelsmann sends Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) on the pitch.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Oliver Baumann makes a difficult save to deny Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg), who attempted to head into the bottom left corner from inside the box.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) is obviously very disappointed with his shot from the rebound. He aims exactly at the goalkeeper's gloves. This should have been an easy goal!
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) replaces Andrej Kramaric.
Substitution. Jakub Blaszczykowski makes his way off the pitch and Bruno Henrique (Wolfsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg) latches on to the corner kick inside the box, but his header crashes against the crossbar! The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
The foul by Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Gunter Perl.
Here comes a substitution. Nadiem Amiri is given a rest as he is replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Daniel Caligiuri and he is replaced by Jannes-Kilian Horn (Wolfsburg).
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the left post.
The game has come to an end for Julian Draxler. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Paul Seguin (Wolfsburg).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Timo Horn pulls off a great save to deny Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Marcel Risse (Koln) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Anthony Modeste (Koln) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header perfectly into the right side of the goal. He makes it 1:0.
Goal! Yuya Osako puts the ball across the area and Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 2:0.
Mike Frantz (Freiburg) is quickest inside the box and leaps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it floats just over the crossbar.
Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) almost scores with a cheeky low shot towards goal that goes under the defensive wall, but Timo Horn is alert and makes a good save. Freiburg have been awarded a corner kick.
Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) has received a yellow card for his foul.
It's a goal! Anthony Modeste (Koln) does well to meet a cross inside the box and strikes a perfect header inside the right post.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Caglar Soyuncu is replaced by Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
Leonardo Bittencourt has picked up an injury and is replaced by Simon Zoller (Koln).
Substitution. Pawel Olkowski (Koln) replaces Yuya Osako.
Christian Streich has decided to substitute Onur Bulut and he is replaced by Janik Haberer (Freiburg).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Georg Niedermeier (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch so that Manuel Gulde can be given a rest.

Timo Horn pulls off a great save to deny Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner. Freiburg have been awarded a corner kick.
That will be all from Anthony Modeste who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Milos Jojic (Koln).
Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) sees a yellow card from Felix Zwayer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) is first to latch onto the rebound near the penalty spot, and he produces a fantastic header which goes inside the left post.

What a wonderful moment! Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) receives a perfect pass in the middle of the pitch, lines up the ball and unloads a powerful strike towards the crossbar. His effort fails to surprise Oliver Baumann, who makes a nice save. The ball is out of play. Mainz win a corner kick.
What an excellent shot, but not the luckiest one. Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) fires the ball from inside the penalty box but it only hits the left post!
Goal! Levin Oztunali provides Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) latches on to an inch-perfect pass and produces a low drive from the edge of the box which goes into the middle of the goal and past the helpless goalkeeper.
Julian Nagelsmann prepares a substitution. Fabian Schar is replaced by Mark Uth (Hoffenheim).
Goal! Andrej Kramaric slips it to Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) on the edge of the box and he finds the left side of the net with a great effort. The score is 3:1.
Goal - 4:1! Pablo De Blasis tees up Levin Oztunali (Mainz) inside the box and he curls the ball into the top right corner and past Oliver Baumann.
The foul by Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Markus Schmidt.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) comes on the pitch for Jeremy Toljan.

It's a foul from Gaetan Bussmann (Mainz). Surprisingly, the referee comes and pulls out a red card. It was a very harsh one and Gaetan Bussmann (Mainz) complains, but it's no use of course. The decision has been made.
Today's referee Markus Schmidt rightly decides to book Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) for his harsh tackle.
The manager is forced to make a substitution due to a red card. Martin Schmidt issues instructions to Daniel Brosinski (Mainz), who will replace Pablo De Blasis.
Golden chance! Jhon Cordoba (Mainz) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
It is time for a substitution. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) is on for Eugen Polanski.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) was probably a bit loose with his words to Markus Schmidt, who decides to show him a yellow.

It's in the back of the net! Andrej Kramaric sends a superb cross into the box. Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header into the roof of the net, leaving Jonas Lossl beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 4:2.

Pirmin Schwegler passes to Mark Uth (Hoffenheim), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 4:3.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Levin Oztunali as he is replaced by Christian Clemens (Mainz).
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) gets to the rebound and from mid-range takes a shot which crashes against the crossbar!
Substitution. Jhon Cordoba makes his way off the pitch and Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) comes on as his replacement.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he sends his effort over the crossbar.
Leon Balogun (Mainz) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Andrej Kramaric, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 4:4.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) for a tough tackle.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Today's referee Daniel Siebert rightly decides to book Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) for his harsh tackle.
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) has tested the patience of referee Daniel Siebert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
CHANCE! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) fires just wide of the right post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Ja-Cheol Koo.
Serge Gnabry sprays a pass out to Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes high over the bar.
Daniel Siebert blows his whistle after Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. The referee gives a penalty to Werder Bremen!
Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) is going to take the penalty!
Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) takes the penalty and perfectly sends the ball inside the left post.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Daniel Siebert blows his whistle to start the second half.
Dirk Schuster makes a half-time substitution. Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) comes on in place of Raul Bobadilla.
1:1. Daniel Baier takes over corner duties and picks out Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg), who puts the ball into the right side of the net from close range.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Felix Wiedwald pulls off a great save to deny Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.
Substitution. Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) replaces Aron Johannsson.
Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) sets the ball for the free kick and fires in a beautiful strike, which nestles exactly in the top right corner.
Substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo leaves the pitch and is replaced by Gojko Kacar (Augsburg).
Viktor Skripnik prepares a substitution. Robert Bauer is replaced by Lennart Thy (Werder Bremen).
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went inches over the bar.
It is time for a substitution. Thanos Petsos (Werder Bremen) is on for Florian Grillitsch.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Daniel Siebert ignores the protests.
We are about to witness a substitution. Christoph Janker (Augsburg) is replacing Daniel Baier.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Roman Burki was forced into action to thwart Timo Werner (RB Leipzig). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and releases a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies painfully close to the right post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund). Wolfgang Stark doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle to start the second half.
Today's referee Wolfgang Stark rightly decides to book Lukas Klostermann (RB Leipzig) for his harsh tackle.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Wolfgang Stark lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Marc Bartra (Dortmund) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Wolfgang Stark didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Marcel Sabitzer walks off the pitch and Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) comes on as a substitute.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Yussuf Poulsen and he is replaced by Oliver Burke (RB Leipzig).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) for Mario Gotze.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) replacing Gonzalo Castro.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) produced a promising shot towards the roof of the net after his wonderful solo run, but Roman Burki thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same. The ball goes out of play. RB Leipzig are awarded a corner kick.

Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the bottom left corner. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save.
What a chance that is! Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar.
The manager makes a subsitution with Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) coming on for Dominik Kaiser.
Thomas Tuchel has decided to make a change. Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) replaces Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
It's a goal! Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the top right corner. The assist goes to Oliver Burke and the score changes to 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Roger Schmidt is forced to make a change. Karim Bellarabi is unable to continue due to injury, Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.

Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) leaps highest in the penalty area to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, and he produces a promising goal-bound header low towards the middle of the goal, but Rene Adler pulls off a comfortable save to deny him.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) latches on to an accurate pass into the box and immediately unleashes a low shot goalwards. His effort is well saved by the keeper.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Kevin Kampl picks out Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen), who drives a shot just wide of the left post from the edge of the box.
GOAL! Bobby Wood (Hamburger) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 0:1.
What a chance that is! Chicharito (Bayer Leverkusen) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the left post!

Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) picked up a yellow card from referee.

Goal! Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) scores after an assist by Julian Brandt that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:1.
The game has come to an end for Bobby Wood. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger).
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
The substitution has been made. Alen Halilovic (Hamburger) has replaced Filip Kostic.
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a change. Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Wendell.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant foul.

Goal Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen)! Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) was put through by Benjamin Henrichs and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom right corner. 2:1.
Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a well-taken defence-splitting pass inside the box and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom left corner.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Guillermo Varela limps off the pitch to be replaced by Jesus Vallejo (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Michael Esser pulls off a great save to deny Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Branimir Hrgota.
Norbert Meier has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Laszlo Kleinheisler (Darmstadt) replacing Roman Bezjak.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Leon Guwara (Darmstadt) for Peter Niemeyer.
Jerome Gondorf (Darmstadt) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Jesus Vallejo (Eintracht Frankfurt) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked.
A substitution has been made. Anis Ben-Hatira is replaced by Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt).

Michael Esser blocks a long-range effort from Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) towards the left side of the goal. The referee points to the corner flag and Eintracht Frankfurt will take a corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes onto the pitch so that Alexander Meier can be given a rest.
Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the top left corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.

Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Yann Sommer makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom left corner.
OFF THE POST! Good play from Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes the left post!
Goal - 0:1! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the top left corner. Ibrahima Traore provided an assist for the goal.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Harm Osmers blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Harm Osmers shows the yellow card to Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) for a heavy challenge.

Goal! Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the top right corner. Yann Sommer had no chance of reaching it. The score is 0:1.

Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Yann Sommer guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Yann Sommer (B. Monchengladbach) brings an opponent down and Harm Osmers interrupts the game. The referee points to the penalty spot. PENALTY to Freiburg!
The foul by Yann Sommer (B. Monchengladbach) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Harm Osmers.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

That's it for today, Harm Osmers has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
What was Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) meets a cross inside the box, but his header is blocked by an opposing player.

Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Manuel Neuer to get hold of the ball.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The end of the first half.

That's the end of the game for Evgen Konoplyanka, who is replaced by Breel Embolo (Schalke).
Crossbar! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) picks up a precise pass and produces a bullet of a strike from distance that smashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal.
Substitution. Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) in, Xabi Alonso out.

Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Manuel Grafe had an easy-decision to make.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Substitution. Renato Sanches walks off the pitch and Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) blew a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross deep inside the box, but his shot flew just over the bar.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich). Javi Martinez plays a fantastic through ball and finds Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the roof of the net. It's now 0:1.
Substitution. Benjamin Stambouli is replaced by Sead Kolasinac (Schalke).
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Manuel Grafe didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

GOAL! Superb work from Robert Lewandowski, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich), who beats Ralf Fahrmann with a brilliant shot into the left side of the net. 0:2.

Oliver Baumann pulls off a great save to deny Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal.

What a huge chance for Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.

Referee Tobias Stieler blows his whistle to start the second half.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch so that Kevin Vogt can be given a rest.
Fabian Schar (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
The yellow card goes to Marvin Compper (RB Leipzig).
The ball from the corner slips through the box to Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) and he slots it into the bottom right corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Diego Demme provides Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Substitution. Marvin Compper did his best and is replaced by Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig).
Julian Nagelsmann decides to make a substitution. Lukas Rupp will be replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).

Sebastian Rudy finds Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) with a sweet pass inside the penalty box, who then smashes the ball inside the left post. What a clinical finish to make it 2:1.

Goal - 2:2! Benno Schmitz laid the ball off to Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Freiburg will have a goal kick.
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Manuel Gulde (Freiburg) for his blatant foul.

Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out of play. Freiburg are awarded a corner kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Benjamin Brand blows his whistle to start the second half.

Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the left post. Alexander Schwolow has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Goal! Vedad Ibisevic tees up Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the right side of the goal. 1:0.

Gooal! Vincenzo Grifo takes over corner duties. Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the right side of the net. 1:1.
Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home low into the middle of the net. The goalkeeper was helpless.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it to the middle of the goal, but Bernd Leno makes a comfortable save to stop his effort.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) picks up the rebound after chaos in the box and directs a sweet strike towards the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper, however, denies him with a stunning save.

Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Bernd Leno pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. B. Monchengladbach force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the bottom right corner, but is thwarted by a great save from Yann Sommer. The ball goes out of play. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) has received a yellow card for his foul.

Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the set piece. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and crashes against the crossbar.

Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Bernd Leno guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a great shot into the bottom right corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Bernd Leno, so the score changes to 0:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Andre Schubert probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Tony Jantschke. He is replaced by Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach).

OFF THE POST! Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) takes the mid-range free kick and sends it towards the roof of the net, but he is denied by the goalkeeper. The referee signals a corner kick to B. Monchengladbach.
Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ibrahima Traore.

Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Brych didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) uses bad language while talking to the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Brych ignores the protests.
Aranguiz just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces him.

GOAL! Superb work from Thorgan Hazard, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach), who beats Bernd Leno with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 2:1.

Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) latched on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and immediately slams the ball towards the top right corner. His effort was thwarted by the alert goalkeeper, who pulled off a stunning save.
