Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Suat Serdar will be replaced by Levin Oztunali (Mainz).
Thomas Tuchel prepares a substitution. Felix Passlack is replaced by Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund).
Substitution. Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) replaces Christian Clemens.
The substitution is prepared. Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Yunus Malli.
Here is a change. Sebastian Rode is going off and Thomas Tuchel gives the last tactical orders to Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund).
One of the Mainz players unfairly tackled his opponent and conceded a foul. That is a penalty kick for Dortmund.
A yellow card is awarded to Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) slams home the penalty with a precise low shot into the bottom right corner.

A perfect lofted pass from Pablo De Blasis finds Yoshinori Muto (Mainz), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header to the middle in the countermovement of the keeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Roman Burki had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
CHANCE! Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a shot towards Ralf Fahrmann, who produces an excellent reflex save.
CHANCE! Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top.

Superb finishing from Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt). Szabolcs Huszti plays a fantastic through ball and finds Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a low shot from close range past the goalkeeper. It's 0:0.
Goal disallowed! Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) scores but Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle for a foul.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Breel Embolo (Schalke) comes on the pitch for Franco Di Santo.
Here comes a substitution. Szabolcs Huszti is given a rest as he is replaced by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Sead Kolasinac is replaced by Abdul Baba Rahman (Schalke).

Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle after Junior Caicara (Schalke) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. It's a penalty! Eintracht Frankfurt have an opportunity to score from the penalty spot.
The foul by Junior Caicara (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Wolfgang Stark.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot low into the middle of the goal. Ralf Fahrmann anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and doesn't have to move to stop the effort.
Substitution. Dennis Aogo will be replaced by Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke).
What an awful challenge. The referee Wolfgang Stark has no other option than to send Michael Hector (Eintracht Frankfurt) off the pitch. Red card!
Here is a change. Branimir Hrgota is going off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical orders to Jesus Vallejo (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Max Meyer (Schalke) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save.
Guillermo Varela (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Wolfgang Stark after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Wolfgang Stark shows the yellow card to Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
Johannes Geis (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Wolfgang Stark ignores the protests.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) will replace Mijat Gacinovic.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

Artjoms Rudnevs (1. FC Koln) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom right corner is blocked by Michael Esser, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Goal! Marcel Risse (Koln) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the left post by a whisker.
Dominic Maroh (Koln) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Anthony Modeste (Koln) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but powers his header just wide of the left post.
What was Artem Fedetsky (Darmstadt) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Yellow card. Fabian Holland (Darmstadt) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
Immanuel Hohn (Darmstadt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The weather is too bad and the match has to be interrupted right now.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Artem Fedetsky leaves the pitch and Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt) comes on.
Artjoms Rudnevs feeds the ball through to Anthony Modeste (Koln), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the right side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:0!
Timo Horn was forced into action to thwart Sandro Sirigu (Darmstadt). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) is booked.
It is time for a substitution. Yuya Osako (Koln) is on for Artjoms Rudnevs.
Norbert Meier has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Florian Jungwirth (Darmstadt) replacing Anis Ben-Hatira.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Simon Zoller (Koln) will replace Leonardo Bittencourt.
Norbert Meier has decided to make a change. Denys Olijnyk (Darmstadt) replaces Laszlo Kleinheisler.
Substitution. Milos Jojic (Koln) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Anthony Modeste walks off.
Simon Zoller (Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Markus Suttner (Ingolstadt) sees a yellow card from Marco Fritz after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. A free kick has been awarded to Hamburger SV.

Pascal Gross (Ingolstadt) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box directed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper is equal to it! The ball is out of play. Ingolstadt win a corner kick.
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.
Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) gets a yellow card.
A yellow card for a tackle by Alfredo Morales (Ingolstadt). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Here comes a substitution. Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Gideon Jung.
Markus Kauczinski has decided to substitute Moritz Hartmann and he is replaced by Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt).
Substitution. Nicolai Muller makes way for Alen Halilovic (Hamburger).
That's the end of the game for Michael Gregoritsch, who is replaced by Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger).
Goal! Lukas Hinterseer (Ingolstadt) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Almog Cohen (Ingolstadt) replaces Alfredo Morales.
The referee shows the yellow card to Johan Djourou (Hamburger).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dario Lezcano trots off the pitch and is replaced by Stefan Lex (Ingolstadt).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the top right corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Felix Wiedwald, so the score changes to 0:0.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Felix Wiedwald leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Fantastic team goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) was set free in the area by Franck Ribery and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the top of the net. 2:0.

Good touch by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) as he latched on to an accurate pass before attempting to threaten the goalkeeper with his long-range shot. Unluckily for him, his attempt only rattles the left post.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.

Great first touch by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) after collecting a pass deep into the box. He smashes the ball to the middle of the net, but the keeper makes a fantastic reflex save and pushes it onto the post. Brilliant goalkeeping!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Christian Dingert has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot inside the left post. Thomas Muller assisted in the goal. 2:0.
A substitution has been made. Aron Johannsson goes off and Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Carlo Ancelotti decides to make a substitution. Xabi Alonso will be replaced by Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich).
Thomas Muller passes the ball into the penalty area. Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) collects it and quickly sends it into the left side of the goal via the post! The goalkeeper was helpless. 2:0!
What a goal! Thomas Muller plays it to Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Felix Wiedwald into the roof of the net. 5:0.
Here comes a substitution. Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Florian Grillitsch.
Carlo Ancelotti prepares a substitution. Philipp Lahm is replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).

Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows for a foul after seeing the whole situation. It's a penalty! Bayern Munich have an opportunity to score from the penalty spot.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the bottom left corner.
Substitution. David Alaba will be replaced by Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich).
Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Fin Bartels goes off the pitch and Lennart Thy (Werder Bremen) comes on.
That's all for today as the game is over.
